jobTitle: Property Consultant Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50532509.txt	§Property Consultant§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Property Consultant§§Advertiser: §WSP§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Real Estate & Property§, §Other§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Property Consultant §    §    §      §WSP is a collaborative team of global experts who aspire every day to shape a better tomorrow.§With more than 49,000 people working in over 550 offices across 40 countries, we are one of the world’s leading engineering consultancy firms.§We value our people, our reputation, and our impact on the future. At WSP our role is to plan, design, manage and engineer our communities to thrive. We want our work to bring long-term improvements and to future proof our cities and environments.§The Role:§We are seeking a Property Consultant to join our growing team in Wellington­­­­­­­­­­ and work on projects of national significance in the North Island and beyond. Be part of a tight-knit, innovative group of specialist property consultants. Take advantage of all that WSP has to offer, whilst enjoying quality, career enhancing work.§You’ll get to be a key contributor to the disposal of land on behalf of the Crown under the provisions of the Public Works Act. You’ll also help provide property consultancy and advice to clients in the Crown, Government Agencies, Local Authority and corporate sectors. This is an excellent opportunity to build upon your experience and progress your career.§Skills and Experience:§·      A degree, or equivalent qualification §·      Up to 5 years’ experience in a property related field §·      Good knowledge of relevant NZ standards, legislation and practises, particularly the Public Work Acts and a general understanding of land law§·      Experience with Crown transactions, specifically the disposal of land§·      Confidence in dealing with a variety of property professionals on a regular basis including surveyors, valuers and accredited agents§·      Be confident in your ability to present ideas, information and advice in a way that is understandable by a range of audiences§How to Apply:§If this sounds like you, we want you to be part of what makes us great. Are you ready to be part of WSP? §For further information, please view the position description. To apply, just follow the link and apply online.§Why do you want to join us?§We’re future-focused experts who propose innovative ideas for our clients. It matters to us that our people come to work every day with curiosity, drive and a sense of purpose. Join us in doing purposeful, sustainable work that helps shape our communities and the future.§Stimulating, open working environments where everyone feels relevant, valued and supported is a catalyst for outstanding achievements in our opinion.§We know that, for everyone here, work is only one part of life, and making time for family, friends, hobbies and passions is vital. So, if working from home, working part-time or having a flexible start and finish to the day will help with this, we will try to make it happen. §Diversity of all kinds is extremely important, and so at WSP we embrace a diversity of perspectives. We welcome applications from individuals of all backgrounds, orientations, and identities.§He aha te mea nui o te ao. He tāngata, he tāngata, he tāngata.§What is the most important thing in the world? It is people, it is people, it is people.§        §§      §      §      §    §    §WSP - Creating what matters for future generations  |  wsp.com/nz§  §§§WSP is a collaborative team of global experts who aspire every day to shape a better tomorrow.§With more than 49,000 people working in over 550 offices across 40 countries, we are one of the world’s leading engineering consultancy firms.§We value our people, our reputation, and our impact on the future. At WSP our role is to plan, design, manage and engineer our communities to thrive. We want our work to bring long-term improvements and to future proof our cities and environments.§The Role:§We are seeking a Property Consultant to join our growing team in Wellington­­­­­­­­­­ and work on projects of national significance in the North Island and beyond. Be part of a tight-knit, innovative group of specialist property consultants. Take advantage of all that WSP has to offer, whilst enjoying quality, career enhancing work.§You’ll get to be a key contributor to the disposal of land on behalf of the Crown under the provisions of the Public Works Act. You’ll also help provide property consultancy and advice to clients in the Crown, Government Agencies, Local Authority and corporate sectors. This is an excellent opportunity to build upon your experience and progress your career.§Skills and Experience:§·      A degree, or equivalent qualification §·      Up to 5 years’ experience in a property related field §·      Good knowledge of relevant NZ standards, legislation and practises, particularly the Public Work Acts and a general understanding of land law§·      Experience with Crown transactions, specifically the disposal of land§·      Confidence in dealing with a variety of property professionals on a regular basis including surveyors, valuers and accredited agents§·      Be confident in your ability to present ideas, information and advice in a way that is understandable by a range of audiences§How to Apply:§If this sounds like you, we want you to be part of what makes us great. Are you ready to be part of WSP? §For further information, please view the position description. To apply, just follow the link and apply online.§Why do you want to join us?§We’re future-focused experts who propose innovative ideas for our clients. It matters to us that our people come to work every day with curiosity, drive and a sense of purpose. Join us in doing purposeful, sustainable work that helps shape our communities and the future.§Stimulating, open working environments where everyone feels relevant, valued and supported is a catalyst for outstanding achievements in our opinion.§We know that, for everyone here, work is only one part of life, and making time for family, friends, hobbies and passions is vital. So, if working from home, working part-time or having a flexible start and finish to the day will help with this, we will try to make it happen. §Diversity of all kinds is extremely important, and so at WSP we embrace a diversity of perspectives. We welcome applications from individuals of all backgrounds, orientations, and identities.§He aha te mea nui o te ao. He tāngata, he tāngata, he tāngata.§What is the most important thing in the world? It is people, it is people, it is people.§§§§

It is important you have excellent communications skills as you will be interacting with both parking personnel and customers. You will also be responsible for ad-hoc administrative tasks for branch operations.§        §You will receive hands on technical training to ensure that our equipment is always running perfectly so you will need to be a 'hands on' person.§        §This role will allow you to prove yourself and give you the opportunity to be noticed in a company that rewards both financially and in career advancement. Previous experience in multi-site operations would be desirable. Knowledge of MS office suite would be a definite advantage; as would a highly positive 'can do' attitude.§        §All applicants must be legally entitled to live and work in New Zealand indefinitely.§        §APPLY TODAY!!§      §      §      §    §  §§§Wilson Parking delivers comprehensive car park management services nationwide. jobText: TXT/50573253.txt	§Site Facilities Manager - Tongariro§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Site Facilities Manager - Tongariro§§Advertiser: §DOWNER NZ§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§15 Sept 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Taupo§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Real Estate & Property§, §Body Corporate & Facilities Management§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Site Facilities Manager - Tongariro §      §        §Downer New Zealand is a leading provider of integrated services.  Our commitment to building long term relationships and supporting our customers with high calibre services and solutions; the talents of our people; and consistent excellence in operational delivery sets us apart. §        §We have entered into a long term Asset Management and Facilities Management Contract with the Department of Corrections and the Ministry of Justice. We are currently seeking a Site Facilities Manager to join our team at the Tongariro Prison.§        §About your role:§        §Our Site Facilities Manager is a critical role within our business with responsibility for leading a large technical team; ensuring on time, quality and, safe jobs delivery, and managing workflows over a 24/7 period. In this role, you will see yourself:§        §          §Driving a strong commitment to Health & Safety;§          §Using a contemporary leadership style to support your team with solid technical solutions;§          §Understanding and managing a KPI Driven environment;§          §Using your financial skills; including cost containment and productivity management§          §Working autonomously and as part of the broader Downer Team§        §        §This is not a job for the faint hearted. Prison environments are demanding and workflows can be unpredictable. You will need to be well organised and be able to multi-task.  You will take ownership of the site and be prepared to manage high priority or complex jobs on weekends and after hours.§        §A bit about you:§        §          §You will be a strong and energetic people leader with well-developed relationship management ability, good commercial acumen, and current facilities management experience and will bring with you; Management qualification and/or demonstrated management skills and experience;§          §Minimum 7 years’ current experience within the facilities management industry;§          §Demonstrated experience in managing a 24/7 critical function facility (prison, hospital, emergency complex);§          §Strong analytical and numeric skills and demonstrated commercial acumen;§          §Experience in driving operational activities to ensure quality is achieved, work is completed to schedule and, rework is minimised;§          §Strong oral and written communication skills;§          §Ownership, commitment and an ability to meet deadlines;§          §Current working knowledge of the Health and Safety at Work Act 2015;§          §Working knowledge of building compliance and regulatory requirements;§          §Intermediate level of computer literacy including MS Outlook, Word, and, Excel.§        §        §A role with us can enables you to develop and enhance your skills and experience.  This is a great opportunity for you to join our diverse and inclusive culture and be part of a great team thriving in a collaborative fast-paced environment.  We will reward you with great training and ongoing development, and the opportunity to advance your career within our organisation. §        §If this sounds like the opportunity for you, head to §www.downercareers.co.nz§ and enter reference number 572023 to apply. §    §        §Downer NZ is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a diverse and inclusive culture.§ §        §Our workplaces are drug and alcohol free - all successful applicants will be required to undertake a pre-employment drug test and medical. § §      §      §      §    §    §www.downer.co.nz§  §§§Downer New Zealand is a leading provider of integrated services.  Our commitment to building long term relationships and supporting our customers with high calibre services and solutions; the talents of our people; and consistent excellence in operational delivery sets us apart. §We have entered into a long term Asset Management and Facilities Management Contract with the Department of Corrections and the Ministry of Justice. We are currently seeking a Site Facilities Manager to join our team at the Tongariro Prison.§About your role:§Our Site Facilities Manager is a critical role within our business with responsibility for leading a large technical team; ensuring on time, quality and, safe jobs delivery, and managing workflows over a 24/7 period. In this role, you will see yourself:§§Driving a strong commitment to Health & Safety;§Using a contemporary leadership style to support your team with solid technical solutions;§Understanding and managing a KPI Driven environment;§Using your financial skills; including cost containment and productivity management§Working autonomously and as part of the broader Downer Team§§This is not a job for the faint hearted. Prison environments are demanding and workflows can be unpredictable. You will need to be well organised and be able to multi-task.  You will take ownership of the site and be prepared to manage high priority or complex jobs on weekends and after hours.§§A bit about you:§§You will be a strong and energetic people leader with well-developed relationship management ability, good commercial acumen, and current facilities management experience and will bring with you; Management qualification and/or demonstrated management skills and experience;§Minimum 7 years’ current experience within the facilities management industry;§Demonstrated experience in managing a 24/7 critical function facility (prison, hospital, emergency complex);§Strong analytical and numeric skills and demonstrated commercial acumen;§Experience in driving operational activities to ensure quality is achieved, work is completed to schedule and, rework is minimised;§Strong oral and written communication skills;§Ownership, commitment and an ability to meet deadlines;§Current working knowledge of the Health and Safety at Work Act 2015;§Working knowledge of building compliance and regulatory requirements;§Intermediate level of computer literacy including MS Outlook, Word, and, Excel.§§A role with us can enables you to develop and enhance your skills and experience.  This is a great opportunity for you to join our diverse and inclusive culture and be part of a great team thriving in a collaborative fast-paced environment.  We will reward you with great training and ongoing development, and the opportunity to advance your career within our organisation. §If this sounds like the opportunity for you, head to §www.downercareers.co.nz§ and enter reference number 572023 to apply. §    §Downer NZ is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a diverse and inclusive culture.§ §§Our workplaces are drug and alcohol free - all successful applicants will be required to undertake a pre-employment drug test and medical. § §§§§

jobTitle: FM Contracts Coordinator Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50575821.txt	§FM Contracts Coordinator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§FM Contracts Coordinator§§Advertiser: §DOWNER NZ§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§16 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Manukau & East Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Real Estate & Property§, §Administration§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §FM Contracts Coordinator §      §        §Downer New Zealand has a proud history that can be traced back to 1870, and today we are NZ’s leading provider of integrated services.  Our commitment is building long-term relationships and supporting our customers with high calibre services and solutions.  The key to our success is our people who, on a day-to-day basis, they stand and deliver the company's core values of Excellence, Courage, Collaboration & Integrity across a diverse landscape of markets. We are proud of what we do, and that we support the well-being of the communities we work, live and play in§.§ §        §About the role:§        §We currently have an opportunity for an experienced Property/Facilities Management (FM) Administrator who is looking for the next step in their career to join our National Property team based in our Wiri offices.   §        §You will have some understanding commercial property management but importantly you will have strong administration and accounting skills, enjoy project work and have excellent written and verbal communication skills. You will be a team player, have high levels of attention to detail and most of all enjoy being busy! Administration responsibilities include:§        §          §Ensure invoices are processed accurately and paid in a timely manner§          §Work with the Property Team to ensure the accuracy and completeness of the leases database§          §Ensure compliance with internal/external policies and procedures§          §Develop relationships with depot coordinators so they know you are their first point of contact for any questions regarding leasing or facilities services§          §Work with our national call centre to ensure they are sending the right subcontractors to any job§          §Provide support to the National Property Manager and National Finance team§          §Reviewing and preparing documents and correspondence§          §Collaborating with other teams (internal and external) to ensure the smooth day to day property operations and development§        §        §What we offer:§ §        §This is an outstanding opportunity to work in our diverse business. The environment is challenging and rewarding. We offer the opportunity to join our diverse and inclusive culture, and be part of a great team working in a collaborative environment. We offer a competitive remuneration package, flexible working arrangements, and our focus for our people is training and development, so this gives excellent opportunities to enhance your skills and advance your career.   §        §If this sounds like the opportunity for you, head to §www.downercareers.co.nz§ and enter reference number 573351 to apply. §   §        §Downer NZ is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a diverse and inclusive culture. §        §Our workplaces are drug and alcohol free - all successful applicants will be required to undertake a Pre-Employment drug test and medical.  §        §Due to the fast-paced nature of Downer, our vacancy close dates may be subject to change, so don't delay and make sure you apply as soon as possible.§ §        §Please note we have an in-house recruitment team that manage all our vacancies. No candidates presented through an agency will be considered for any of our roles advertised, unless previously arranged. We would strongly encourage all candidates interested in these roles, to apply directly online through the portal provided otherwise your application will not be considered.§      §      §      §    §    §www.downer.co.nz§  §§§Downer New Zealand has a proud history that can be traced back to 1870, and today we are NZ’s leading provider of integrated services.  Our commitment is building long-term relationships and supporting our customers with high calibre services and solutions.  The key to our success is our people who, on a day-to-day basis, they stand and deliver the company's core values of Excellence, Courage, Collaboration & Integrity across a diverse landscape of markets. We are proud of what we do, and that we support the well-being of the communities we work, live and play in§.§ §About the role:§We currently have an opportunity for an experienced Property/Facilities Management (FM) Administrator who is looking for the next step in their career to join our National Property team based in our Wiri offices.   §You will have some understanding commercial property management but importantly you will have strong administration and accounting skills, enjoy project work and have excellent written and verbal communication skills. You will be a team player, have high levels of attention to detail and most of all enjoy being busy! Administration responsibilities include:§§Ensure invoices are processed accurately and paid in a timely manner§Work with the Property Team to ensure the accuracy and completeness of the leases database§Ensure compliance with internal/external policies and procedures§Develop relationships with depot coordinators so they know you are their first point of contact for any questions regarding leasing or facilities services§Work with our national call centre to ensure they are sending the right subcontractors to any job§Provide support to the National Property Manager and National Finance team§Reviewing and preparing documents and correspondence§Collaborating with other teams (internal and external) to ensure the smooth day to day property operations and development§§What we offer:§ §This is an outstanding opportunity to work in our diverse business. The environment is challenging and rewarding. We offer the opportunity to join our diverse and inclusive culture, and be part of a great team working in a collaborative environment. We offer a competitive remuneration package, flexible working arrangements, and our focus for our people is training and development, so this gives excellent opportunities to enhance your skills and advance your career.   §If this sounds like the opportunity for you, head to §www.downercareers.co.nz§ and enter reference number 573351 to apply. §   §Downer NZ is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a diverse and inclusive culture. §Our workplaces are drug and alcohol free - all successful applicants will be required to undertake a Pre-Employment drug test and medical.  §Due to the fast-paced nature of Downer, our vacancy close dates may be subject to change, so don't delay and make sure you apply as soon as possible.§ §Please note we have an in-house recruitment team that manage all our vacancies. No candidates presented through an agency will be considered for any of our roles advertised, unless previously arranged. We would strongly encourage all candidates interested in these roles, to apply directly online through the portal provided otherwise your application will not be considered.§§§§

Having led the Barfoot & Thompson training department for several years I have also been fortunate to train, coach and mentor some of Auckland's top salespeople and helped them to find the same success you are looking for.§Barfoot & Thompson is the market leader, listing and selling approximately 1 in 3 properties across Auckland. We have the #1 market share which creates more opportunities for you to gain success. Barfoot & Thompson is a family owned and operated company with strong values, diversity and a formidable reputation.§At the Mission Bay branch we are a high performing, results focussed team that believe in respect, professionalism and supporting our colleagues. I am looking for 2 salespeople to join our dynamic team selling all across Auckland. §We offer industry leading benefits and rewards:§Uncapped commission earning potential§Industry leading training and coaching with your own mentor§Managers that don't sell (support role - not competitor)§Open access to all our property listings company-wide giving you a head start in the industry§Marketing support to launch your career §Latest technology to allow you to become successful faster§The ability to list and sell property anywhere in Auckland§The best sea views in Auckland from our office§If you would like to take your career and income to the next level or start fresh in this amazing industry with the support you need to succeed then why not apply now?§Contact Teresa Weiss, Branch Manager, Mission Bay §tweiss@barfoot.co.nz§ or M: §0272868439§ §Barfoot & Thompson has been voted the best Real Estate company in the world - So why work for anything less than #1?§§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How would you rate your English language skills?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§Have you completed a New Zealand Certificate in Real Estate Level 4 or are you in the process of obtaining? (Please Answer: YES or NO)§Why are you the ideal candidate for this position?§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50576776.txt	§Facilities Assistant§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Facilities Assistant§§Advertiser: §JNJ Management Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§16 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Real Estate & Property§, §Body Corporate & Facilities Management§§§§§§About the business§ § § §JNJ Management Limited owns and operates a retail and entertainment building complex in Auckland CBD. We are looking for a dedicated Facilities Assistant to join our team and be part of an exciting period of growth for the company.§ § § §About the role§ § § §The Facilities Assistant will be responsible for the day-to-day maintenance and operation of the premises. This position which requires the candidate to be able to communicate effectively with all levels of management and stakeholders daily. The Facilities Assistant must be flexible in their approach and be willing to adapt to meet the ever-changing needs of the business.§ §The role will involve§ §Assist to check all firefighting equipment, alarm system and emergency lighting§Direct persons and contractors to places where they are required to work§Support regular visual inspections of all premises and equipment located within the building and the grounds of the property§Carry out regular visual inspections of fire routes and fire doors to ensure that they are unhindered. Problems must be reported to the Facilities Manager and sufficient action taken to resolve the problem to reduce the potential for danger§Support Planned Preventative Maintenance works to ensure that continued problem free operation of equipment and facilities within the building. All defects should be reported to the Facilities Manager§Carry out Reactive Maintenance works on Electrical, Mechanical and Civil Systems as instructed by the Facilities Manager§Ensure that Housekeeping standards are maintained within the building and to carry out monthly removal of all unused materials§Responsible for the execution of minor project works within the building. This should include items such as hanging pictures, putting up shelves, furniture repair etc§Carry out decoration works within the building to ensure the up keep of the building§Assist with the day-to-day management of contractors working within the building§Assist the Facilities Manager in ensuring that the building is maintained in line with all Health and Safety guidelines and legislation§Ensure that all sub-contractors employed to carry out specialist tasks are working safely§Liaison job assigned by management§ § § §Skills and experience§ § § §Ideal skills & experience§ §To be successful in this role, you will be able to demonstrate the following skills and experience:§ §Knowledge in A/C (priority), electricity, and fire control§Honesty, diligent and trustworthy§Work under the pressure§Good problem solving§ §If this sounds like you, please submit your CV and cover letter now!§ §Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ open work visa.§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Which of the following Microsoft Office products are you experienced with?§Do you have experience in a role which requires relationship management experience?§How many years' experience do you have in the real estate industry?§Do you have native or bilingual proficiency in any languages other than English?§§§

The position therefore requires the individual to plan, organise, and prioritise their work in order to meet strict deadlines and provide timely and accurate information to all stakeholders.§        §Please note this is a fixed term contract for 9 months and the role is based on site within a dedicated FM building within the Auckland South Corrections Facility located in Wiri. §        §Our ideal candidate will bring to the role:§        §          §Previous experience with property, facilities and/or asset management role§          §Good knowledge of computerised works management systems (WMS, DES SAP, Maximo etc. advantageous)§          §Good Microsoft Office skills and a basic level understanding of accounting§          §Excellent oral & written communication and interpersonal skills§          §Proven ability to establish and maintain an effective customer relationship§          §Strong and accurate administration and data entry experience§          §Management of contractor work outcomes and subcontractor management§          §Good knowledge of handling Asset/Equipment related information§          §NZ Building Compliance beneficial§          §Commitment to workplace health and safety (WHS management)§        §        §What we offer:§        §This is an outstanding opportunity to work in our diverse business.  The environment is challenging and rewarding.  We offer the opportunity to join our diverse and inclusive culture, and be part of a great team working in a collaborative environment.  We offer a competitive remuneration package, flexible working arrangements, and our focus for our people is training and development, so this gives excellent opportunities to enhance your skills and advance your career.  §        §If this sounds like the opportunity for you, head to the Spotless Careers page and enter reference number 573891 to apply.     §        §Spotless Facilities Services (NZ) is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a diverse and inclusive culture. §        §Due to the fast-paced nature of Spotless, our vacancy close dates may be subject to change, so don't delay and make sure you apply as soon as possible. §        §Please note:§ As a pre-requisite for these roles, candidates will be required to undertake a pre-employment medical and drug screen, police clearance and security check. §      §      §      §    §    §www.downer.co.nz§  §§§Spotless Facility Services (NZ) Limited is respected as a leading provider of comprehensive facilities management and asset maintenance services that focus jobText: TXT/50584697.txt	§Experienced Real Estate Administrator Wanted§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Experienced Real Estate Administrator Wanted§§Advertiser: §Bayleys in the North§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§17 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Rodney & North Shore§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Real Estate & Property§, §Administration§§§§§§Bayleys Rodney North are seeking an admin superstar. This role is based in our central Warkworth office and will appeal to an experienced real estate administrator who has exceptional organisational ability and strong people skills, able to work closely with multiple sales agents. § §Working alongside the Admin Team Leader, this position plays a critical role in the day-to-day running of a busy and successful team, where great communication skills, attention to detail, the ability to multi-task and an energetic and pro-active approach are crucial. You will have achieved mastery of the real estate administration process and have advanced Word, PowerPoint and Excel skills. Experience with PropertySuite would be an advantage. § §Not for the faint-hearted as it will be busy, but we promise you'll never get bored and we'll have some fun along the way. § §If you’re looking for a role where you can make a difference but want to work close to home and for only 20-25 hours a week, we would love to hear from you. A job description is available upon request and applications close Thursday, 24 September.§ §Applicants for this position must have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.§ §Please email your CV and covering letter to §diana.winks@bayleys.co.nz§. §§§§

jobText: TXT/50587241.txt	§Project Sales Consultant§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Project Sales Consultant§§Advertiser: §Colliers International§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§17 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Real Estate & Property§, §Residential Sales§§§§§§Company Description§ §Colliers International is a global property services company and best employer operating across 68 countries. We have a workforce of more than 17,000 professionals who think differently, share great ideas and provide service excellence to their clients. § §Colliers have been involved in some of Auckland’s most successful developments – Alexandra Park Epsom, Fabric Onehunga, Boatshed Bay Snells Beach, OKLA Albany, Fraser Avenue Northcote, Kotuitui Manukau – all first-class residential developments marketed and sold by our leading Residential Projects team.§ §We have new and exciting affordable residential projects, well-designed and aimed at the most active part of Auckland’s residential market; these new projects will be in market over the coming months.§ § §Job Description§ §Do you love real estate, enjoy architectural design and want to work with some of Auckland’s leading residential developers?§ §You may be starting your journey in residential sales and struggling to obtain listings or may be an experienced salesperson looking to try something different. Either way this opportunity is not one to be missed.§ §Our cutting-edge marketing programmes direct traffic to on-site sales display suites and straight to your phone, making your role a relatively simple one – listen to what prospective owners want and guide them through the different product offerings within the developments until they have enough information to be confident in purchasing their brand new home. How exciting!§ §Qualifications§ §We are looking for qualified salespeople that have a high level of customer service, proactive and effective electronic and personal communication skills, professional presentation and genuinely enjoy selling real estate. Your relationship management skills will be second to none, you will love working with prospects and purchasers, a team environment and be a results-driven professional.§ §You will be skilled at developing relationships to identify and connect with prospective purchasers from all backgrounds from initial enquiry stage right through to a successful sale, whilst collaborating with the wider Colliers network to maximise referral opportunities.§ §Additional Information§ §Our current projects are aimed at the most active part of the residential market and we have a culture of excellence and collaboration that provides our people with the ideal platform to develop their skills and accelerate their careers.  For you, this means a world of opportunity and the platform to learn, grow and succeed.§§§§

The position is also responsible for the further development of the Company’s business in New Zealand.§                    §Duties include:§                    §                      § Prepare on a timely basis all necessary reports for review and approval by the Project Control Group (PCG) including but not limited to the Project Annual Plan, Project Programme and Cashflow Forecasts.§                      §Deliver the Project Plan in accordance with the timelines and costs of the approved budgets.§                      §Maintaining effective lines of communication with all internal and external stakeholders including but not limited to NZ Government Relations, Builders, Consultants and Statutory Authorities.§                      § Further develop the Company’s business in New Zealand.§                      §Work with our internal teams, based in New Zealand and Australia, to ensure the success of the project. §                    §                    §Skills & experience§                    §You will have extensive experience in the delivery of large scale master planned projects for the residential housing market, whilst experience in delivering projects using urban housing design and environmental principles would be highly desirable.§                    §Tertiary qualification in town planning, engineering, surveying/land economics or similar discipline related to the residential developments industry would be highly regarded. §                    §Significant and demonstrable communication skills, and have proven ability to lead and motivate a team is required.§                      § Applications close 5pm, Wednesday, 30 September 2020.§                    §                    §About AVJennings§                    §AVJennings has been part of the Australian landscape with experience in home building, land development, pre-planned integrated housing and medium density activities.§                    §Everyone wants to feel like they belong. jobText: TXT/50595656.txt	§Real Estate Salespeople§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Real Estate Salespeople§§Advertiser: §REAP Recruitment§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§18 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Rodney & North Shore§§Salary§§Harveys Warkworth§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Real Estate & Property§, §Residential Sales§§§§§§§§§  §    §      §Real Estate Salespeople §    §    §      §Throughout New Zealand, Harveys are known for great service, top auction marketing and open honest communication.  Amanda, Greg and the rest of the team at §Harvey’s Warkworth§ are a leading example of this and they currently have a fabulous opportunity for §Existing & New Real Estate Salespeople§ to join them.§  § §Harvey’s Warkworth§ is a privately-owned Real Estate company that operates to the highest professional standards.  They believe their people (as real estate professionals) are all committed to ongoing education and development and ensure that they continue to grow and achieve great results for their customers.§  § §Harvey’s Warkworth§ have positioned themselves as being among the most cost-effective marketing, sales and property management office in the region. With a strong focus on the local community, they are committed to ensuring that these high standards are maintained and all those they work with benefit.§  § As business owners, Greg & Amanda have years of industry experience and knowledge that is waiting to be passed on.  With extensive knowledge of the local market, a recent “Brand Refresh” (that is now seeing great results) real pride in their team along with the support and dedication that they offer, this is an office where you need to be.  Along with the hands-on support you’ll receive from Amanda & Greg, you will also have the support of their unique training systems and a very successful international office network.   §        §          §All levels of Real Estate Sales experience required§          §Outstanding opportunity to develop your Real Estate career§        § Whether you're an experienced Real Estate Salesperson or looking to take the first step towards a successful, rewarding career in the industry, you need to be talking with §Harveys Warkworth§. jobText: TXT/50596591.txt	§Property Manager Experienced or Trainee @ LJ Hooker Timaru§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Property Manager Experienced or Trainee @ LJ Hooker Timaru§§Advertiser: §Enting Real Estate Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§19 Sept 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Timaru & South Canterbury§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Real Estate & Property§, §Residential Leasing & Property Management§§§§§§WHY JOINING LJ HOOKER IN TIMARU IS YOUR DREAM COME TRUE?§ §Join Timaru’s most experienced Property Management team as a Property Manager§ §If you are serious about your career and are looking for a role that will give you variety, is administrative but with plenty of contact with the public, this could be your dream job. We are growing the Property Management function within our business and are looking for serious local professionals to bring their organisational prowess to the real estate industry.§ §No experience necessary as we know how to grow real estate careers and will fund all of your industry training including full certification with the §Real Estate Institute§ of §New Zealand§ (REINZ).§ §We also welcome applications from experienced Property Managers or real estate administrative staff wanting to step up to Property Management.§ § § §Where Are You Now?§ § §Same place you’ve been for years - trying to get a break?§ §Tired of retail or hospitality but still enjoying the customer contact?§ §Looking for a long-term career with more substance that uses your full capacity and is at the forefront of business technology?§ §Wanting to feel like you are contributing to your community, like your efforts to help will be remembered for more than a few minutes?§ § § §WHY JOIN US?§ §OUR OFFICE§ – §International identity – local strength§ §Owned and managed by Principal, Murray Groundwater since purchasing Enting Real Estate Ltd and rebranding to LJ Hooker Timaru in 2003. Joined by his wife Lesley Groundwater to offer Property Management services in 2005.§ §Building on the LJ Hooker platforms we have taken our marketing, systems and technology leadership to another level.  This includes continuous upgrades of our website and a strong social media presence.§ § § §Stability and Innovation§ §Over this time technology has bought huge changes to the real estate industry. Everything has gone on-line, happens in real-time and is fully transparent to both landlords and tenants.  Building on the LJ Hooker platforms we have taken our marketing, systems and technology leadership to another level.  This includes continuous upgrades of our website and a strong social media presence.§ § We continue to evolve and perfect our systems to meet consumers expectations as well as to reduce systems complexity for staff. It's a fine balance of improvement and stability to ensure we provide exceptional service in a sustainable and rewarding workplace. § §Our commitment to innovation includes the careful selection of staff to join our team using an international system called Sales Inventory Profile (SIP) which identifies if you have the inherent ability to work in Real Estates even if you have no prior experience. We won't let you give up your current role just to 'have a go'. If we offer you a role it will be because we can see you have the right ingredients needed to succeed and we will back our decision with extensive training and on-going support.§ § § §Supportive friendly Team.§ §Our Principal Murray Groundwater has created a genuine team structure by supporting every new member as if they are family. Providing training, resources and patient oversight to allow each one to develop at their own speed and to their fullest potential. Like other families, we can jostle internally but we always pull together when it counts.§ §There is real cooperation across the entire team regardless of the seniority or role to ensure that all members are as successful as possible. We share the common goal of building a great business and each person's success is important to us as a whole.§ § § §Full training § §You will work initially under Lesley’s guidance to introduce you to every aspect of your job and oversee your work until you feel confident to take full responsibility. Our Property Management team also work as a team across many issues so that we can support each other during peak times and cover for holidays and absences. This means that you will never work alone or be left to guess at how to approach tasks.§ §To learn our systems and software we have access to specialist online training material as well as regularly bringing in trainers or sending you to local providers. If you are new to our industry, we can also support you through the §Real Estate Institute§ of §New Zealand§ (REINZ) program to attain a full real estate certification.§ § § §Real Estate skills are global§.§ §Property Management is an Account Management style of selling, a valued skill in many industries. Success comes from being comfortable working with well-defined processes and systems in a timely and planned manner while still having plenty of client contact and the satisfaction of helping people. Unlike the sales agents, there are no prospecting or sales targets just a focus on providing quality service.  § § § §Contributing to our community§ §When we succeed we celebrate together and with our community by regularly participating in local events, sponsoring numerous organisations and giving to charities of all types§ § § §WHAT ARE WE LOOKING FOR IN YOU? § § §You are at a stage in your life where are ready to put in the work to establish a long-term career§ §You live in the greater Timaru area,§ §You have an unblemished drivers licence§ §So, if you would like to talk to us about your future please follow the instructions below.§ §TO PRIORITISE YOUR APPLICATION§ §GO TO; www.salesinventoryprofile.com§ §At the bottom left of the home page go to the box labelled '1. Candidates - Job Seekers' and click on 'Start Now'. § §On the Registration Page carefully ENTER not paste the§ PRK §code:     § §re-845a-ljti-000§ §Follow the on-screen prompts and complete the questionnaire. Once you have completed the questionnaire please click on the §Upload Résumé§ button to load both a résumé and cover letter. Please save your documents in .pdf format so we can view them from any device.§ §WHAT TO INCLUDE IN A COVER LETTER§: tell us a bit about your plans for your career and what attracts you to our industry and us. Your Résumé will tell us what you have done, SIP will show us what you can do in terms of account management and the cover letter is your chance to tell us about your passions and what you want for your future.§ §Thank you for applying for our role. We will be in touch.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§§§

jobText: TXT/50599565.txt	§Building/Facilities Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Building/Facilities Manager§§Advertiser: §Alive Building Solutions§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Salary§§$50,000 - $69,999§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Real Estate & Property§, §Body Corporate & Facilities Management§§§§§§FULL TIME POSITION AVAILABLE:§Note this has been re-advertised due to the confusion over the live in nature of the position.§Building Manager§A small expanding building management company requires an enthusiast practical person to join the team.  We provide facilities management services to the bodies corporate of apartment buildings (essentially managing the common areas of residential apartment complexes). This position requires the successful applicant to live in an apartment within a residential apartment building (the apartment is a 2 bedroom + study). §The successful applicant will be able to think logically and be able to carry out a range of tasks independently. While it is helpful to have some experience in building or property management it is also important that you can demonstrate honesty, reliability, and be motivated to work. Experience is preferable but not essential for this role as in-house training will be provided if you are the right person for the job.§Solving day-to-day problems and gaining the trust and cooperation of the residents is key, along with overseeing the ongoing maintenance and cleanliness of the common areas of the buildings to ensure they are being carried out to a high standard.§The role will involve a mix of working independently and as part of an experienced, supportive team, in a flexible and busy environment.§You must be able to work full-time hours Monday to Friday, with some after-hours required.§Note : This is not a residential property managers position.§The following would be helpful :§ Property , facilities, or project management skills.§Management of contractors.§Proficient with computers inc e.g. MS word, MS outlook, MS excel, along with Google, Dropbox.§A high level of verbal and written communication and reporting skills.§Be comfortable presenting building management reports to the Body Corporates and Committees.§Outstanding multi-tasking and organisational skills.§A knowledge of building act and compliance functions (Building Warrant of Fitness).§An understanding of Health and Safety in the workplace.§Accuracy, attention to detail and a 'can-do' attitude.§Ability to work well under pressure.§Time management skills are crucial.§A team player within the organisation.§Well presented.§A proven track record.§A current clean NZ Drivers Licence.§Applicants may be subject to a Police background check.§Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work permit.§Please upload your resume in pdf format. Please note that only shortlisted candidates will be responded to.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50605717.txt	§Property and Facilities Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Property and Facilities Manager§§Advertiser: §Madison Recruitment Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Real Estate & Property§, §Commercial Sales, Leasing & Property Mgmt§§§§§§Spanning 40 years in the NZ property market, this family owned business is on a trajectory of continued growth.§ As they continue to add to their already sizeable portfolio of Industrial properties in the Auckland region, they’re also growing their team with a spot now open for a Property and Facilities Manager to take full ownership of the portfolio.§ §Your new role:§ Whether you’re a seasoned Facilities or Property Manager, an up and coming property superstar waiting to get noticed or perhaps you’ve done your time in property valuations and looking to round out your experience with a change to portfolio management, this is an opportunity to work alongside some of the best in the business! You’ll enjoy full ownership of a small industrial portfolio comprising many long-term tenancies built on strong landlord/tenant relationships that will be passed over to you to continue. Tasked with the usual day to day responsibilities that come with property and facilities management, no two days will be the same. Expect complete autonomy after an initial period of training and with KPI’s in place to keep you on track for success. Earn your stripes through hard work, commitment, and outstanding results; and opportunities to assist with property acquisitions will come your way over time.§ §About you:§§Minimum 2 years’ experience in the property sector§Experience managing contractors and trade staff§Exceptional communicator, natural relationship builder and self confidence§Go-getter with initiative, drive, self-motivation, and enthusiasm§Commercially savvy with a strategic mindset§What's on offer?§ If you're looking for a varied role where you'll be out and about and not tied to the office, this role is sure to tick the box. Joining this small, high achieving team, you can look forward to a generous salary plus all the tools of the trade. Based between a smart Parnell office and the Industrial Estate office in Onehunga, you’ll have a dedicated carpark and fuel card, but above all, an opportunity that we don’t see too often!§ Hit the apply button now. Upload your CV and cover letter outlining why you this is the role for you.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50613349.txt	§Facilities Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Facilities Manager§§Advertiser: §Industrious Property§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§22 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Real Estate & Property§, §Commercial Sales, Leasing & Property Mgmt§§§§§§Industrious Property is looking for a proactive and experienced Facilities Manager to join the fastest growing management company in Wellington! Our pipeline and upcoming scope of work is quickly expanding, and we need a Facilities pro to come on board, ready to dive in and help us achieve our goals. § § §The Role:§ §You'll be responsible for the day-to-day management of several key properties in our expansive portfolio, working to ensure all premises are maintained to a high standard, and the comfort and safety of all tenants and visitors is maintained at all times. This role is fast paced and truly varies from day to day, so best suits someone who is a motivated self-starter, likes to act fast, enjoys a good challenge and can learn quickly! § §To be successful in this role you’ll need to be a creative and adaptive problem solver, have good technical knowledge in buildings, skills in Health & Safety and compliance procedures, and have the ability to create and manage great relationships with tenants, contractors, and clients. You should also place importance on being both proactive and reactive in your work. § §The ideal candidate will be passionate about the property industry and innovation in this space, and always be keen to learn and create new opportunities for themselves and the business. Additionally, this role has a career pathway for leadership and management so the desire and drive to learn, grow and win within the business is a must.§ § §What we need from you:§ §Minimum of 2 years’ experience as a Commercial Facilities and/or Property Manager§ §Effective written and verbal communicator with all stakeholders and network§ §Ability to work autonomously and as a team player§ §Technical knowledge of primary building services§ §Compliance, Health & Safety, and Emergency Management knowledge§  § §It’s a bonus if you have:§ §Tertiary or technical qualification in property§ §Experience with Re-Leased, Xero, Urbanise and Asana§ §Experience with lease management and commercial lease contracts§ §Experience with running a property operational and capex budget§ §Experience in managing small to medium projects like fit outs and service upgrades§  § §Working at Industrious:§ §Industrious Property is an established Commercial Property, Facilities, and Project Management company in the heart of the Wellington CBD. We love what we do, and we love working in our close-knit and dedicated team, clients and tenants.§ §If you come on board at Industrious, you’ll get the benefits of:§ § §Competitive remuneration rates§ §Being part of a supportive and positive team culture§ §Flexible work hours and ability to work from home§ §Mental health and wellbeing focus§  § §If you’re interested, click Apply Now with a cover letter and your CV. §Applications close October 9th§. § § § §If you’d like to read the full job description please go to our website industriousproperty.nz/careers or email info@industriousproperty.nz§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

Authority responsible for providing key infrastructure, community facilities, economic development, a range of regulatory functions, and managing natural resources.§        §The property function within the Council is undergoing positive change to enhance the way property assets are managed and maintained, with asset management, property management, and acquisition and disposal now managed portfolio.§        §This is an exciting leadership opportunity where you can make a huge impact.  We’re looking for an energetic manager to support and develop the team, refresh processes and ways of Currently we directly manage, operate and promote §Mt Smart Stadium§, North Harbour Stadium and §Western Springs§ Stadium. §        §For more information on Auckland Stadiums view:§ §https://www.aucklandstadiums.co.nz/about-us§        §He kōrero mōu: About you §        §Reporting to the General Manager Assets & Facilities, we are looking for a Facilities Manager with a proven history in delivering holistic Facilities Services who can inspire and lead their team.  Working alongside Event Management, Venue Presentation and Security personnel you will deliver the stadiums as safe, clean and comfortable environments for both events and non-event day activities. To be successful in this role you will have proven experience of at least 6 to 10 years with strong facilities or venue management expertise and be used to working in the ‘live’ environment. jobText: TXT/50618122.txt	§Property Advisor - Disposals and Acquisitions§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Property Advisor - Disposals and Acquisitions§§Advertiser: §APL Property Queenstown Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§23 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Real Estate & Property§, §Commercial Sales, Leasing & Property Mgmt§§§§§§About the business§APL Property delivers professional property management, advisory and valuation expertise to our clients throughout New Zealand and is a LINZ Accredited Supplier of Crown property services. §About the role§ §This is an exciting career opportunity to join our Queenstown office, who manage and consult on a diverse range of property matters to private individuals, corporates, central and local Government clients§We currently have a position available for a Property Advisor who will be primarily working alongside a team involved with the disposal of surplus Government properties and the acquisition of properties for central and local Government clients across New Zealand. We are able to augment this with a range of property advisory tasks that will further challenge and develop the successful candidate. § §In this role you will be completing due diligence and feasibility assessments, undertaking research of historic property information, coordinating surveyors, instructing valuers, engaging with real estate agents  and applying complex legislation and Government policy, including Treaty Settlement requirements, and the Public Works Act to property acquisitions and disposals. § §Benefits and perks §Queenstown offers a unique lifestyle in one of the most beautiful and inspiring regions of New Zealand. We offer a supportive team environment from our office in the heart of Queenstown CBD. Not a fan of Queenstown? We are open to employing an experienced candidate who may be located in any New Zealand location. We offer and encourage opportunities to grow and develop professionally and are supportive of flexible working arrangements.  § § §Skills and experience §To be successful in this role, you will have a relevant tertiary qualification and or at least 5 years relevant industry experience. Existing LINZ Accredited Suppliers are encouraged to apply.§If you are interested in this exciting opportunity with APL Property, please apply now with your CV, together with a covering letter addressed to the Managing Directors. §For a confidential discussion regarding this role please contact Jeff Reidy §03 442 7133§. §https://www.aplproperty.co.nz/ §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

jobTitle: Property and Facilities Manager Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50620972.txt	§Property and Facilities Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Property and Facilities Manager§§Advertiser: §Madison Recruitment Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§23 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Real Estate & Property§, §Body Corporate & Facilities Management§§§§§§Spanning 40 years in the NZ property market, this family owned business is on a trajectory of continued growth.§ As they continue to add to their already sizeable portfolio of Industrial properties in the Auckland region, they’re also growing their team with a spot now open for a Property and Facilities Manager to take full ownership of the portfolio.§ §Your new role:§ Whether you’re a seasoned Facilities or Property Manager, an up and coming property superstar waiting to get noticed or perhaps you’ve done your time in property valuations and looking to round out your experience with a change to portfolio management, this is an opportunity to work alongside some of the best in the business! You’ll enjoy full ownership of a small industrial portfolio comprising many long-term tenancies built on strong landlord/tenant relationships that will be passed over to you to continue. Tasked with the usual day to day responsibilities that come with property and facilities management, no two days will be the same. Expect complete autonomy after an initial period of training and with KPI’s in place to keep you on track for success. Earn your stripes through hard work, commitment, and outstanding results; and opportunities to assist with property acquisitions will come your way over time.§ §About you:§§Minimum 2 years’ experience in the property sector§Experience managing contractors and trade staff§Exceptional communicator, natural relationship builder and self confidence§Go-getter with initiative, drive, self-motivation, and enthusiasm§Commercially savvy with a strategic mindset§What's on offer?§ If you're looking for a varied role where you'll be out and about and not tied to the office, this role is sure to tick the box. Joining this small, high achieving team, you can look forward to a generous salary plus all the tools of the trade. Based between a smart Parnell office and the Industrial Estate office in Onehunga, you’ll have a dedicated carpark and fuel card, but above all, an opportunity that we don’t see too often!§ Hit the apply button now. Upload your CV and cover letter outlining why you this is the role for you.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50621382.txt	§Property Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Property Manager§§Advertiser: §Taylor Property Plus§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§23 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Real Estate & Property§, §Residential Leasing & Property Management§§§§§§Taylor Property Plus is looking for an enthusiastic and dedicated Property Manager to join their residential property management team based in Churton Park with properties throughout the Wellington Region. § §Taylor Property Plus is a growing and market leading property management company that manages a diverse range of investment properties in Wellington – from standalone homes to large apartment blocks, studio apartments to exclusive properties.  As a company we are totally focused on providing outstanding service for our owners and tenants. § §This role would see you working in a team environment working alongside other Property Managers, Administrators and Company Directors, overseeing the day-to-day management of owner’s property investments. This is a full time permanent role with 5 days of work between Monday and Saturday. § §Roles and responsibilities; § § § §Property Marketing – oversee the marketing of properties for new tenants and ensuring that properties are leased to quality tenants at market rates § § § §Tenant Relations and Management – overseeing the execution and ongoing management of lease agreements, monitoring and following up of rental payment in a timely manner § § § §Facilities Management – scheduling of maintenance and repair, ensure up keep of long term maintenance plans, contract negotiations with contractors, conducting regular property inspections, prompt resolution of property emergencies§ § § §Financial Reporting - keep financial records from property operations, create/review monthly financial reports for property owners § § § §Owner Relations – keep open dialogue with property owners on vacancies, tenants, physical condition of property, financial updates, etc. § § §To be successful in this role you will need to have developed skills and knowledge; § § § §Familiar with applicable local, regional and national laws and regulations § § § §Strong interpersonal & business communication skills – ability to work in a team in environment § § § §High level of organisation and attention to detail § § § §Competence with office management software § § § §Knowledge of financial reporting § § § §Professional, innovative and confident, especially in a business environment § § § §Strong client and commercial focus  § § §An understanding and appreciation for the property and property management industry would be of benefit. Training will be provided, specifically for the use of property management software, you are required to have a full and clean New Zealand driver’s license to be able to drive company vehicles. § §When applying for this position please enclose your CV, cover letter, relevant references and a copy of your driver’s license. §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§§§

They have an outstanding track record of generating and sustaining the wealth of their investors, are passionate about providing an amazing work environment for their people and are committed to giving back to the communities they operate in.§        §This is a special career opportunity for an experienced commercial Property Analyst, there's lots of scope to keep growing, to be part of a dedicated and dynamic team and to work for a company who are committed to ensuring their people are happy and challenged in their roles.§        §We are seeking someone with 3-5 years commercial property analyst experience to work closely with the Asset Management and Investment teams in the information management and data analysis of the day-to-day property and property transaction decisions.  You'll have the opportunity to take the lead with developing systems, tools, resources, and processes that work for both asset management and transactions management functions and be involved in the success of a substantial commercial property portfolio.§        §You'll require a thorough knowledge of commercial property concepts and terminology, be experienced presenting and analysing commercial property data, have good knowledge of financial concepts and terminational and a fundamental understanding of Management Information Systems.  As well as strong Excel you'll also have worked with property management systems from an Asset Management perspective and have excellent communication and people skills.§        §Competitive salary and an outstanding bonus/benefits package available.§        §Don't miss out!  To apply, please send your Resume to Caroline Lynch via SEEK §        § §        § §        § §      §      §      §    §    §metro§recruitment§.co.nz§  §§§Our client is one of the most established and trusted property and fund mangers in N.Z. They have an outstanding track record of generating and sustaining the wealth of their investors, are passionate about providing an amazing work environment for their people and are committed to giving back to the communities they operate in.§ §This is a special career opportunity for an experienced commercial Property Analyst, there's lots of scope to keep growing, to be part of a dedicated and dynamic team and to work for a company who are committed to ensuring their people are happy and challenged in their roles.§ §We are seeking someone with 3-5 years commercial property analyst experience to work closely with the Asset Management and Investment teams in the information management and data analysis of the day-to-day property and property transaction decisions.  You'll have the opportunity to take the lead with developing systems, tools, resources, and processes that work for both asset management and transactions management functions and be involved in the success of a substantial commercial property portfolio.§ §You'll require a thorough knowledge of commercial property concepts and terminology, be experienced presenting and analysing commercial property data, have good knowledge of financial concepts and terminational and a fundamental understanding of Management Information Systems.  As well as strong Excel you'll also have worked with property management systems from an Asset Management perspective and have excellent communication and people skills.§ §Competitive salary and an outstanding bonus/benefits package available.§ §Don't miss out!  To apply, please send your Resume to Caroline Lynch via SEEK § § § § § § §§§§

Opportunities for growth and achievement within the company are excellent.  If you are already licenced then enquire today how goodGround can assist with your Real Estate career.  §Inquire today and hear goodGround Principal, Martin Albrecht talk about the facts and statistics of the industry as well as discussing your career prospects, the process of becoming qualified, how to start your own business, and what makes goodGround stand out from the other real estate companies.§ §This role is being managed by REAP Recruitment on behalf of goodGround Real Estate. Please apply on-line below to be considered for this role.§All applications will remain confidential to REAP Recruitment & goodGround Real Estate and will only be forwarded on to others with your consent.§      §      §Matt Hunter§Apply On-Line Below §    §    §  §§§Interested in a career in Real Estate Sales? §goodGround Real Estate are looking for great people that want to take their career to the next level and reach their potential in a team environment focused on excellence.  You may not be currently involved with Real Estate but believe you have got what it takes, or you may be an existing licensed salesperson looking to achieve greater success. Either way, we want to hear from you now.  You must have the following:§ § §Your own reliable transport§ §Honesty and integrity§ §The desire to build a lasting career§ §The willingness to learn§ §A positive "can do" attitude§ §Good computer skills§ §NZ citizenship or hold a NZ permanent resident visa§ § On offer is:§ § §A structured career path with outstanding support systems§ §Open access to all their property listings company wide§ §The ability to list and sell property anywhere§ §Significant uncapped income stream§ §An administrative support team there to help you succeed§ §Freedom to grow and achieve your goals§ §Exciting and fun-loving environment§ § goodGround Real Estate is a rapidly expanding, independent Agency with a successful record. Opportunities for growth and achievement within the company are excellent.  If you are already licenced then enquire today how goodGround can assist with your Real Estate career.  §Inquire today and hear goodGround Principal, Martin Albrecht talk about the facts and statistics of the industry as well as discussing your career prospects, the process of becoming qualified, how to start your own business, and what makes goodGround stand out from the other real estate companies.§ §This role is being managed by REAP Recruitment on behalf of goodGround Real Estate. Please apply on-line below to be considered for this role.§All applications will remain confidential to REAP Recruitment & goodGround Real Estate and will only be forwarded on to others with your consent.§§§§

If you are currently working in Real Estate or considering a career in the industry then we would love the opportunity to speak with you about the prospect of joining their friendly team and will reward you with the following:§ § §Unlimited earning potential§ §On-going support and mentorship for an experienced leadership team§ §Excellent systems & processes§ §Support from Head Office§ §A great team culture§ § If you are already a Licenced Salesperson (or completed your studies) then please call me today for a confidential chat.  We are also interested in hearing from those people who are considering a career in Real Estate and would like to see what Ray White can offer, so please enquire today.  Full training and other support are available for successful candidates.§This role is being managed by REAP Recruitment.
