jobTitle: Centre Manager - NorthWest Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50673629.txt	§Centre Manager - NorthWest§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Centre Manager - NorthWest§§Advertiser: §Cobalt Consulting NZ Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§2 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Real Estate & Property§, §Retail & Property Development§§§§§§§§§  §    §      §Centre Manager - NorthWest §    §    §      §      §        §On behalf of Stride Property, one of New Zealand’s leading listed property companies, Cobalt are recruiting for a Retail Centre Manager to join their team here in Auckland. §        §Stride Property Group (SPG) is an NZX listed stapled group comprising Stride Property Limited (Stride) and Stride Investment Management Limited (SIML). They are primarily investors in New Zealand office, retail and industrial property.§        §Wholly owned and developed by Stride, NorthWest Shopping Centre’s GLA is approximately 34,500 sqm and is anchored by Farmers and Countdown, along with over 120 specialty retailers, restaurant precinct and office accommodation.§        §The overall objective is to ensure maximisation of net operating income and asset value through effective leasing strategy, operational excellence and the maximisation of centre sales performance.§        §Key responsibilities include:§        §          §The integration of an annual budget, marketing plan and reporting§          §Optimisation of tenancy mix in conjunction with the leasing team§          §Security and safety of the centre and its services§          §Marketing and public relations§          §Business case preparation and expenditure management, and§          §Stakeholder relationships, retailer advisory, and people management.§        §        §To be successful in the role you will possess the following:§        §          §Practical experience in property management, building management / commercial leasing, and/or retail assets§          §Skilled and efficient user of administrative, management and building management technologies§          §Practical Financial Management and Marketing§          §Dispute resolution experience§          §Ability to implement and oversee Health and Safety policy and processes.§          §Lease Management§          §Contractor management§          §OPEX/CAPEX budgeting/Reporting§        §        §In return, Stride offers the opportunity to be part of the exciting future of NorthWest, leading and working alongside a great team of people. The team takes great pride in creating an exceptional retail experience, whilst maintaining a fun, collegiate, knowledgeable, and progressive workplace environment. An excellence remuneration package, including base salary and incentives, is on offer for the right candidate. This is an exciting opportunity for an experienced property professional to make a mark in an expanding commercial retail environment.§        §If you’re interested to learn more about this opportunity please submit your interest via the link above, or alternatively for a confidential conversation contact Matt Webster at Cobalt Recruitment on §(09) 303 9093§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§On behalf of Stride Property, one of New Zealand’s leading listed property companies, Cobalt are recruiting for a Retail Centre Manager to join their team here in Auckland. §Stride Property Group (SPG) is an NZX listed stapled group comprising Stride Property Limited (Stride) and Stride Investment Management Limited (SIML). They are primarily investors in New Zealand office, retail and industrial property.§Wholly owned and developed by Stride, NorthWest Shopping Centre’s GLA is approximately 34,500 sqm and is anchored by Farmers and Countdown, along with over 120 specialty retailers, restaurant precinct and office accommodation.§The overall objective is to ensure maximisation of net operating income and asset value through effective leasing strategy, operational excellence and the maximisation of centre sales performance.§Key responsibilities include:§The integration of an annual budget, marketing plan and reporting§Optimisation of tenancy mix in conjunction with the leasing team§Security and safety of the centre and its services§Marketing and public relations§Business case preparation and expenditure management, and§Stakeholder relationships, retailer advisory, and people management.§To be successful in the role you will possess the following:§Practical experience in property management, building management / commercial leasing, and/or retail assets§Skilled and efficient user of administrative, management and building management technologies§Practical Financial Management and Marketing§Dispute resolution experience§Ability to implement and oversee Health and Safety policy and processes.§Lease Management§Contractor management§OPEX/CAPEX budgeting/Reporting§In return, Stride offers the opportunity to be part of the exciting future of NorthWest, leading and working alongside a great team of people. The team takes great pride in creating an exceptional retail experience, whilst maintaining a fun, collegiate, knowledgeable, and progressive workplace environment. An excellence remuneration package, including base salary and incentives, is on offer for the right candidate. This is an exciting opportunity for an experienced property professional to make a mark in an expanding commercial retail environment.§If you’re interested to learn more about this opportunity please submit your interest via the link above, or alternatively for a confidential conversation contact Matt Webster at Cobalt Recruitment on §(09) 303 9093§§§§

jobTitle: Superstar Property Manager Job in Canterbury - SEEK
xenophobe: Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?
jobText: TXT/50673648.txt	§Superstar Property Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Superstar Property Manager§§Advertiser: §Iron Bridge Property Management§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§2 Oct 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Real Estate & Property§, §Residential Leasing & Property Management§§§§§§A rare opportunity has come up to join our award-winning, family owned Property Management company, based in our modern and spacious Addington office.§We are a close-knit team at Iron Bridge Property Management, who work collectively to deliver exceptional service and advice to our clients. We value our people and are committed to looking after them.§Company culture is very important to us and we are looking for a Tenant Property Manager who will fit well into our work family. Someone who will celebrate the highs and knuckle down when needed. We believe in doing the best job possible every day and we will expect our new Tenant Property Manager to do the same.§We have structured our business to deliver a superior level of service to our clients. As the Tenant Property Manager, you will be working with the support of a Senior Property Manager. While you will both care for the property portfolio, your time will be focussed on building relationships with the tenants.§What this looks like for you:§Late model Mazda 3 car & fuel package (with parking!)§Dedicated accounts and support team who deal with all invoicing and rent receipts leaving you more time to spend with your tenants and nurturing your portfolio.§Supported by a dedicated letting agent and business development manager.§An attractive salary plus bonuses for team performance and for referred new business.§Family owned and operated. No big franchises to work through, just innovative creative people in the trenches with you.§What we are looking for in our new Superstar Tenant Property Manager:§§Maintenance knowledge§. You would win the Block NZ if you entered!§Organisation and Time Management.§ Because getting home before dinner counts!§Attitude and Work Ethic§. You work hard and you expect the same of your peers and your team.§Negotiation Skills.§ You are a delicate diplomat and are a 'closer'.§Communication and Problem Solving.§ You understand the importance of adding value to a customer and providing proactive advice and guidance.§Administration Skills§. You make sure that every ‘t’ is crossed, and every ‘i’ is dotted, because you know the devil is in the detail.§Fit.§ You love what we do, embrace who we are, and want to be part of a legacy that runs much deeper than routine inspections and rent arrears...§If you think this sounds like you, apply now and send us your CV, but most importantly a cover letter or email telling me why you want to be part of our team.§Get in quick. We hope to hear from you soon.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have customer service experience?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§Do you have experience in a role which requires relationship management experience?§§§

jobText: TXT/50673786.txt	§Real Estate Sales - EXPERIENCED Rural & Residential Salespeople wanted§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Real Estate Sales - EXPERIENCED Rural & Residential Salespeople wanted§§Advertiser: §LJ Hooker Cambridge§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§2 Oct 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Rest of Waikato§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Real Estate & Property§, §Residential Sales§§§§§§** MUST HAVE CURRENT REAL ESTATE LICENSE **§ §LJ Hooker Cambridge is committed to building a winning team consisting of results-focused people who are highly skilled in sales, customer care and ethics.  § §With the right people and the right training, our aim is to improve the real estate industry; not only for our agency, but also for the clients we serve.§ §If you join LJ Hooker Cambridge you will be given clear direction and expected to make a number of commitments.  Some of these are:§ §* Show honesty at all times in your dealings with clients§ §* Follow the sales training made available to you§ §* Complete specific actions on a  regular basis§ §* Become part of a team§ §Continually improve your knowledge and skill§ §* Work hard to reach your goals and those of your clients.§ §* Have a desire to succeed§ §You will receive:§ §* An excellent income (commission based) and a generous bonus package§ §* Support from your leader and colleagues§ §* Challenge and excitement - No 2 days are ever the same!§ §* Freedom of working hours - time is under your control§ §* The opportunity to advance or train and assist other salespeople§ §* The happiness that comes from being in one of the best industries in the world.§ §* Pride in being part of an international group the public can trust.§ §* LOTS OF FUN!§ § § §If you are interested in pursuing a career in real estate and you feel you have the dedication to succeed, please call Gerda Venter on 027 311 3722 or §07 827 7188§.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a real estate salesperson?§How many years' experience do you have in the real estate industry?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§§§

jobTitle: Business Development Manager Job in Auckland - SEEK
xenophobe: While it would be sensational to find these attributes in someone who has a residential property business development background, we are open to receiving applications from business development professionals from other industries as well.
jobText: TXT/50675149.txt	§Business Development Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Business Development Manager§§Advertiser: §Automotive Employment (NZ) Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§2 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Manukau & East Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Real Estate & Property§, §Residential Leasing & Property Management§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Business Development Manager §    §    §    §      §Job reference - 620985§        §          §The Rent Shop Ltd: A fresh, innovative, progressive, supportive, and energised company§          §Nationwide expansion provides genuine career scope§          §Acknowledgement, personal growth, and standards that are the envy of industry§        §  § §About the employer§ Having entered a proactive national growth strategy, The Rent Shop now has multiple locations in Manukau, Botany, Auckland City, Hobsonville, Taranaki, Tauranga, Nelson, and Dunedin§  § The Rent Shop continue their expansion in other main cities around New Zealand. This growth strategy continues to cement The Rent Shop’s reputation as the most innovative and energised property management company in the industry.§  § Born from the desire to deliver a progressive approach to the property market, The Rent Shop has become a powerful brand growing wealth, protecting investments, and a partner in property management trading second to none.§  § Reputation is everything at The Rent Shop and the track record is exemplary.§  §  § §About the role§ The key focus of this role is to build the rental portfolio in the Manukau Prime Market Area (PMA).§  § It is your job to actively create new business in the PMA while providing top service and returns to the landlord ensuring consistent communication and reliable tenants.§  § This is a complex industry sector - the BDM needs to be able to work strategically and think and act intelligently with rapidity and efficiency.§  §  § §General Description of Position:§        §          §Develop and actively prospect for new business forging mutually valuable relationships with landlord property investors and gaining repeat and referral business§          §Communicating the unique market position of The Rent Shop to landlords so they understand the genuine advantage of entrusting their properties to The Rent Shop to manage§          §Meet the financial management and growth objectives of the Property Management Department on a monthly and annualised basis§          §Conduct rental appraisals§          §Utilise all available databases and a variety of marketing resources to secure new business§          §Complete all paperwork and digital content with excellent efficiency rapidly delivering superior service delivery to landlords§          §Contributing to, as well as attending all meetings and training sessions§          §Consistent and ongoing development of your knowledge of the residency tenancy act (RTA) is a requirement§          §Your ability to communicate and proactively engage with landlords on an ongoing basis is essential§          §Delivering superior social media engagement in conjunction with your manager providing fresh valuable content to the marketplace. This is a role that develops a high public profile, you need to be prepared to be the face of The Rent Shop Manukau and deliver their unique message of excellence§          §The BDM is to use all sources possible to find potential landlords, working closely with the executive team, grafting leads and turning those leads into real life business§          §Create new ideas, be involved, find new ways of doing things, review existing procedures and make them better§          §Participate in creative discussions around digital and social media, marketing material and any other new business-related campaigns including investor information evenings§        §  §  § §What we are looking for§        §          §The Rent Shop are a team of fresh thinking, inspirational, quick-minded, and dynamic property professionals§          §You will know you’re bright§          §You will dress with modern professionalism because those are the standards you imbibe§          §You will have the ability to engage with the team and investor clients charismatically bringing intelligence, fun, and efficiency to the workplace§        §  § §Your background§ Clear open thinking means we will consider a range of backgrounds, but it is likely you will consider yourself intelligent, educated, charismatic, and engaging because this is a role that requires you to build warm relationships with ease.§  § While it would be sensational to find these attributes in someone who has a residential property business development background, we are open to receiving applications from business development professionals from other industries as well.§  §  § §The challenge and rewards§ Remuneration is via a base salary and performance-based bonuses. A decent company car is provided, as well as training. No reward comes without challenge.§  § There will be support for you to thrive through training, positive reinforcement, and acknowledgement. Your challenge is to make your career grow at The Rent Shop. Be awesome, be proactive, and grow.§  § Nail your job with commitment and contribute strategically. Be one of the team at The Rent Shop.§  §  §  § §The Rent Shop application process and closing date§ Property Employment NZ are our selected recruitment partners. The closing date is the §21st§ of §October §at §5pm§. Processing begins on §October 22nd.§  § An initial acknowledgment is made on receipt of your application. A second acknowledgement will be made after October 22nd to inform that we have begun processing.§  § To guarantee The Rent Shop are able to view your application click the apply section of Property Employment NZ's job ad and upload your resume.§  § A unique login to our specific recruitment assignment guarantees all applications will be reviewed by The Rent Shop.§  § A job description can be obtained by emailing §russell@propertyemployment.co.nz§ or §cassandra@propertyemployment.co.nz§  § You can also call Russell Phillips at Property Employment NZ on §09 271 3200§ or 027 479 0000.§  § Property Employment NZ is a division of JOBCORP NZ Ltd§      §      §+64 9 271 3200§ §      §    §    §  §§§Job reference - 620985§ § §The Rent Shop Ltd: A fresh, innovative, progressive, supportive, and energised company§ §Nationwide expansion provides genuine career scope§ §Acknowledgement, personal growth, and standards that are the envy of industry§ §  § §About the employer§ Having entered a proactive national growth strategy, The Rent Shop now has multiple locations in Manukau, Botany, Auckland City, Hobsonville, Taranaki, Tauranga, Nelson, and Dunedin§  § The Rent Shop continue their expansion in other main cities around New Zealand. jobTitle: Advisor, Clearances Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50679985.txt	§Advisor, Clearances§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Advisor, Clearances§§Advertiser: §Land Information New Zealand§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§4 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Real Estate & Property§, §Other§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Advisor, Clearances §      §      §      §        §About the LINZ Clearances Team§        § §        §As a thriving part of our Crown Property business unit, our Clearances team has an important role to play in the buying, use and disposal of land assets across New Zealand. Working in close collaboration with a variety of other Government Agencies, we play an active role in managing major housing, roading or infrastructure projects, buying or designating land for new school developments or any of the other multitude of improvement projects required to keep New Zealand moving forwards. We work closely with a variety of other Government Agencies and support the work they are doing. §        § §        §About the Role§        § §        §Our Clearances team has a major role to play in facilitating timely and efficient land acquisitions for a number of large, nationwide projects over the next 5 years.  These projects will significantly boost productivity across road, rail, public transport, walking and cycling infrastructure. To support our role in achieving these goals, we have an §Advisor, Clearances§ role available.§        § §        §Our Clearances team is made up of enthusiastic and technically savvy professionals. Day to day, they manage quality assurance on work submitted by accredited suppliers acting for vendor agencies and make strong, reason based statutory decisions under delegation. We're looking for someone energetic, Agile and collaborative who is seeking to further build on their existing experience and build a knowledge of the Public Works Act to provide technical expertise on Clearances issues, both inside and outside the team.§        § §        §This role offers you the opportunity to take the next step in your professional development and support our team to manage intellectually challenging pieces of work in a more autonomous way. With your continuous improvement focused mindset, you'll be well positioned to help us continue building the strategic agility within the Clearances team and provide technical insight to contribute to the review of legislation from a Clearances perspective.§        § §        §Ideally, you'll join us with previous experience in property, interpreting legislation, case law, standards & guidelines pragmatically - but we're not particular about which industry you've gained this ability in, as long as you are interested in the NZ land and property industry and are willing to build a new area of subject matter expertise. These capabilities, combined with your excellent communication and stakeholder engagement skills, will see you build strong networks amongst the Senior Advisors across the Crown Property team.  As part of your ongoing development, you'll develop the foresight to scan internal and external environments for issues that may be of concern and actively propose appropriate solutions or interventions. With your excellent written communication skills, you'll be comfortable peer reviewing others work and apply a critical thinking lens and insightful feedback, particularly when dealing with sensitive and complex subject matter.§        § §        §At LINZ we aim to set our new staff up for success, long-term opportunities for professional development and enjoyable career pathways with us. To help you in this role, you may have previous professional experience in a valuation, property, policy, conveyancing, or legal background. Strong written communication skills, scrupulous attention to detail and a focus on quality assurance, excellent record keeping, and workload prioritization skills will be essential. You'll also have previous experience building strong key stakeholder relationships and communicating appropriately to meet the needs of diverse audiences.§        § §        §Please note; if this role is of interest to you, but you feel your experience places you at more of a "Senior Advisor" level, rather than an Advisor, we have the flexibility to consider your application at this level. §        § §        §Due to the urgent need for these positions, we'll be applying an "as you go" shortlisting approach to this recruitment. What this means is that we'll be contacting suitable candidates to discuss the next steps of the process with them, prior to this advertisement closing - so the sooner you lodge your application the better. §        § §        §H§ow to Apply§        §To apply, please click "Apply Online." You'll be taken through to our LINZ Careers Centre where you'll be able to review further information about the responsibilities and accountabilities of this role in the Position Description.  You'll be able to complete your online application form and upload a copy of your CV/Cover Letter.  Please keep in mind when including your CV to specifically highlight the capabilities and skills listed in the above ad and the position description.§        § §        §Applications close 14th October 2020§        § §        §If you have any questions about this role or working at LINZ, please email opportunities@linz.govt.nz and our Recruitment Team will be in touch with you.§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§About the LINZ Clearances Team§ §As a thriving part of our Crown Property business unit, our Clearances team has an important role to play in the buying, use and disposal of land assets across New Zealand. Working in close collaboration with a variety of other Government Agencies, we play an active role in managing major housing, roading or infrastructure projects, buying or designating land for new school developments or any of the other multitude of improvement projects required to keep New Zealand moving forwards. We work closely with a variety of other Government Agencies and support the work they are doing. § §About the Role§ §Our Clearances team has a major role to play in facilitating timely and efficient land acquisitions for a number of large, nationwide projects over the next 5 years.  These projects will significantly boost productivity across road, rail, public transport, walking and cycling infrastructure. To support our role in achieving these goals, we have an §Advisor, Clearances§ role available.§ §Our Clearances team is made up of enthusiastic and technically savvy professionals. Day to day, they manage quality assurance on work submitted by accredited suppliers acting for vendor agencies and make strong, reason based statutory decisions under delegation. We're looking for someone energetic, Agile and collaborative who is seeking to further build on their existing experience and build a knowledge of the Public Works Act to provide technical expertise on Clearances issues, both inside and outside the team.§ §This role offers you the opportunity to take the next step in your professional development and support our team to manage intellectually challenging pieces of work in a more autonomous way. With your continuous improvement focused mindset, you'll be well positioned to help us continue building the strategic agility within the Clearances team and provide technical insight to contribute to the review of legislation from a Clearances perspective.§ §Ideally, you'll join us with previous experience in property, interpreting legislation, case law, standards & guidelines pragmatically - but we're not particular about which industry you've gained this ability in, as long as you are interested in the NZ land and property industry and are willing to build a new area of subject matter expertise. These capabilities, combined with your excellent communication and stakeholder engagement skills, will see you build strong networks amongst the Senior Advisors across the Crown Property team.  As part of your ongoing development, you'll develop the foresight to scan internal and external environments for issues that may be of concern and actively propose appropriate solutions or interventions. With your excellent written communication skills, you'll be comfortable peer reviewing others work and apply a critical thinking lens and insightful feedback, particularly when dealing with sensitive and complex subject matter.§ §At LINZ we aim to set our new staff up for success, long-term opportunities for professional development and enjoyable career pathways with us. To help you in this role, you may have previous professional experience in a valuation, property, policy, conveyancing, or legal background. Strong written communication skills, scrupulous attention to detail and a focus on quality assurance, excellent record keeping, and workload prioritization skills will be essential. You'll also have previous experience building strong key stakeholder relationships and communicating appropriately to meet the needs of diverse audiences.§ §Please note; if this role is of interest to you, but you feel your experience places you at more of a "Senior Advisor" level, rather than an Advisor, we have the flexibility to consider your application at this level. § §§Due to the urgent need for these positions, we'll be applying an "as you go" shortlisting approach to this recruitment. What this means is that we'll be contacting suitable candidates to discuss the next steps of the process with them, prior to this advertisement closing - so the sooner you lodge your application the better. §§ §H§ow to Apply§§To apply, please click "Apply Online." You'll be taken through to our LINZ Careers Centre where you'll be able to review further information about the responsibilities and accountabilities of this role in the Position Description.  You'll be able to complete your online application form and upload a copy of your CV/Cover Letter.  Please keep in mind when including your CV to specifically highlight the capabilities and skills listed in the above ad and the position description.§ §Applications close 14th October 2020§ §If you have any questions about this role or working at LINZ, please email opportunities@linz.govt.nz and our Recruitment Team will be in touch with you.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50683529.txt	§Property Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Property Manager§§Advertiser: §Wallace and Stratton Real Estate Group Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Rodney & North Shore§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Real Estate & Property§, §Residential Leasing & Property Management§§§§§§The Role§ §We are after a Property Manager with a difference - a high level of attention to detail coupled with the ability to communicate clearly and work in a fast paced environment.  We want a Property Manager that brings a fresh approach to business, putting the customer needs as a top priority whilst adding value to our boutique real estate business.§ § § §We offer:§ § §A supportive and friendly working environment§ §An opportunity to learn and advance your career in property management§ §To be successful in this role we are looking for someone who is:§ § § § §Experienced§ §passionate§ §Has attention to detail§ §Results Driven§ §Highly motivated and target driven§ §Communication and negotiation skills§ §A proven track record in hunting out sales§ §Good work ethic. § §Optimistic and self-motivated.§ §Goal oriented§ §Energetic§ § § §Duties and responsibilities:§ § §Passionate about the property market, understanding the factors influencing property value.§ §Daily communication with owners and tenants on every aspect of their rental property§ §Routine Property Inspection - treating our owners property as if it was your own§ §Organise and attend to repairs§ §Review property maintenance, security and tenancy contracts§ §Completing tenancy renewals and facilitating rent reviews§ §Advertise and show rental homes § §Negotiate tenancy agreements§ §Collect rents and bonds from tenants§ §Investigate and resolve any tenant complaints§ §Able to analyse information quickly and make robust decisions. § §Keep up to date with the real estate market§ §Advise building owners on tenancy law and the real estate market§ §Focused on delivering best possible results for the company and shows determination, resourcefulness and a sense of purpose in achieving this§ §Available 24/7 to attend urgent issues where necessary§ §Work well under high pressure§ §Ability to meet KPI and deadlines§ §Analytically minded with excellent administrative skills and a confidence in working with numerous data§ §Highly proficient in general property management software including Myrent and or Palace etc. § §Excellent organisational skills.§ §Ability to work efficiently to tight deadlines and manage a number of tasks simultaneously§ §Have a full NZ Drivers Licence and a clean record.§ §Applicants must be a New Zealand citizen or permanent resident.§ §Skills and Experience required:§ § §Previous Property Management Experience§ §Minimum 2 years experience in Property Management§ §Solid knowledge and understanding of the Residential Tenancy Act§ §Be computer literate (experience with Palace and PropertyMe will be highly considered)§ §Highly communicative - working with landlords and ensuring a responsive nature to calls, emails and texts§ §Ability to resolve disputes, conflicts in a professional manner§ §Keep accurate records, tenancy agreements, reports and accounts§ §Prepare cases for legal actions§ §Organise repairs and maintenance works§ §Create a good rapport with customers and trades§ §Be able to work under pressure § §Full NZ driving licence Bbe able to work after working hours if required§ §Willingness to go out of your way to support the business where required§ §To be successful in this role you will be a high energy, optimistic people focussed person.  You will be approachable and work with an open door policy.  A sense of humor is critical in this role as office banter is part of the culture.  We look forward to welcoming you to our W&S family.§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a property manager?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§Which of the following Microsoft Office products are you experienced with?§§§

We're down to earth. We're smart and curious. We are people obsessed. We understand.§ §Classic Builders is a success story that spans more than 20 years. A couple of guys with different skills had a shared vision to build homes for Kiwis. They wanted to build better homes with quality and affordability taking centre stage.§ §Now the second largest residential builder in New Zealand, Classic Builders has built over 6,000 homes across Aotearoa. § §But we can't do this alone – we rely on the tenacity of our people, the heart of our business.§ §Our Lakes District branch has a brand-new opportunity for a superstar to join the team! In this role, you will be responsible for selling Classic Builders homes to prospective clients. §You can be based from either Rotorua or Taupo - whatever works for you - as long as you're adaptable to work across both regions§.§ §The leads are burning hot, the calls are coming in daily and we need a sales consultant that can come in, hit the ground running - and make the most of this awesome opportunity.  § §You will be accountable for actively promoting the Classic brand to all potential clients, qualifying leads to genuine sales and building great relationships with clients for a seamless and informative process. § §The successful candidate will have: § § §Minimum 3 years experience in a sales environment. § §Proven success achieving targets and KPI's.§ §Exceptional communication skills.§ §Strong Microsoft Office suite abilities and be overall technology literate.§ §A great approach to building relationships with others.§ §Just some of what Classic has to offer: § § §Competitive commission structure§ §Good support - training and guidance to enable your success§ §An awesome company culture§ §A reputable company with great ethics and solid pipeline of ongoing work.§ §Core to what we do at Classics is our values, so if these resonate with you and the way you work then you'll fit in fine:§ § §We care§ §We work as one team§ §We are daring§ §We deliver excellence§ §If this sounds like a bit of you, then apply by clicking the link! §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have experience in a sales role?§Do you have experience working towards targets and KPIs?§§§

jobText: TXT/50684289.txt	§Finance & Facilities Administrator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Finance & Facilities Administrator§§Advertiser: §Cushman and Wakefield NZ§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Real Estate & Property§, §Body Corporate & Facilities Management§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Finance & Facilities Administrator §      §        §With a reputation for excellence in providing service and support to our customers, Cushman & Wakefield is a market leader in Facility Management and Facilities Service delivery. We have a genuine commitment to continually strengthen client relationships and raise the bar in terms of customer service and delivery outcomes.§        §We are currently seeking a§ Finance & Facilities Administrator§ to join our Victoria University Facilities Contract team based on site. The team is responsible for managing the portfolio of Victoria University facilities and assets. You will also be responsible for finance related processes.§        §Reporting to the Finance & Facilities Coordinator this role will support the successful delivery and coordination of the services of the contract on site.§        §This is a part time role working 24 hours per week. This can be three full days or five days with reduced hours however you must be available to work Thursdays and Fridays. §        §KEY RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE:§        §          §Inputting of time-sheeting from internal trades staff§          §Process of Supplier Invoices in conjunction with Facilities Coordinator§          §Processing of consumable expenses§          §Support the closing of Reactive and PPM work orders including invoicing.§          §Support Facilities Coordinator to chase up Completed Not Billed (CNB) work orders within contract agreed timelines.§          §Management of the contract quoting process including direct customer quotes.§          §Joint management of the common email inbox with contract support and management team.§          §Provide support and cover for Operations Support role & Facilities Coordinator roles as required.§          §Liaise with the Property Help Desk when required§        §        §BACKGROUND AND EXPERIENCE§        §          §Relevant qualifications relating to finance or business management.§          §Minimum of two years in a facilities administration, property administration, customer service or finance administrator role.§          §Industry experience in Outsourced Facilities Management preferred.§        §        § §Cushman & Wakefield offer an above average remuneration package which includes:§        §          §Free Life Insurance§          §Free Income replacement insurance§          §Discounted Medical cover with Southern Cross§          §Access to Marram Trust holiday / medical program§        §        §Candidates must be eligible to work in New Zealand to apply.§        §Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.§        §§      §      §      §    §    §      §    §    §Cushman & Wakefield is a leading global real estate services firm that helps clients transform the way people work, shop, and live. The firm's 43,000 employees in more than 60 countries help investors optimise the value of their real estate by combining global perspective and deep local knowledge with an impressive platform of real estate solutions. Cushman & Wakefield is among the largest global commercial real estate services firms with revenue of $5 billion across core services of agency leasing, asset services, capital markets, facility services, global occupier services, investment & asset management, project & development services, tenant representation, and valuation & advisory. To learn more, visit cushmanwakefield.com.au and follow @CushWakeaust on Twitter.§  §§§With a reputation for excellence in providing service and support to our customers, Cushman & Wakefield is a market leader in Facility Management and Facilities Service delivery. We have a genuine commitment to continually strengthen client relationships and raise the bar in terms of customer service and delivery outcomes.§ §We are currently seeking a§ Finance & Facilities Administrator§ to join our Victoria University Facilities Contract team based on site. The team is responsible for managing the portfolio of Victoria University facilities and assets. You will also be responsible for finance related processes.§ §Reporting to the Finance & Facilities Coordinator this role will support the successful delivery and coordination of the services of the contract on site.§ §This is a part time role working 24 hours per week. This can be three full days or five days with reduced hours however you must be available to work Thursdays and Fridays. § §KEY RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE:§ § §Inputting of time-sheeting from internal trades staff§ §Process of Supplier Invoices in conjunction with Facilities Coordinator§ §Processing of consumable expenses§ §Support the closing of Reactive and PPM work orders including invoicing.§ §Support Facilities Coordinator to chase up Completed Not Billed (CNB) work orders within contract agreed timelines.§ §Management of the contract quoting process including direct customer quotes.§ §Joint management of the common email inbox with contract support and management team.§ §Provide support and cover for Operations Support role & Facilities Coordinator roles as required.§ §Liaise with the Property Help Desk when required§ §BACKGROUND AND EXPERIENCE§ § §Relevant qualifications relating to finance or business management.§ §Minimum of two years in a facilities administration, property administration, customer service or finance administrator role.§ §Industry experience in Outsourced Facilities Management preferred.§ § §Cushman & Wakefield offer an above average remuneration package which includes:§ § §Free Life Insurance§ §Free Income replacement insurance§ §Discounted Medical cover with Southern Cross§ §Access to Marram Trust holiday / medical program§ §Candidates must be eligible to work in New Zealand to apply.§ §Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.§§§§

This is a full time permanent role with days of work being Monday to Thursday and Saturday. § § § §Roles and responsibilities; § § § §Assisting Property Managers with: § § § §Property Marketing – marketing of properties for new tenants and ensuring that properties are leased to quality tenants at market rates § § § §Tenant Relations and Management – execution and ongoing management of lease agreements, monitoring and following up of rental payment in a timely manner § § § §Facilities Manager – maintenance and repair, ensure up keep of long term maintenance plans, contract negotiations with contractors, conducting regular property inspections, prompt resolution of property emergencies § § § §Owner Relations – assist with keeping open dialogue with property owners on vacancies, tenants, physical condition of property, financial issues, etc. § § §  § §To be successful in this role you will need to have developed skills and knowledge; § § § §Familiar with applicable local, regional and national laws and regulations § § § §Strong interpersonal & business communication skills – ability to work in a team in environment § § § §High level of organisation and attention to detail § § § §Competence with office management software § § § §Professional, innovative and confident, especially in a business environment § § § §Strong client and commercial focus  § § §  § §An understanding and appreciation for the property and property management industry would be of benefit. Training will be provided, specifically for the use of property management software, you are required to have a full and clean New Zealand driver’s license to be able to drive company vehicles. § §  § §When applying for this position please enclose your CV, cover letter, relevant references and a copy of your driver’s license. §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§§§

It is more than just a business transaction – it is about looking after the customer’s future plans and dreams. jobText: TXT/50693886.txt	§Property Executive§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Property Executive§§Advertiser: §LQ Queenstown by Wyndham§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Otago§, §Queenstown & Wanaka§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Real Estate & Property§, §Residential Leasing & Property Management§§§§§§Property Executive, LQ Queenstown by Wyndham.§ §We are looking for a Property Executive to primarily manage a brand new residential portfolio with the other side of your role working some of the time as a Front Desk Executive at our 91-room LQ Queenstown Hotel to ensure visitors receive a heart-warming welcome, efficient check-in/check-out and to assist with activities, including phone calls, reservations and guest’s services.§ §This is a live on-site position with accommodation as part of your package which will also include free and unlimited high-speed internet. There is an element from time to time for some after-hours work as and when required.§ §The applicant does not necessarily need previous hotel front desk experience but must have handled a rental property portfolio and is experienced with advertising rental properties, interviewing, and vetting rental applicants, conducting property inspections and in general, keeping a close eye on the rental market in Queenstown in order to give landlords the most up to date and current information when needed. You will be highly organised and able to efficiently multi-task.§ §As Property Executive, you should combine your pleasant personality with a dynamic professional attitude to efficiently handle any inquiries and/or complaints to ensure LQ Queenstown provides a solid customer service approach.§ §You will be used to handling both short and long-term tenancies, liaising with owners and ensuring apartments are continuously rented at the highest market level of rent possible. When apartments are vacated you will conduct the property inspection report, coordinate, and oversee all maintenance necessary. You will also conduct regular property inspections when apartments are tenanted.§ §You will be responsible for placing advertisements and fielding inquiries to then vet applicants to find the highest calibre of tenants available for the apartment owners of LQ Queenstown.§ §You will report to the General Managers of LQ Queenstown.§ §Requirements§ §Proven experience, preferably as a rental property manager. Only candidates with a minimum of at least 2 years property management experience will be considered.§ §Advantageous if you've used Palace and Renti software.§ §Hands-on experience with office machines (e.g. computers and printers)§Strong social media ability.§Thorough knowledge of customer service, office management.§Proficiency in English (oral and written) Second language an advantage.§Solid knowledge of MS Office, particularly Excel and Word§Excellent communication and people skills§Good organizational and multitasking abilities§Problem-solving skills§A Manager’s Liquor License is required, so if you don’t have this the company will pay for you to complete the course to obtain this.§High School diploma and additional tertiary certification, especially in property management, is a plus.§ §Note: New Zealand citizens or residents only, please.  CVs that do not say the applicant is either a New Zealand citizen or resident will not be considered.§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have customer service experience?§Do you have experience in an administration role?§How many years of residential property management experience do you have?§§§

jobTitle: Property Administrator Job in Otago - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50695395.txt	§Property Administrator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Property Administrator§§Advertiser: §Waitaki District Council§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Otago§, §Rest of Otago§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Real Estate & Property§, §Administration§§§§§§Full-time, permanent§ §Do you have a talent for organising people, documents and processes? Are you a great communicator, with an eye for detail?§  §Our Property team is seeking a Property Administration to provide administrative and other business support to help ensure efficient and effective delivery of property services to the community.§  §Waitaki is one of New Zealand's most vibrant on-the-grow districts and home to great lakes, ski fields, cycle trails, epic tramping, fishing and hunting, surf beaches and so much more. Award-winning restaurants, wineries, craft breweries, Steampunk and Oamaru's fascinating Victorian Precinct will be at your doorstep, along with Aotearoa's longest national heartland cycleway (the Alps to Ocean) and the fabulous Waitaki Whitestone Geopark. Add to this affordable housing, great schools and a real sense of community with no traffic jams!§  §As Property Administration for the Property team, you'll be based in our Oamaru office and responsible for:§ § §Assisting with lease and tenancy management including debt collection§ §Administration of the property leasing and asset management software systems§ §Preparing contract, licence and leasing documentation§ §Reviewing and developing administrative processes for the team§ §Administering team documents and correspondence§ §Assisting with management of financial systems and reporting§ §Ability to coordinate others§ §To be successful in this role, you will have:§ § §NCEA Level 3 or equivalent§ §At least 3 years of successful experience in an administration or business support role§ §Property management experience§ §Experience with data systems and proficiency in using Microsoft Office and other applications to create and manage documents§ §Excellent oral and written communication skills§ §Well-developed planning and organisational skills, including the ability to prioritise tasks under pressure§ §The ability to build positive relationships within a team, organisations and external stakeholders§ §Enquiries regarding the position can be made to Renee Julius, Property Manager by calling §03 433 0300§.§  §Applications close midday on Monday 26 October 2020.§  §To apply for this job and to view the position description go to: waitakidistrictcouncil.recruitmenthub.co.nz/Vacancies & enter ref code: 5238161.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50695637.txt	§Facilities Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Facilities Manager§§Advertiser: §BGIS§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§§Salary§§Rewarding role with great benefits§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Real Estate & Property§, §Body Corporate & Facilities Management§§§§§§BGIS has over 7000+ employees globally, we are a leader in the provision of facility management, project delivery, energy and sustainability, asset management, workplace advisory, real estate and technical services. We are focused on delivering innovative service solutions for our clients.§ § Our organisation manages more than 30,000 facilities, including corporate offices, universities, schools, hospitals and stadiums, and we are regarded as a world leader in the management of data centres and other critical environments. Our clients come from a diverse range of sectors, such as Defence, Healthcare, Government, Higher Education and Utilities.§ § Further information is available at apac.bgis.com§ § § §The Role§ § The §Facilities Manager§ is part of an on-site team with a key client and is responsible for the all on-site maintenance works. This a well-rounded autonomous role with varied leadership, reporting, operational and administrative functions.§ § This role is based in §Auckland, NZ.§ §Facilitate planning and programming for prescribed technical works, in line with tendered obligations.§Manage and co-ordinate reporting and administration focusing on the Service Agreement and KPIs.§Supervise and manage a small team.§Ensure risk assessments and site audits are regularly completed.§Ensure contractors are managed in accordance with the contractor management program.§Contribution to the continuous improvement of systems and processes including rollouts.§ §​Skills and Experience§Proven experience in a Facilities Management or Senior Facilities Coordination role.§Demonstrated knowledge of technical FM and trades.§Proven capability of working within QA, OH&S and environmental systems.§Professional and engaging communication style.§Able to respond quickly to change and adopt a flexible/innovative approach§ §Culture§ At BGIS, we create safe environments where our people can do their best work. Our team comprises of individuals from many different cultures and nationalities, with a multitude of valued personal and professional backgrounds. We welcome diverse perspectives and are always on the lookout for people who can bring new ways of thinking to our teams.§ § § §Benefits§ BGIS offers Professional Development opportunities, excellent Company Benefits and an exceptional Employee Recognition Program, as well as flexible working arrangements.§ §§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

If you pride yourself in making things happen, getting the job done and have a current, clean driver's licence then apply now!§For further information, please contact §L.radovanovich@massey.ac.nz§To apply please apply at §https://masseyunicareers.nga.net.nz§Closing date: 28 October 2020§Reference number: SGE_O_534_10/20§§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

Built on the guiding principles of honesty, integrity and service, we make one simple promise - to deliver the very best results for our clients.§An opportunity has become available for an enthusiastic property professional to take on the exciting role of Branch Manager in our Warkworth Branch.§You will be responsible for the end to end processes of the branch, including but not limited to§:§Setting KPI's and managing the overall branch performance§Recruiting, developing, training and coaching new and established salespeople/employees§Implementing company systems, policies and procedures to facilitate the smooth running of the branch§You will have these key skills and attributes§:§Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills§Ability to lead by example§The ability to encourage and inspire hard work from your team§Be committed to growth and success§A Branch Manager qualification is ideal but not essential§Barfoot & Thompson is known for providing some of the best training, support systems, and rewards in the industry. With this exciting role you will be rewarded with a generous remuneration package based on profit share.§If you are looking for a challenging career and the opportunity to join an industry leader, here is your chance!§APPLY NOW through our online application form with an up to date resume and cover letter, outlining your relevant experience and why Warkworth office needs YOU!§Applications close: Friday 23rd October, 2020.§§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How would you rate your English language skills?§Do you hold a current Real Estate License? (Please answer: YES or NO)§How many years' experience do you have in the Real Estate industry?§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Administrator Facilities Management Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50703320.txt	§Administrator Facilities Management§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Administrator Facilities Management§§Advertiser: §Ministry of Social Development§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Casual/Vacation§§Classification§§Real Estate & Property§, §Body Corporate & Facilities Management§§§§§§§§§  §    §Administrator Facilities Management §    §      §        §Job Ref: 35134§        §Casual/On-Call§        §          §Do you have admin experience?§          §Do you want a mix of desk based and physical work?§          §Great lifestyle opportunity§        §        §Are you looking for casual or on-call work to support your lifestyle or student allowance? §        §About the Role§        §We are seeking someone to work in our busy Office Services team in the Wellington CBD.§        §The primary role of the Facilities Administrator is to provide quality services and effective facilities management at National Office. You will provide great customer services, assist with organising repairs and maintenance, carry out regular floor checks, help induct and manage our contractor/tradespeople, assist with onboarding and offboarding, ensure our databases are up to date, help manage building access, arrange car park bookings, assist in the mailroom and help distribute stock. §        §Skills and experience§        §To be successful in this role you will:§        §          §Be highly customer focussed.§          §Have high energy, be flexible, adaptable with a ‘can do’ attitude.§          §Be able to work to timeframes and have good time management.§          §Be competent in Word and Excel. §          §Be able to pick up new systems and programs easily. §          §Have attention to detail.§        §        §If this sounds like you, please, we would like to hear from you. §        §About our Team§        §The Property and Facilities Team includes the Ministry’s property operations, property strategy and National Office Facilities. Our Purpose is to bring our expertise and connections in Property and Facilities to deliver safe, fit for purpose work environments today and tomorrow.§        §How to Apply§        §To apply, click the 'Apply Now' button to upload your CV, cover letter and complete the online application form. Note: Your cover letter will be a key part of our assessment process, so please highlight how your experience relates to the key accountabilities listed in the position description.§        §All applications must be made online. If this is not possible or if you have any queries, please contact us at §jobs@msd.govt.nz§        §Applications close: 14 October 2020.§        §Position Description§        §http://www.msd.govt.nz/hr/documents/position-descriptions/dce-people-and-capability/property-and-facilities/administrator-facilities-management.docx§        §Joining us§        §Joining MSD means being part of a whānau that celebrates the diversity each individual represents. We show manaaki, we care about the wellbeing and success of people and want everyone to thrive, and be who they are in a supportive and inclusive working environment. We work together to make a difference for communities while doing the right thing with integrity. We are a Treaty partner committed to strengthening relationships with§ §Māori,§ §Hapū§,§ Iwi and communities to realise their own potential and aspirations.§        §If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to tell us when you apply so we can assist you through the recruitment process.§      §      §The Ministry of Social Development is one of New Zealand's largest government agencies. Our work to achieve better social outcomes affects almost every New Zealander, now or in the future.§        §https://jobs.msd.govt.nz/§      §    §    §  §§§Job Ref: 35134§ §Casual/On-Call§ § §Do you have admin experience?§ §Do you want a mix of desk based and physical work?§ §Great lifestyle opportunity§ §Are you looking for casual or on-call work to support your lifestyle or student allowance? § §About the Role§ §We are seeking someone to work in our busy Office Services team in the Wellington CBD.§ §The primary role of the Facilities Administrator is to provide quality services and effective facilities management at National Office. You will provide great customer services, assist with organising repairs and maintenance, carry out regular floor checks, help induct and manage our contractor/tradespeople, assist with onboarding and offboarding, ensure our databases are up to date, help manage building access, arrange car park bookings, assist in the mailroom and help distribute stock. § §Skills and experience§ §To be successful in this role you will:§ § §Be highly customer focussed.§ §Have high energy, be flexible, adaptable with a ‘can do’ attitude.§ §Be able to work to timeframes and have good time management.§ §Be competent in Word and Excel. § §Be able to pick up new systems and programs easily. § §Have attention to detail.§ §If this sounds like you, please, we would like to hear from you. § §About our Team§ §The Property and Facilities Team includes the Ministry’s property operations, property strategy and National Office Facilities. Our Purpose is to bring our expertise and connections in Property and Facilities to deliver safe, fit for purpose work environments today and tomorrow.§ §How to Apply§ §To apply, click the 'Apply Now' button to upload your CV, cover letter and complete the online application form. Note: Your cover letter will be a key part of our assessment process, so please highlight how your experience relates to the key accountabilities listed in the position description.§ §All applications must be made online. If this is not possible or if you have any queries, please contact us at §jobs@msd.govt.nz§ §Applications close: 14 October 2020.§ §Position Description§ §http://www.msd.govt.nz/hr/documents/position-descriptions/dce-people-and-capability/property-and-facilities/administrator-facilities-management.docx§ §Joining us§ §Joining MSD means being part of a whānau that celebrates the diversity each individual represents. We show manaaki, we care about the wellbeing and success of people and want everyone to thrive, and be who they are in a supportive and inclusive working environment. We work together to make a difference for communities while doing the right thing with integrity. We are a Treaty partner committed to strengthening relationships with§ §Māori,§ §Hapū§,§ Iwi and communities to realise their own potential and aspirations.§ §If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to tell us when you apply so we can assist you through the recruitment process.§§§§

Business ownership is a definite possibility for the right individual based on achieving mutually agreed results.§Professionals are an Australasian real estate company with a network over 225 offices and an established a reputation of support, camaraderie, empowerment and working together. §People work for our brand, because it works for them. Please apply on-line below to be considered.  All applications will remain confidential to REAP Recruitment & LJ Hooker and will only be forwarded on to others with your consent.  More information is available on request.§REAP Recruitment specialise in recruitment for the Real Estate and Property (REAP) industries.  We are your independent choice whether you're wanting to see if the "grass is greener" or looking for a new role in Real Estate.   If you're thinking about your career in Real Estate, then make REAP Recruitment your first call. §§§§

$64,901) dependent on qualifications and experience, plus Kiwi Saver.  We offer you flexible work arrangements and the chance to enjoy the lifestyle and beauty only the Far North region can provide.§                    §You will also be given all the tools of the trade you need to hit the ground running including a phone and a professional development plan to ensure your ongoing growth and success within the organisation. §                    § §                    §Positions like this don't come along often so don't wait - apply now!§                    §Creating Great Places, Supporting our People§                    § §                    § §Applications  close on Tuesday, 27 October 20§                    §                    § §                    § Email: Please click the 'Apply Now' button below.§                  §                  §The Far North District Council is an§ Equal Employment Opportunity Employer§                §              §            §          §        §      §    §  §§§Te wero – The Challenge§ §Our team is growing and we have an exciting new opportunity for a suitably experienced person to join our District Facilities team within the Infrastructure & Asset Management Department.  Our focus is looking after our many council and community buildings, Housing for the Elderly units, community leases / facilities, parks and reserves, cemeteries, public toilets, town maintenance, swimming pools, solid waste management and the related Contracts.§ § § §I ā koe§– About You§ §You will know how to deal with maintenance requests - This includes strategic review, opportunities to improve and setting business plans to grow this part of our business.§ §Providing the business with timely and appropriate annual business plans and budgets for Property Management to be incorporated within our overall business planning.§ § §The successful candidate will have:§ §Essential§ § §A tertiary qualification in a property/construction management discipline§ §At least 10 years’ experience in property/asset management§ §Preferably 2 or more years in a leadership/management role§ §Understand what best practice looks and feels like in property management and can develop and articulate plans to deliver this§ §   §Personal Attributes § § §Your core behaviours engender respect and trust with others§ §A collaborative working style§ §Proactive and visible leadership to bring your team, business and stakeholders together to deliver great outcomes§ §Excellent communication skills§ §You will bring strategic thinking with an agile response§ § If this exciting opportunity sounds like you then, please apply below, or contact Brad Minnema on §0221354864§ for further information.§§§§

With Uber DNA, Urban Lighthouse naturally has global growth ambitions and is currently building out the founding team to drive the adoption of this next generation property management service in Auckland.§Urban Lighthouse is a technology-enabled, full-service residential property management company. We pair talented people with technology to intelligently unlock higher returns for property owners while enabling a positive living experience for tenants.§We believe every property owner should be able to enjoy the benefits of investing in property without the burden of managing the day-to-day operations. Urban Lighthouse provides top-quality full-service property management to owners at a fairer flat-fee price, enabling higher returns, greater transparency and more time for owners to focus on the important things in life. We also believe renting a home should be an enjoyable living experience for all tenants. Urban Lighthouse strives to bring the latest mobile technology to tenants, making living in one of our properties simple and stress-free.§ABOUT THE ROLE§As an early team member, this is a rare opportunity to join a technology startup at the ground floor, working directly with the founder.§The junior property manager role is diverse in scope with the initial focus being on inspections, management of maintenance and letting. The right candidate has an impressive aptitude for learning and over time will get exposure to additional elements of the property manager role with the goal of developing into a fully-fledged property manager building and managing their own portfolio of properties.§In addition to the on-the-ground nature of the role, this role will work closely with our founder and technology development team to help prioritise which technologies and product features are to be built in order to improve the experience of the owners & tenants which we serve.§This is an early-stage and thus dynamic startup. The ideal candidate is comfortable in an environment requiring flexibility and initiative, loves problem solving and is able to thrive in a fast paced culture. Above all you should be passionate about real estate.§WHAT YOU’LL DO:§Initially, support the property manager with property inspections, management of maintenance and the letting process (marketing, viewings, tenant screening, etc).§Help design processes, structures and tools to improve the letting and inspection processes. You will work closely with the Urban Lighthouse product team to provide insights thus contributing to building the technology-enabled property management service of the future.§As you grow in your knowledge and ability, you will gain exposure to the other facets of managing investment properties related to the tenant experience, owner experience and growth.§WHO ARE YOU?§Proactive self-starter. jobText: TXT/50731021.txt	§Property Development Specialist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Property Development Specialist§§Advertiser: §Wise Group§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§13 Oct 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Hamilton§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Real Estate & Property§, §Retail & Property Development§§§§§§Full-time position working 40 hours per week§Based in Hamilton East§Enjoy delivering smart, effective and efficient property solutions?§Join our new Property team as a Property Development Specialist to help deliver property and asset management to the Wise Group.§Summary§Wise Property Solutions is a new service that delivers innovative and sustainable property solutions that creates fresh possibilities for the Wise Group. We do this through delivering smart, effective and efficient property solutions that reduce risk for all parties.§We’re looking for a Property Development Specialist is responsible for ensuring commercial and residential property negotiations, to get the best solution for the Wise Group entities based on their specific needs.§This role is full-time working 40 hours per week, Monday - Friday based in our Hamilton East office. In this role you will need to be prepared to travel across New Zealand as required.§You’ll report to the Team Lead: Property Strategy & Projects. You’ll have an organisational overview of land holdings and strategic property portfolio, lead property negotiations, whether it be related to a purchase or build, are done in a way that builds and maintains strong and effective relationships and gets the best solution for our customer. The Property Development Specialist is responsible for liaising with subcontractors, suppliers, council, architects, engineers and construction staff to ensure builds are completed on time and on budget.§You§We’d love to hear from applicants who have established local, regional and national strategic relationships in the industry, who are experienced successful negotiators and who also have a relevant qualification in property industry or related, preferably at degree level. You’ll have experience project managing large scale building developments, understand and implement strategic objectives, and knowledge of the RMA and city/district planning.§You’ll also have:§A clean, full drivers license§Established strategic relationships and strong facilitation skills§Ability to understand and implement strategic objectives§Ability to develop and sustain positive relationships across a range of networks§Problem-solving and conflict resolution skills§Knowledge of Treaty of Waitangi principles§Preferred:§A tertiary qualification in Property, Finance, Urban Planning, Project Management, Engineering or other relevant discipline. §Experience working within the mental health, addiction, disability, public health, non-government and/or community sector§The Benefits§In this role, you can look forward to flexible work arrangements, extra leave, subsidies for school holiday childcare and a great team around you every day working in an organisation that believes in its’ purpose. Be part of a supportive work environment where life balance is encouraged, people are valued and new solutions are the norm!§Position Description:§ To view the position description, please copy and paste the following link into your browser: https://www.wisegroup.co.nz/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/WPS-Property-Development-Specialist.pdf§Closing date:§ Sunday 8 November 2020. Please note, this advert may close earlier if a suitable candidate is found.§Contact:§ Phil King on 027 281 9006 if you have any questions.§**All new appointees require background checking. Under the requirements of the Children's Act 2014, new employees that are identified as coming under this act are required to undergo further safety checks as part of the recruitment process.§ §§§§

jobTitle: Infrastructure Asset Planners - Christchurch Job in Canterbury - SEEK
xenophobe: right to live and work
jobText: TXT/50740999.txt	§Infrastructure Asset Planners - Christchurch§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Infrastructure Asset Planners - Christchurch§§Advertiser: §Ministry of Education§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§14 Oct 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Real Estate & Property§, §Analysts§§§§§§Kia ora, Bula Vinaka, Fakaalofa lahi atu, Fakatalofa atu, Kia orana, Malo e lelei, Malo ni, Talofa lava, Tena koutou katoa and welcome.§Fixed-term or secondment, full-time (18 months)§Produce high quality strategic property plans from various information sets§Support the development of new planning frameworks and be responsible for writing school property plans across a portfolio of schools§Provide timely, quality advice and support for operational policy and management to support property delivery§Help shape the future of education§At the Ministry of Education, we work together to shape an education system that delivers equitable and excellent outcomes.§Our organisation is made up of more than 3,000 talented and committed people around New Zealand, from a wide range of backgrounds and cultures.§While we work in different groups and on different things, we all strive every day to make the biggest difference we can for every child, young person and adult student in our education system.§ About us§Education Infrastructure Service (EIS), a part of the Ministry of Education, manages the Crown's second largest property portfolio of around 2,100 schools with a book value of $18.3 billion, the largest payroll in the country, and transportation of over 100,000 students to and from school each day.§Our vision for school property is that all schools have quality learning environments as part of a well-managed and sustainable portfolio that helps deliver equitable and excellent outcomes for every child.§ About the role§Reporting to the Infrastructure Manager - Asset Planning in Christchurch, you will be responsible for the delivery of School property plans.§Your key accountabilities will include the following:§Preparing Asset Management Plans by translating information into high quality written documents§Promote a strategic approach to asset management planning and review asset performance against agreed targets and service levels§Identify operational, maintenance and capital improvements and optimise life-cycle costs§Ensure asset planning considers education needs, technical requirements, strategic improvement initiatives, compliance requirements and impact of demand§Develop and apply decision making tools and models to prioritise investments§Establish and maintain collaborative and effective partnerships with schools, Property Advisors and other key stakeholders to ensure asset management meets business objectives§Support alignment of capital investment programme management with Ministry asset management requirements§Ensure alignment with Te Rautaki Rawa Kura - The School Property Strategy 2030§ About you§You will have a Tertiary qualification in an appropriate field and will also offer:§proven asset management experience with organisations owning large and complex property portfolios, desirably but not confined to the public sector§well-developed strategic and critical thinking skills as well as the ability to analyse complex data and information§experience in the assessment of assets and a proven background producing high quality documents (specifically, sound well-reasoned property plans that achieve required outcomes)§excellent writing and verbal communication skills with a strong analytical focus and the ability to quickly establish trust and credibility§If you'd like to bring your skills to a rewarding role within an organisation that's continuously reaching goals and striving for a better future for New Zealand, we'd love to hear from you.§ Are you ready to make a difference?§We welcome candidates from diverse backgrounds, including Māori, Pacific and those with disabilities, who will enrich our understanding of the education system.§As a government agency, the Ministry is committed to keeping to the Treaty of Waitangi's guiding principles in our work for and with Māori students, their whānau, hapū and iwi.§Please review the job description and if this opportunity interests you, and you meet the requirements, apply now using the 'apply online' button. §For further information please contact Stephanie Phillips at §eis.recruitment@education.govt.nz§§Applications close midnight on Monday, 26 October 2020.§Click here to view the role description§§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§
