jobText: TXT/50746837.txt	§Commercial Property Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Commercial Property Manager§§Advertiser: §Mackersy Property§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§14 Oct 2020§§Location§§Bay of Plenty§, §Tauranga§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Real Estate & Property§, §Commercial Sales, Leasing & Property Mgmt§§§§§§About Mackersy Property§ §Mackersy Property is a leading New Zealand property investment management company, our focus being the successful management of syndicated investment and privately-owned commercial properties. Our team are industry experts that oversee all aspects of investment, commercial property management and facilities management within our extensive portfolio.§ § § §The Role§ §We are looking for an experienced and enthusiastic Commercial Property Manager to join our growing business in the Tauranga office. Working within a strong and supportive team, we are looking for property professionals wishing to advance their career and build on their current knowledge and skills.  § §This role will  encompass all aspects of Commercial Property Management and you will work closely with our Tauranga based Facilities Manager. This role is a permanent full-time role and some nationwide travel will be required.  § § § §Skills Required:§ §A relevant New Zealand property degree is essential with a minimum of three years’ experience as a commercial property manager in New Zealand. § §You will:§ § §Have superior communication skills, both written and verbal with the ability to build strong relationships with ease§ §Be a highly organised individual that works well in a busy environment and is happy to work autonomously§ §Be well versed in business operations with strong financial acumen§ §Have experience in full budget management§ §Have excellent lease/licence management knowledge with experience in lease negotiations and renewals § §Be confident with rent reviews, renewals and negotiations § §Be a strong negotiator with a personal approach§ §Be focused on operational excellence§ §Be a proficient Microsoft Office user with excellent skills in Excel, Word, PowerPoint and Outlook as well as strong IT skills and the ability to adapt to new systems with ease§ §Have experience and confidence with legal documentation§ §Have the ability to identify new opportunities for your clients, be a strong problem solver and have excellent time management§ §Be an individual who remains calm under pressure and is always ready to face new challenges§ §Resonate with our values: honesty, trust, loyalty, openness, efficiency and innovation§ §Have a full driver’s licence§ § § §About us§ §Our business is a promoter of our staff members, we encourage collaboration, innovation and progression. We expect a dedication to the business, a passion for the work we do and a genuine desire to deliver successful outcomes.§ §We are a unique team that believes in honesty and hard work. We want our people to be happy in what they do and work together for the continuous development of our growing business. We are proud and will always strive to do our best for our staff, investors, clients and contractors.§ § § §If this role sounds like you, please apply online before the 4th of November 2020. If you have any questions about this role or Mackersy Property, please contact Gabrielle on 022 674 7985.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a commercial property manager?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§Do you have experience in a role which requires relationship management experience?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

jobText: TXT/50733525.txt	§GOING NOWHERE IN YOUR CURRENT JOB?§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§GOING NOWHERE IN YOUR CURRENT JOB?§§Advertiser: §Harcourts The Difference§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§13 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Rodney & North Shore§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Real Estate & Property§, §Residential Sales§§§§§§A lot of people say they love property. A fortunate few actually take this feeling and turn it into a business.§  §It's not easy and it requires perseverance and dedication, but lifelong financial freedom and independence can be yours for as long as you desire.§  §When you become a real estate salesperson you really are starting your own business. Further information is noted on the company’s website (www.ypm.co.nz).§THIS ROLE:                           §The Body Corporate Manager, in tandem with a Facilities Coordinator, is responsible for key services to be delivered to a defined building portfolio.§                                                §Specifically the Body Corporate Manager is responsible for:                        §Advising body corporate chairs and committees regarding the Unit Titles Act 2010 and 2011 Unit Title Regulations§Assisting chairpersons and committee members in discharging their duties and powers§Representing YPM  more generally in its relationships with the relevant body corporate chairpersons and their members§Representing the company in meetings and minuting of body corporate management committees (generally quarterly) and annual general and any special meetings§Liaising closely with the YPM Facilities Coordinator servicing the shared client portfolio§Health & Safety§Liaising with client suppliers where relevant§Other body corporate contracts and administration functions as defined by the Managing Director§The Body Corporate Manager is part of a small team consisting of a Managing Director, two further Body Corporate Managers, three Facilities Coordinators, two Accounting Managers, three Accounting Officers and two Administration Managers.§Flexibility to attend after-hours meetings is essential.§ §ROLE REPORTS TO:§          Managing Director§INTERPERSONAL CONTACTS:§Internal:                                  §Managing Director, Accounting Managers, Other Body Corporate Managers, Facilities Coordinators, Administration Managers, Accounts Officers§External:                                §Body Corporate Chairs, Body Corporate Management Committees, Body Corporate owners, property managers Contract & services suppliers and potential suppliers, Regulatory organisations, External Facilities Managers§ §KEY RESPONSIBILITIES AND OUTCOMES TO BE ACHIEVED BY THE POSITION OF BODY CORPORATE MANAGER§As company representative§Acting as the company’s overall manager of a defined portfolio of bodies corporate. The Body Corporate Manager is the first point of contact for most issues related to the bodies corporate in his or her portfolio§Building strong and effective relationships with body corporate chairpersons and committee members.§Representing the company at body corporate meetings (Annual, Quarterly, Special) for a defined portfolio of bodies corporate. This will include delivering reports on both financial and facilities management, noting that the position is not involved in preparing accounts or accounting reports, only in tabling them at body corporate meetings and taking any questions (full support provided by Managing Director, and Accounting Managers). In a similar vein facilities management reports to be presented are provided by the relevant Facilities Coordinator. The Body Corporate Manager role also includes production of meeting minutes and delivery to chairpersons for approval.§Being responsible for the overall organisation of these meetings (in concert with the relevant Administration Manager)§Providing clear and accurate advice to body corporate chairs and committees on the Unit Titles Act 2010 and 2011 Regulations and the relevant body corporate operational rules and any other statutory and regulatory requirements (in concert with the Managing Director and relevant Facilities Coordinator)§ Deliverables:§Customer relations:§Management of YPM’s relationship with Body Corporate Chairs and Management Committees§Dealing with and responding to general enquiries from customers (noting that specific responses on many issues will be handled by the relevant Accounting Manager or Facilities Coordinator)§Major projects administration, to potentially include such areas as:§Long-term maintenance plans§Refurbishment projects§Earthquake strengthening (liaise with an external Project Manager)§Weather tightness (liaise with an external Project Manager)§Budgeting:§Preparation of body corporate annual budgets in concert with the relevant Accounting organisation of meetings, all relevant documentation, and postings to company website§Managing Director regarding insurance§§ §Health and Safety§Advising body corporate chair and committees of H&S legislatory requirements§Understanding of and knowledge of legal framework§Compliance with YPM H&S directives§Identify and remedy H&S issues before they escalate§Attain suitable accreditation§ §Any other body corporate and/or office administration functions as required by the Managing Director§ §PERSON SPECIFICATION§The following skills and background would be an advantage:§Relevant tertiary or jobText: TXT/50633166.txt	§PASSIONATE PROPERTY MANAGER§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§PASSIONATE PROPERTY MANAGER§§Advertiser: §Erskine & Owen§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§25 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Salary§§$70,000 - $89,999§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Real Estate & Property§, §Residential Leasing & Property Management§§§§§§Let it be your time to shine!§  §Point Property and Portfolio Management are a growing and innovative property company. Directing and advising on the management of our clients' property portfolios is a key part of our business. With our sister companies, we are specialists in advice, acquisition and directing of clients' investment portfolios.  We pride ourselves in offering a property management service that goes beyond the basics to take a pro-active and strategic approach in maximising the performance of our clients' portfolios.§  §We are seeking an experienced property manager to look after a medium size portfolio and grow the portfolio.    Success for us is in our team, they are the reason why we have happy clients who achieve good investment results.   We are looking for a person who loves to play on  a team, likes to enjoy team social interaction  and strives to see all players become become stars.§  §You will have sound  knowledge of the RTA and understand  the importance of ensuring new legislation is complied with.  §  §With your experience you know that communication, attention to detail and maintaining processes is the success of a great property manager.§  §We are based in smart new  offices in Newmarket.  A good base salary and a generous commission/bonus structure is offered, along with a company car and carpark.§  §If you are ready for your next challenge and want to work in a progressive company with diverse career opportunities, be a star now and apply.§  §Applicants must have at least 3 years work experience in NZ/Australia and hold a NZ drivers licence.§  §Please submit your CV and cover letter via the Seek website for consideration.§  § §§§§

jobText: TXT/50725581.txt	§Senior Investment Analyst§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Investment Analyst§§Advertiser: §salt§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§12 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Real Estate & Property§, §Analysts§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Senior Investment Analyst §      §        §Our client, a thriving New Zealand property development and investment company has an exciting newly-created career opportunity for a Big 4 CA trained or Management Consulting Senior Analyst. With their specialist expertise, they have projects ranging from large scale, medium to high-end developments in urban environments and historic precincts. Based in beautiful offices in the Auckland CBD, you will work with a team of passionate, smart, entrepreneurial people in a growing business that plenty of exciting projects.§        §ABOUT THE ROLE§        §You will support the Director/CFO in new business investigations, analysis of current projects and negotiating of new tenancy arrangements. This will be a multi-faceted role where there will be plenty of challenge, variety and solid mentoring along the way. Bring your roll your sleeves up attitude, intelligence, thirst for learning and you will be rewarded. Your responsibilities will include:§        §· Monitor the financial performance of existing developments§        §· Prepare feasibilities for new developments, running scenarios and reporting§        §· Analysing new development and investment opportunities§        §· Assist in due diligence process and follow-up consultants§        §· Assist in establishing bank facilities including coordination of satisfaction of conditions precedent, managing lawyers on generating and processing loan documentation§        §· Writing investment recommendations for new projects§        § §        §YOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE§        §You will be degree qualified in property, finance or similar. You will be a Senior Analyst in a Big 4 Chartered Accounting firm or within a high-profile Management Consulting firm. You will have strong analytical and financial skills, an ability to build solid relationships with a range of stakeholders internally and externally. Your professional approach, intelligence and can-do attitude will be well rewarded in this growing business.§        §BENEFITS§        §A competitive salary, yearly performance bonus and mobile phone will be included in the package. You will work in attractive offices in Auckland CBD with a team of passionate, committed individuals in a business that has a range of interesting projects where you will be at the forefront of new investment opportunities. §        §Keen to hear more? Please click on the apply button below and send your CV. §        §Salt is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy.§      §      §      §    §    §Level 1, 1 Vinegar Lane, Grey Lynn, Auckland 1021§  §§§Our client, a thriving New Zealand property development and investment company has an exciting newly-created career opportunity for a Big 4 CA trained or Management Consulting Senior Analyst. With their specialist expertise, they have projects ranging from large scale, medium to high-end developments in urban environments and historic precincts. Based in beautiful offices in the Auckland CBD, you will work with a team of passionate, smart, entrepreneurial people in a growing business that plenty of exciting projects.§ABOUT THE ROLE§You will support the Director/CFO in new business investigations, analysis of current projects and negotiating of new tenancy arrangements. This will be a multi-faceted role where there will be plenty of challenge, variety and solid mentoring along the way. Bring your roll your sleeves up attitude, intelligence, thirst for learning and you will be rewarded. Your responsibilities will include:§· Monitor the financial performance of existing developments§· Prepare feasibilities for new developments, running scenarios and reporting§· Analysing new development and investment opportunities§· Assist in due diligence process and follow-up consultants§· Assist in establishing bank facilities including coordination of satisfaction of conditions precedent, managing lawyers on generating and processing loan documentation§· Writing investment recommendations for new projects§ §YOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE§You will be degree qualified in property, finance or similar. You will be a Senior Analyst in a Big 4 Chartered Accounting firm or within a high-profile Management Consulting firm. You will have strong analytical and financial skills, an ability to build solid relationships with a range of stakeholders internally and externally. Your professional approach, intelligence and can-do attitude will be well rewarded in this growing business.§BENEFITS§A competitive salary, yearly performance bonus and mobile phone will be included in the package. You will work in attractive offices in Auckland CBD with a team of passionate, committed individuals in a business that has a range of interesting projects where you will be at the forefront of new investment opportunities. §Keen to hear more? Please click on the apply button below and send your CV. §Salt is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50758341.txt	§Executive General Manager Property§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Executive General Manager Property§§Advertiser: §KiwiRail§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§16 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Real Estate & Property§, §Other§§§§§§§§§  §    §      §      §        §Executive General Manager Property §        §          §KiwiRail is one of New Zealand's largest landowners and a significant landlord with 18,000ha of land, more than 1500 buildings and a property portfolio worth $3.6 billion. We take our role seriously as guardians of the rail corridor for future generations, securing and protecting active rail land while disposing of assets that are no longer needed to fund future rail investments.§          §The role Executive General Manager, Property takes a lead role in the transformation of our business, driving the delivery of KiwiRail's agreed property strategy and ensuring the leverage of our property to create new value to the organisation. In this role you will provide strategic direction, transformation leadership and translate this into tactical business plans, implementing these across the property portfolio as we undergo significant business change, growth and innovation. You will provide expertise in all property related matters and act as a trusted advisor to the Group CEO, Board and members of the Executive team, bringing innovative opportunities to enhance the group property strategy. This leadership role will lead our property group, driving engagement, capability, performance and diversity and will champion a customer led culture that supports growth and delivery.§          §To be considered for this opportunities you will have senior leadership experience within the New Zealand property or planning/development sector and have successfully managed large teams. You will demonstrate expertise and understanding of the NZ government and political environment and the complexities of working within this and have excellent commercial and financial acumen that will drive commercial opportunities. Your breadth of experience will include previous roles where you have translated organisational strategies into tactical business plans in relation to property and your ability to develop of a range of investment models for major investment. Naturally we would expect you to have extensive statutory property legislation knowledge and a relevant degree in property, commerce or business.§          §Confidential enquiries can be made to §Pauline.brown@kiwirail.co.nz§        §        §        §      §      §    §  §§§KiwiRail is one of New Zealand's largest landowners and a significant landlord with 18,000ha of land, more than 1500 buildings and a property portfolio worth $3.6 billion. We take our role seriously as guardians of the rail corridor for future generations, securing and protecting active rail land while disposing of assets that are no longer needed to fund future rail investments.§The role Executive General Manager, Property takes a lead role in the transformation of our business, driving the delivery of KiwiRail's agreed property strategy and ensuring the leverage of our property to create new value to the organisation. In this role you will provide strategic direction, transformation leadership and translate this into tactical business plans, implementing these across the property portfolio as we undergo significant business change, growth and innovation. You will provide expertise in all property related matters and act as a trusted advisor to the Group CEO, Board and members of the Executive team, bringing innovative opportunities to enhance the group property strategy. This leadership role will lead our property group, driving engagement, capability, performance and diversity and will champion a customer led culture that supports growth and delivery.§To be considered for this opportunities you will have senior leadership experience within the New Zealand property or planning/development sector and have successfully managed large teams. You will demonstrate expertise and understanding of the NZ government and political environment and the complexities of working within this and have excellent commercial and financial acumen that will drive commercial opportunities. Your breadth of experience will include previous roles where you have translated organisational strategies into tactical business plans in relation to property and your ability to develop of a range of investment models for major investment. Naturally we would expect you to have extensive statutory property legislation knowledge and a relevant degree in property, commerce or business.§Confidential enquiries can be made to §Pauline.brown@kiwirail.co.nz§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Property Assets Officer Job in Otago - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50769720.txt	§Property Assets Officer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Property Assets Officer§§Advertiser: §Waitaki District Council§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§19 Oct 2020§§Location§§Otago§, §Rest of Otago§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Real Estate & Property§, §Other§§§§§§Full-time, permanent§ §Our Property team is seeking an enthusiastic and professional Property Assets Officer to undertake a variety of work involving property management, asset management, asset data improvement and professional technical property advice to ensure efficient and effective delivery of property services to the community.§ §Waitaki is one of New Zealand's most vibrant on-the-grow districts and home to great lakes, ski fields, cycle trails, epic tramping, fishing, and hunting, surf beaches and so much more. Award-winning restaurants, wineries, craft breweries, Steampunk and Oamaru's fascinating Victorian Precinct will be at your doorstep, along with Aotearoa's longest national heartland cycleway (the Alps to Ocean) and the fabulous Waitaki Whitestone Geopark. Add to this affordable housing, great schools, and a real sense of community with no traffic jams.§ §The position§ §The Property Assets Officer plays a critical role in ensuring we maximise the use of our investments by establishing long term maintenance programmes and planning for the sustainable replacement of assets. This Property Assets Officer also ensures the most appropriate return on property interests whilst balancing commercial interests, income generation and social responsibilities to provide affordable facilities for the benefit of the community.§ §You'll be based in our Oamaru office and responsible for:§ § §Providing specialist technical expertise and professional advice on all property matters§ §Undertaking all aspects of leasing and property management including acquisitions and disposals§ §Developing, maintaining, and improving data in the property asset management system for maintenance and renewal work programmes for Council owned property§ §Assisting with developing the infrastructure strategy, asset management plans, policies, technical drawings, and strategies relating to property assets§ §Developing, maintaining, and implementing capital works and maintenance programmes for property assets§ §Ensure planned work is carried out to a high standard, on time and within budget§ §To be successful in this role, you will have:§ § §A tertiary qualification or equivalent in asset management, project management or property related field§ §At least 3-5 years' successful experience in a property or asset-related industry§ §Proven analytical and problem-solving skills, based on a sound understanding of risk management principles§ §Excellent interpersonal communication, engagement, and relationship management skills§ §Enquiries regarding the position can be made to Renee Julius, Property Manager by calling §03 433 0300§.§ §Applications close 5pm Friday 13 November 2020.§ §To apply for this job and to view the position description go to: waitakidistrictcouncil.recruitmenthub.co.nz/Vacancies & enter ref code: 5252246. §§§§

jobText: TXT/50773321.txt	§Tenancy Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Tenancy Manager§§Advertiser: §Emerge Aotearoa§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§19 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Porirua & Kapiti Coast§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Real Estate & Property§, §Residential Leasing & Property Management§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Tenancy Manager §      §        §§        §          §Our vision is Tautokohia te mana tangata, Realising potential§          §Our purpose is whakapakari ngatahi I te whanau kia puawai te hapori, to strengthen whanau together, so that communities thrive§          §Our Organisation offers many development opportunities, with values that define all that we do§        §        §Emerge Aotearoa is a social services organisation providing a range of services to whānau, including Health and Disability, Youth and Emergency Housing. Our kaimahi all have a common goal - helping people realise their potential with the aim of supporting people to live their best life as independently as possible.§        §About the role§        §We are looking for an experienced Tenancy Manager for our Housing First with some work across our other housing programmes, including transitional housing. The role will manage tenancies within the landmark Housing First initiative, where Emerge works in collaboration with other organisations to place long term chronically homeless directly into housing and work to sustain those tenancies. This role will be based in the Aro Mai Housing First office in Wellington City for up to three days per week, the remaining two days would be based in our Porirua or Lower Hutt offices.§        §The role involves carrying out property inspections, managing all lease documentation, managing tenant financial contributions, managing turnover and working in partnership with other team members and circumstances§          §Excellent communication written, verbal and listening skills§          §Effective time management skills, including the ability to meet deadlines§          §It would be This is a true co-ordination position and is pivotal to the running of the team and making it all happen.§Providing general administration support to a team of 6 people it is varied, busy, fast paced and you will be 'in the know' of all that we have on. The role ranges from dealing with staff requests via the portal, processing claims, purchase orders and invoices to dealing with our contractors and external and internal stakeholders.§We are looking for a real go getter, someone who enjoys being in a supporting/ administrative position and can hold the team together, likes a busy role and gets a kick of being efficient and helpful. There is room for system and operational improvement so a forward and fresh thinking approach is what this role and team needs.§We are looking for someone with;§Two to three years office administration/ co-ordination experience in a similar environment - contracts and or asset administration experience would be ideal§Strong customer service skills and an ability to work magic with customers§Be able to work independently with initiative and be a strong team player§Strong attention and eye for detail§An outgoing and people centric personality§Tech savvy and able to pick up systems well and work with multiple systems at one time.§Can manage a multiple of tasks and is action orientated and does well under pressure§A strong communicator who is able to build and maintain effective internal and external relationships§Some knowledge of accounting aspects such as payables and budgeting would be of an advantage§Some knowledge of asset management and contractor management would be advantageous§At Tauranga City Council, we believe in supporting our talent and we offer a range of learning and development opportunities and flexible working conditions to help you achieve the most from your career.§If you're looking for a career where you can make a real difference then we would love to hear from you and have you join our team!§To read the position description, please click Apply to be directed to our Careers Page.§Applications close 2nd November 2020 at 11:55pm.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

the talents of our people; and consistent excellence in operational delivery sets us apart. §We have entered into a long term Asset Management and Facilities Management Contract with the Department of Corrections and the Ministry of Justice. Prison environments are demanding and workflows can be unpredictable. You will need to be well organised and be able to multi-task.  You will take ownership of the site and be prepared to manage high priority or complex jobs on weekends and after hours.§§A bit about you:§§You will be a strong and energetic people leader with well-developed relationship management ability, good commercial acumen, and current facilities management experience and will bring with you; Management qualification and/or demonstrated management skills and experience;§Minimum 7 years’ current experience within the facilities management industry;§Demonstrated experience in managing a 24/7 critical function facility (prison, hospital, emergency complex);§Strong analytical and numeric skills and demonstrated commercial acumen;§Experience in driving operational activities to ensure quality is achieved, work is completed to schedule and, rework is minimised;§Strong oral and written communication skills;§Ownership, commitment and an ability to meet deadlines;§Current working knowledge of the Health and Safety at Work Act 2015;§Working knowledge of building compliance and regulatory requirements;§Intermediate level of computer literacy including MS Outlook, Word, and, Excel.§§A role with us can enables you to develop and enhance your skills and experience.  This is a great opportunity for you to join our diverse and inclusive culture and be part of a great team thriving in a collaborative fast-paced environment.  We will reward you with great training and ongoing development, and the opportunity to advance your career within our organisation. §If this sounds like the opportunity for you, head to §www.downercareers.co.nz§ and enter reference number 572023 to apply. §    §Downer NZ is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a diverse and inclusive culture.§ §§Our workplaces are drug and alcohol free - all successful applicants will be required to undertake a pre-employment drug test and medical. § §§§§

jobText: TXT/50783659.txt	§Portfolio Manager, Crown Property§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Portfolio Manager, Crown Property§§Advertiser: §Land Information New Zealand§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§20 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Real Estate & Property§, §Other§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Portfolio Manager, Crown Property §      §      §      §        §At Land Information New Zealand (LINZ), we underpin New Zealand's success with information about ‘where' - ensuring New Zealand has accurate information about where people and places are, that people have confidence in their property rights, now and for future generations.§        §Our Crown Property group provides the leadership and direction for Crown-owned property, looking for opportunities to maximise these assets for the benefit of New Zealanders. Day-to-day, we manage about two million hectares of Crown land, including surplus Crown assets, commercial and residential properties, pastoral leases and forestry licences.§        §To further support our Crown Property group in the vital work we do, we are searching for Portfolio Managers, to help us provide management and oversight across a nationwide portfolio of exciting, complex, and challenging projects.  You'll undertake the core disposal of land functions for LINZ managed properties set aside and held for Treaty settlement purposes.  This role also includes monitoring LINZ's compliance with post settlement commitments that will enhance the Crown/Māori partnership relationship.  This role gives you the opportunity to see a tangible impact from the work you are doing helping New Zealanders, on a national basis.§        §Key to succeeding in this role will be your communication skills. You'll be collaborating across various iwi/Māori groups and work together with Te Arawhiti primarily but also with other government departments to facilitate the transfer of Treaty redress.  Some experience in land registration and negotiation for the sale and purchase of property would assist you in this role but training will be provided.§        §With your knowledge of land and property management, you'll apply your experience to proactively continue developing your expertise as you contribute to the development of Crown Property portfolio understanding and management practices. Our work can be reactive at times, you'll have worked in agile, networked ways previously and will be confident in your ability to support the delivery of the team functions and apply a "continuous improvement" mindset to the work you are doing.§        §At LINZ we aim to set our new staff up for success and long-term opportunities for professional development and enjoyable career pathways with us. If you feel you demonstrate the capabilities and skills listed above and, in the PD, then we would like to hear from you.§        § §        §How to Apply§        §To apply, please click §"Apply Online."§ You'll be taken through to our LINZ Careers Centre where you'll be able to review further information about the responsibilities and accountabilities of this role in the Position Description. You'll be able to complete your online application form and upload a copy of your CV and Cover Letter. §        §Please keep in mind when including your CV and Cover Letter to specifically highlight the capabilities and skills listed in the above ad and the position description. We're not just all about formal professional experience here at LINZ, if your application also includes some information about the community engagement or volunteering work you've done - we'd love to hear about it!§        § §        §Applications close Wednesday 4th November 2020§        §Please see the attached position description for further detail. For further information on this role please contact opportunities@linz.govt.nz and a member of our Recruitment Team will be in touch with you.§        §      §      §      §    §    §  §§§At Land Information New Zealand (LINZ), we underpin New Zealand's success with information about ‘where' - ensuring New Zealand has accurate information about where people and places are, that people have confidence in their property rights, now and for future generations.§Our Crown Property group provides the leadership and direction for Crown-owned property, looking for opportunities to maximise these assets for the benefit of New Zealanders. Day-to-day, we manage about two million hectares of Crown land, including surplus Crown assets, commercial and residential properties, pastoral leases and forestry licences.§To further support our Crown Property group in the vital work we do, we are searching for Portfolio Managers, to help us provide management and oversight across a nationwide portfolio of exciting, complex, and challenging projects.  You'll undertake the core disposal of land functions for LINZ managed properties set aside and held for Treaty settlement purposes.  This role also includes monitoring LINZ's compliance with post settlement commitments that will enhance the Crown/Māori partnership relationship.  This role gives you the opportunity to see a tangible impact from the work you are doing helping New Zealanders, on a national basis.§Key to succeeding in this role will be your communication skills. You'll be collaborating across various iwi/Māori groups and work together with Te Arawhiti primarily but also with other government departments to facilitate the transfer of Treaty redress.  Some experience in land registration and negotiation for the sale and purchase of property would assist you in this role but training will be provided.§With your knowledge of land and property management, you'll apply your experience to proactively continue developing your expertise as you contribute to the development of Crown Property portfolio understanding and management practices. Our work can be reactive at times, you'll have worked in agile, networked ways previously and will be confident in your ability to support the delivery of the team functions and apply a "continuous improvement" mindset to the work you are doing.§At LINZ we aim to set our new staff up for success and long-term opportunities for professional development and enjoyable career pathways with us. If you feel you demonstrate the capabilities and skills listed above and, in the PD, then we would like to hear from you.§ §How to Apply§To apply, please click §"Apply Online."§ You'll be taken through to our LINZ Careers Centre where you'll be able to review further information about the responsibilities and accountabilities of this role in the Position Description. You'll be able to complete your online application form and upload a copy of your CV and Cover Letter. §Please keep in mind when including your CV and Cover Letter to specifically highlight the capabilities and skills listed in the above ad and the position description. We're not just all about formal professional experience here at LINZ, if your application also includes some information about the community engagement or volunteering work you've done - we'd love to hear about it!§ §§Applications close Wednesday 4th November 2020§§Please see the attached position description for further detail. For further information on this role please contact opportunities@linz.govt.nz and a member of our Recruitment Team will be in touch with you.§        §§§§

jobText: TXT/50787771.txt	§TGH Summer Internship 2020/21§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§TGH Summer Internship 2020/21§§Advertiser: §Tainui Group Holdings§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Oct 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Hamilton§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Real Estate & Property§, §Other§§§§§§Tainui Group Holdings §(TGH)§ is responsible for managing the commercial assets of Waikato-Tainui.  Underpinned by the unifying principles of Kiingitanga, our core business is focussed on identifying and growing high quality assets, and to provide consistent, long term dividends to current and future generations of Waikato-Tainui.§ Our summer internship programme is an extension of our commitment to identifying talent, and growing strengths and attributes while developing leaders.  We are currently seeking applications from motivated tertiary students who are interested in working as interns in our dynamic work environment.§ §This summer internship programme runs for ten weeks, Monday to Thursday between 16 November 2020 and 12 February 2021.  The purpose of the internship is to provide an opportunity for students to gain direct experience related to their field of study and to make meaningful contributions to Waikato-Tainui.  There will be a Christmas closedown period from Wednesday 23 December and will reopen on Monday 11 January 2021.§ The internship programme aims to provide:§ § §Work related experiences in the student’s field of study or area of interest;§ §Transportable and transferable skills that are applicable to a range of contexts;§ §Opportunities to apply theory to practice;§ §Professional experience to include in the student’s curriculum vitae;§ §Opportunities to develop decision-making and analytical skills;§ §Useful networks that may lead to future employment.§ § Successful applicants will have the opportunity to work with experienced industry leaders and will be assigned a workplace mentor at the commencement of the programme. § §INTERNSHIP STIPEND§ $5,000 will be paid directly to interns in instalments on the completion of set milestones.§ §SELECTION CRITERIA§ Successful applicants will be:§ § §Waikato-Tainui, Maaori or indigenous students who wish to develop and apply their skills;§ §In their last year of study at the undergraduate level or enrolled in postgraduate or Masters study§ (this internship is not open to PhD students or previous TGH interns§);§ §Available to work full time Monday to Thursday from 16 November 2020 to 12 February 2021;§ §Appropriately qualified and have the requisite skills and knowledge to complete the project or work programme;§ §Required to participate in an interview and selection process;§ §Open to feedback, critique and reflection during the course of the programme.§ § §APPLICATION PROCESS§Complete the screening questionnaire and submit the application form no later than §12 noon§, §30 October 2020§1. Select area/s of interest.§2. Provide supporting information: § §A cover letter explaining why you have chosen to apply for an internship at TGH;§ §CV detailing qualifications, work experience and skills; and§ §Your academic transcript. § § 3.  If you are Waikato-Tainui affiliated, you will require kaumatua confirmation of your whakapapa or confirmation of your registration on the Waikato-Tainui registry database.§4.  Apply online with your application and supporting information via our Careers site https://www.tgh.co.nz/en/careers/ §5.  Participate in an interview and selection process.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Are you willing to undergo a pre-employment medical check?§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have native or bilingual proficiency in any languages other than English?§§§

jobTitle: Building Manager Job in Otago - SEEK
xenophobe: right to live and work
jobText: TXT/50782887.txt	§Building Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Building Manager§§Advertiser: §Skyline Enterprises§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§20 Oct 2020§§Location§§Otago§, §Queenstown & Wanaka§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Real Estate & Property§, §Commercial Sales, Leasing & Property Mgmt§§§§§§  §Skyline Enterprises is a pioneering New Zealand company that owns and operates a diverse range of businesses: gondola, luge and related food and beverage operations; international luge operations, adventure, aviation and marine activities, casino and entertainment operations, accommodation businesses and ownership and rental of Queenstown commercial properties. Established in 1966, Skyline Enterprises is based in Queenstown with operations throughout New Zealand and internationally in Canada, Singapore and South Korea. §Reporting directly to the Property Manager, the Building Manager will assist in managing our central Queenstown commercial and residential property interests. This is a varied role where daily tasks may include (but would not be limited to) dealing with building maintenance issues, ensuring building compliance, answering queries from tenants or the general public and meeting contractors to discuss repairs. §The ability to support tenants and stakeholders with thorough and transparent communication skills, along with strategic project and maintenance management of the physical buildings themselves is of utmost importance. You will build genuine relationships with internal and external stakeholders to create a long-lasting rapport between Skyline and our tenant base, whilst also being practical and eager to get hands-on when needed in order to complete tasks and achieve desired outcomes. §Ideal candidates will have:§Ø The means to multi-task and prioritise workload, especially during busy periods§Ø An ability to learn quickly, to ‘think on your feet’ and adapt to situations as they present themselves in order to reach prompt resolutions.§Ø Exceptional communication, administration and organisational skills§Ø A keen eye for detail and a problem-solving mindset §Ø A natural ability to build and foster lasting relationships§Ø A willingness to progress and identify learning opportunities§Ø The ability to approach maintenance issues with a logical and investigative mindset, where a base understanding of maintenance problems allows you to collaborate with contactors to develop logical plans with efficient and pragmatic conclusions.§Ø A good level of IT literacy, including Office 365 and Outlook.§Ø A minimum of 5 years working in property management§Ø A full and clean New Zealand driving licence.  §Previous experience in commercial property management is essential. Management of residential entities would also be beneficial for this role, along with a working understanding of current New Zealand Health & Safety regulations. You should have solid references to back up your experience and a proven track record of meeting operational targets.§In return, Skyline offer a competitive remuneration package along with Skyline Group benefit So, if the above sounds like you, and you are keen to take your next career step, then please apply with a CV and covering letter outlining your experience and suitability for the role. §For a copy of the Job Description visit §Building-Manager-JD-2020-docxJS-003.pdf§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50785193.txt	§Site Facilities Manager - Northern Corrections Facility§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Site Facilities Manager - Northern Corrections Facility§§Advertiser: §DOWNER NZ§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Oct 2020§§Location§§Northland§, §Rest of Northland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Real Estate & Property§, §Body Corporate & Facilities Management§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Site Facilities Manager - Northern Corrections Facility §      §        §Downer New Zealand is a leading provider of integrated services.  Our commitment to building long term relationships and supporting our customers with high calibre services and solutions; the talents of our people; and consistent excellence in operational delivery sets us apart. §        §We have entered into a long term Asset Management and Facilities Management Contract with the Department of Corrections and the Ministry of Justice. We are currently seeking a Site Facilities Manager to join our team at the Northern Corrections Facility.§        §About your role:§        §Our Site Facilities Manager is a critical role within our business with responsibility for leading a large technical team; ensuring on time, quality and, safe jobs delivery and managing workflows over a 24/7 period. In this role, you will see yourself:§        §          §Driving a strong commitment to Health & Safety;§          §Using a contemporary leadership style to support your team with solid technical solutions;§          §Understanding and managing a KPI Driven environment;§          §Using your financial skills; including cost containment and productivity management§          §Working autonomously and as part of the broader Downer Team§        §        §This is not a job for the faint hearted. Prison environments are demanding and workflows can be unpredictable. You will need to be well organised and be able to multi-task.  You will take ownership of the site and be prepared to manage high priority or complex jobs on weekends and after hours.§        §A bit about you:§        §You will be a strong people leader with well-developed relationship management ability, good commercial acumen and current facilities management experience and will bring with you;§        §          §Management qualification and/or demonstrated management skills and experience;§          §Minimum 7 years’ current experience within the facilities management industry;§          §Demonstrated experience in managing a 24/7 critical function facility (prison, hospital, emergency complex);§          §Strong analytical and numeric skills and demonstrated commercial acumen;§          §Experience in driving operational activities to ensure quality is achieved, work is completed to schedule and, rework is minimised;§          §Strong oral and written communication skills;§          §Ownership, commitment and an ability to meet deadlines;§          §Current working knowledge of the Health and Safety at Work Act 2015;§          §Working knowledge of building compliance and regulatory requirements;§          §Intermediate level of computer literacy including MS Outlook, Word and, Excel.§        §        §A role with us can enables you to develop and enhance your skills and experience.  This is a great opportunity for you to join our diverse and inclusive culture and be part of a great team thriving in a collaborative fast-paced environment.  We will reward you with great training and ongoing development, and the opportunity to advance your career within our organisation. §        §If this sounds like the opportunity for you, head to §www.downercareers.co.nz§ and enter reference number 569265 to apply. §    §        §Downer NZ is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a diverse and inclusive culture.§ §        §Our workplaces are drug and alcohol free - all successful applicants will be required to undertake a pre-employment drug test and medical. §      §      §      §    §    §www.downer.co.nz§  §§§Downer New Zealand is a leading provider of integrated services.  Our commitment to building long term relationships and supporting our customers with high calibre services and solutions; the talents of our people; and consistent excellence in operational delivery sets us apart. §We have entered into a long term Asset Management and Facilities Management Contract with the Department of Corrections and the Ministry of Justice. Prison environments are demanding and workflows can be unpredictable. You will need to be well organised and be able to multi-task.  You will take ownership of the site and be prepared to manage high priority or complex jobs on weekends and after hours.§§A bit about you:§You will be a strong people leader with well-developed relationship management ability, good commercial acumen and current facilities management experience and will bring with you;§§Management qualification and/or demonstrated management skills and experience;§Minimum 7 years’ current experience within the facilities management industry;§Demonstrated experience in managing a 24/7 critical function facility (prison, hospital, emergency complex);§Strong analytical and numeric skills and demonstrated commercial acumen;§Experience in driving operational activities to ensure quality is achieved, work is completed to schedule and, rework is minimised;§Strong oral and written communication skills;§Ownership, commitment and an ability to meet deadlines;§Current working knowledge of the Health and Safety at Work Act 2015;§Working knowledge of building compliance and regulatory requirements;§Intermediate level of computer literacy including MS Outlook, Word and, Excel.§§A role with us can enables you to develop and enhance your skills and experience.  This is a great opportunity for you to join our diverse and inclusive culture and be part of a great team thriving in a collaborative fast-paced environment.  We will reward you with great training and ongoing development, and the opportunity to advance your career within our organisation. §If this sounds like the opportunity for you, head to §www.downercareers.co.nz§ and enter reference number 569265 to apply. §    §Downer NZ is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a diverse and inclusive culture.§ §§Our workplaces are drug and alcohol free - all successful applicants will be required to undertake a pre-employment drug test and medical. §§§§

DPM have experienced strong year on year growth in A-Grade listings, where we service a broad spectrum of properties including family homes, apartments, multi-units and town houses. Our current business model is proven to generate surplus rental returns for investors. § §DPM investors are located nationwide as well as several off-shore owners. Investors range from first time landlords to experienced property investors / property developers. § §Who we are looking for:§We are looking for an energetic, organised and self-driven individual with natural people skills and a flair for dealing with our stakeholders.§ §The person will play a vital role in continuing to help grow the business. The person will need to bring proven experience in relationship building with new and existing clients, a 'can-do' attitude and a natural desire to support our owners/investors, tenants and contractors.§ §Key responsibilities will include (but are not limited to):§ § §Extensive use of Re-Leased (cloud-based property management software), including raising invoices/expenses, reviewing and updating property/tenant/owner details, importing lease details, running ad-hoc reports/analysis§ §Negotiate and execute Tenancy Agreements within the boundaries of the Residential Tenancies Act 1986.§ §Source tenants - review applications, credit checks, background checks (incl. social media)§ §Build up and manage a database of tenants and respond to enquiries on a daily basis§ §Undertake property inspections; including routine, entry and exit - using Inspection Express (iPad software)§ §Prepare professional responses to queries (owners, tenants, contractors)§ §Advise owners on compliance and tenancy legislation, for example Healthy Homes § §Facilitate repairs and maintenance, including liaising with our trusted contractors and prioritising urgent jobs§ §Follow up with maintenance items and other pending jobs/work orders at a given property§ §Organise, scan and file property documents in a systematic manner, electronically§ §Keep up to date with the rental/property market, including preparing material for newsletters and marketing purposes§ §Various administrative tasks§ §If this sounds like you, get in touch!§Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.§For further information on our business, please feel free to view our website https://www.dpmgroup.nz/§If you wish to apply for the role, please send your CV to Mary Smith - §marysmith@dpmgroup.nz§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§Are you available to work outside your usual hours when required? (e.g. weekends, evenings, public holidays)§§§

jobText: TXT/50804972.txt	§Property Advisor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Property Advisor§§Advertiser: §Ministry of Education§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§23 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Real Estate & Property§, §Other§§§§§§Kia ora, Bula Vinaka, Fakaalofa lahi atu, Fakatalofa atu, Kia orana, Malo e lelei, Malo ni, Talofa lava, Tena koutou katoa, and welcome.§Permanent, full-time§Relationship management§Asset management§Strategic vision§Help shape the future of education§At the Ministry of Education, we work together to shape an education system that delivers equitable and excellent outcomes.§Our organisation is made up of more than 3,000 talented and committed people around New Zealand, from a wide range of backgrounds and cultures.§While we work in different groups and on different things, we all strive every day to make the biggest difference we can for every child, young person and adult student in our education system.§About us§Education Infrastructure Service (EIS), a part of the Ministry of Education, manages the Crown's second largest property portfolio of around 2,100 schools with a book value of $18.3 billion, the largest payroll in the country, and transportation of over 100,000 students to and from school each day.§Our vision for school property is that all schools have quality learning environments as part of a well-managed and sustainable portfolio that helps deliver equitable and excellent outcomes for every child.§About the role§You will be providing advice and support for the management of a portfolio of schools over the short, medium and long term to meet ongoing and future educational requirements.§Your Key Priorities will include the following:§Developing effective relationships and trust with schools§Working with individual Schools to develop an asset management plan so they are effectively managing and maintaining their school property and infrastructure§Ensuring schools implement projects and spending supports the school's pedagogy and/or Ministry Asset Strategy§Following and working within Ministry and EIS policy, procedures and guidelines and providing the right advice to schools§Ensuring Ministry information and data is kept up to date and accurate§Working collaboratively across the team to share technical knowledge and experience with others so all portfolios are well supported and there is consistent delivery of service§Working collaboratively with other teams within the Ministry and EIS to provide effective property and infrastructure solutions that support teaching and learning§Please note there is further information available in the attached job description.§About you§To be successful in this role you will need to be an amazing people person and be an excellent communicator with proven skills in building and managing strong, effective relationships. Your ability to understand your audience, their vision and motivations is critical. You will be able to adapt your communication style to be able to effectively deliver a range of messages to a variety of people.§You will also offer the following:§Demonstrated ability to plan and implement initiatives and achieve positive results§Ability to interpret, plainly articulate the intent, and apply policy appropriately§Ability to manage and prioritise competing demands§Problem solving, have the ability to apply a variety of approaches to solve problems or identify options to achieve great outcomes§Relevant professional qualification or experience such as asset management, project management, property management or construction.§A full, current and clean driver's licence§If you'd like to bring your skills to a challenging but rewarding role within an organisation that's continuously reaching goals and striving for a better future for New Zealand, we'd love to hear from you.§The team is high performing with a 'can-do' attitude. We work collaboratively to support each other to provide the region's schools an outstanding, professional service.§Are you ready to make a difference?§We welcome candidates from diverse backgrounds, including Māori, Pacific and those with disabilities, who will enrich our understanding of the education system.§As a government agency, the Ministry is committed to keeping to the Treaty of Waitangi's guiding principles in our work for and with Māori students, their whānau, hapū and iwi.§Please review the job description and if this opportunity interests you, and you meet the requirements, apply now using the 'Apply Online' button.§For further information please contact Stephanie Phillips at §eis.recruitment@education.govt.nz§§ Applications close midnight on Sunday, 8 November 2020.§Click here to view the role description§§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50804748.txt	§Infrastructure Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Infrastructure Manager§§Advertiser: §Ministry of Education§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§23 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Real Estate & Property§, §Other§§§§§§Kia ora, Bula Vinaka, Fakaalofa lahi atu, Fakatalofa atu, Kia orana, Malo e lelei, Malo ni, Talofa lava, Tena koutou katoa and welcome.§Permanent, full-time§Extensive background in asset management and service delivery§Strong relationship management skills§Lead a regionally based team responsible for providing front-line asset management advice and support to schools§Help shape the future of Education§At the Ministry of Education, we work together to shape an education system that delivers equitable and excellent outcomes.§Our organisation is made up of more than 3,000 talented and committed people around New Zealand, from a wide range of backgrounds and cultures.§While we work in different groups and on different things, we all strive every day to make the biggest difference we can for every child, young person and adult student in our education system.§About our group and team§Education Infrastructure Service (EIS), a part of the Ministry of Education, manages the Crown's second largest property portfolio of around 2,100 schools with a book value of $18.3 billion, the largest payroll in the country, and transportation of over 100,000 students to and from school each day.§Our vision for school property is that all schools have quality learning environments as part of a well-managed and sustainable portfolio that helps deliver equitable and excellent outcomes for every child.§Infrastructure Advisory Services is a team within the Education Infrastructure Service which provides support and guidance to state schools in the management of crown owned property and in undertaking property related work on school land and buildings.§ About this role§The Infrastructure Manager reports to the Regional Infrastructure Manager and leads a regionally based group responsible for providing asset management advice and support to schools across the region. The position also plays a key role in issues resolution and school property portfolio planning activities at a regional level.§Your key priorities will include:§developing and maintaining strong and constructive working relationships with schools, their property professionals and with the local Sector Enablement and Support Education teams and other Ministry teams at a local and national level§leading and managing the local Infrastructure Delivery team to ensure effective and efficient operational management of the school property portfolio§leading asset management planning and implementation activities within the allocated geographic area§managing a small case load of schools (generally for schools with more complex property issues or that are of strategic interest) and act as the primary relationship manager for these schools on all matters related to property management.§Please note that there is more information available in the attached job description.§About you§You will have an extensive background in infrastructure, property and/or asset management (private and/or public sector) with significant focus on relationship management and problem solving and a track record of success and results in team management.§You will also offer:§a relevant tertiary qualification§an understanding of the mechanics of managing larger property portfolios§familiarity with public sector asset management principles and practices§well developed strategic and critical thinking skills and analytical capability§experience in effective risk management strategies and processes.§If you'd like to bring your skills to a rewarding role within an organisation that's continuously reaching goals and striving for a better future for New Zealand, we'd love to hear from you.§ Are you ready to make a difference?§We welcome candidates from diverse backgrounds, including Māori, Pacific and those with disabilities, who will enrich our understanding of the education system.§As a government agency, the Ministry is committed to keeping to the Treaty of Waitangi's guiding principles in our work for and with Māori students, their whānau, hapū and iwi.§Please review the job description attached and if this opportunity interests you, and you meet the requirements, please apply now using the 'apply online' button. §For further information please contact Stephanie Phillips at §eis.recruitment@education.govt.nz§§Applications close midnight on Sunday, 8 November 2020.§Click here to view the role description§§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50793780.txt	§Your Future In Real Estate Starts Here!§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Your Future In Real Estate Starts Here!§§Advertiser: §Harcourts Taupo§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§22 Oct 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Taupo§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Real Estate & Property§, §Residential Sales§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Your Future In Real Estate Starts Here! §      §        §People often say they love property but only a fortunate few take this feeling and turn it into a business.§        §By becoming a Real Estate salesperson, you are really starting your own business with the ability to be independent and be your own boss and the opportunity to have financial freedom. It requires dedication, passion and perseverance, knowing it's all on you to succeed and then receiving the direct benefits of all your hardwork is liberating and satisfying at the same time.§        §We are looking for motivated individuals who love problem solving and are seeking a faster way to financial freedom. §        §If you are interested in learning more about a career in Real Estate, register for our careers evening - Tuesday 17th November from 5.30pm at the Harcourts Turangi Office (2/79 Town Centre, Turangi)§        §We will cover:§        §- What it takes to succeed from salespeople who started from scratch and found success in their first year.§        §- The different ways to get started in real estate, just in case you aren't ready to jump in the deep end.§        §- What investment is required to launch your real estate career.§        §- What to look for when choosing an office to join.§        §- What to look for in a Manager.§        §- The next steps you need to take to give yourself the best possible chance to succeed.§        §Please click APPLY to complete our online application form registering your interest for our Careers Evening, or talk with us further about your career opportunities. §        §§      §      §073781112§info@harcourtstaupo.co.nz§ https://us02web.zoom.us/meeting/register/tZcrcuCtpjgoHNOvT_cWlvmZFmtIttWrTRtf §    §    §  §§§People often say they love property but only a fortunate few take this feeling and turn it into a business.§ §By becoming a Real Estate salesperson, you are really starting your own business with the ability to be independent and be your own boss and the opportunity to have financial freedom. It requires dedication, passion and perseverance, knowing it's all on you to succeed and then receiving the direct benefits of all your hardwork is liberating and satisfying at the same time.§ §We are looking for motivated individuals who love problem solving and are seeking a faster way to financial freedom. § §If you are interested in learning more about a career in Real Estate, register for our careers evening - Tuesday 17th November from 5.30pm at the Harcourts Turangi Office (2/79 Town Centre, Turangi)§ §We will cover:§ §- What it takes to succeed from salespeople who started from scratch and found success in their first year.§ §- The different ways to get started in real estate, just in case you aren't ready to jump in the deep end.§ §- What investment is required to launch your real estate career.§ §- What to look for when choosing an office to join.§ §- What to look for in a Manager.§ §- The next steps you need to take to give yourself the best possible chance to succeed.§ §Please click APPLY to complete our online application form registering your interest for our Careers Evening, or talk with us further about your career opportunities. §§§§

jobText: TXT/50807846.txt	§Real Estate Sales§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Real Estate Sales§§Advertiser: §REAP Recruitment§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§23 Oct 2020§§Location§§Hawkes Bay§, §Hastings§§Salary§§Harcourt's Hawkes Bay§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Real Estate & Property§, §Residential Sales§§§§§§§§§  §    §      §Real Estate Sales §    §    §      §RESIDENTIAL | COMMERCIAL | RURAL§  §Harcourt's Hawkes Bay are opening their doors and welcoming you to discover your true potential in the rewarding Real Estate industry. Come and hear how Real Estate can be the best career move you've ever made!§  § Already Licenced or completed your study?  Give us a call now to see how Harcourt's can assist with your successful Real Estate Career. Real Estate is an exciting and rewarding career, and at Harcourts they will show you the way to sales success. § We invite you to come along and have a no obligation and confidential chat with their Sales Managers to find out§        §          §What you need to get started§          §How much it will cost§          §How much you can earn§          §How Harcourts will help you succeed§        § Harcourt's was founded right here in New Zealand in 1888. When you find the right deal, you’ll need to be a pro at bargaining to create win-win situations.§        §Promoting teamwork and excellence§        §Working with your team, you’ll ensure that our business plan and objectives are achieved and meet agreed client expectations. Likewise you’ll be instrumental in retaining our best employees and use technology tools, data and analytics to create experience-rich environments for staff.§        §Sales and Leasing §        §You will provide direction and strategy for all things sales and leasing. As the real estate industry is a complex network, we’ll expect you to be proactive and at the forefront of learning its many facets.§        §Positive, with a ‘can do’ attitude:§ This is an important and dynamic role within JLL. It’s a fast paced environment and you’ll need to be fast paced as well. We have a continuous improvement mentality across our firm and we’ll be looking for you to have the same. We want somebody with an entrepreneurial mind-set and the internal drive to continuously hit goals and succeed.§        § §        §What you can expect from us:§        §You’ll join an entrepreneurial, inclusive culture. One where we succeed together – across the desk and around the globe. Where like-minded people work naturally together to achieve great things. Keep those ambitions in sights and imagine where JLL can take you...§        § §        §As an organisation, we don’t just accept that we are a place of many different people, but we embrace it, we celebrate it, and we proactively support the needs that difference brings. Join us to develop your strengths and enjoy a fulfilling career full of varied experiences. Keep those ambitions in sights and imagine where JLL can take you...§ § § §What are we looking for? § §We are searching for our Head of Office for the JLL Wellington office! This is a once in a lifetime opportunity.§ § § §What this job involves:§ §Knowing your market and winning new business§ §You’ll build further business, winning rapport with our clients property executives and be able to sway a potential new client to choose JLL over the competition. When you find the right deal, you’ll need to be a pro at bargaining to create win-win situations.§ §Promoting teamwork and excellence§ §Working with your team, you’ll ensure that our business plan and objectives are achieved and meet agreed client expectations. You will also promote team efficiency through goal setting and performance reviews and help keep them motivated by implementing our reward and recognition programs. Likewise you’ll be instrumental in retaining our best employees and use technology tools, data and analytics to create experience-rich environments for staff.§ §Sales and Leasing § §You will provide direction and strategy for all things sales and leasing. Your expertise will play a role in dealing with senior executives where you can carry out commercial negotiations with clients. You will support JLL’s position in the market place, leading to excellent client-centric services and allowing JLL to achieve ambitions.§ § § §Sound like you? To Apply, this is what we are looking for:§ §Experience and strong know-how in real estate:§ You will have robust property and asset management experience with an in depth knowledge of the local market and be very well networked in order to help grow the business!§ §Superb interpersonal skills and outstanding work ethic:§ Can you easily get along with people you work with? We’ll expect you to have strong verbal and written communication skills and you are reliable, flexible and always ready to help your team.§ §Strategic Management skills:§ Leading a team in charge of an extensive portfolio, you’ll make sure all members have the resources and support they need to perform at the top of their abilities consistently. As the real estate industry is a complex network, we’ll expect you to be proactive and at the forefront of learning its many facets.§ §Positive, with a ‘can do’ attitude:§ This is an important and dynamic role within JLL. It’s a fast paced environment and you’ll need to be fast paced as well. We have a continuous improvement mentality across our firm and we’ll be looking for you to have the same. We want somebody with an entrepreneurial mind-set and the internal drive to continuously hit goals and succeed.§ § § §What you can expect from us:§ §You’ll join an entrepreneurial, inclusive culture. One where we succeed together – across the desk and around the globe. Where like-minded people work naturally together to achieve great things. Keep those ambitions in sights and imagine where JLL can take you...§ § § §As an organisation, we don’t just accept that we are a place of many different people, but we embrace it, we celebrate it, and we proactively support the needs that difference brings. JLL is committed to equal opportunity regardless of race, gender, age, sexual orientation or disability, and that is why, for more than a decade, we continue to rank among the World’s Most Ethical Companies.§ § § §Apply today, quoting job reference number TSREQ116017§§§§
