It intends to be recognised as the Sport Education training hub for nationally certified sport education programmes and accreditation.§The Assignment§The purpose of this assignment is to support SLSLI to establish good practices and systems in facility management and operations. As this will be the first facility of its kind in the Solomon Islands, SISLI will require some mentoring of its staff to ensure the facilities are well managed, operated and maintained.§§We are looking for a Volunteer with:§        §          §Experience managing facility operations and knowledge of purchasing, supplies, grounds keeping, and equipment maintenance and repair;§          §Experience developing and / or implementing facility booking systems;§          §Good understanding of the commercial environment and a strong awareness of customer satisfaction; and§          §Experience working in a sporting environment.§        § https://vsa.org.nz/assets/Assignment-Descriptions-§2019-2020§/41389-SOL-SISLI-Facility-Operations-Support-Adviser-1.pdf§§VSA volunteers receive a living allowance and accommodation, insurance, and medical costs are provided. Travel arrangements are organised and funded by VSA along with other costs.§§ §VSA’s response to COVID-19§   § Although we have temporarily put our deployment of volunteers on hold due to COVID-19 restrictions and uncertainties both within New Zealand and across the wider Pacific, we’re continuing to recruit and build our talent pool of prospective volunteers so we can return to supporting our partner organisations and communities in the wider Pacific as soon as we can.§   § The Volunteer Recruitment team is continuing to work through all our current applications and keep in touch with applicants.§ § Recruitment will continue although our usual processes will be amended where necessary to ensure social distancing requirements are maintained, such as a greater emphasis on carrying out interviews remotely.§   §§        §§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§The Organisation §An initiative of the Solomon Islands Government, The Solomon Islands Sport and Leadership Institute (SISLI) / National Sports Institute supports athletes, coaches of the Solomon Islands compete at international competitions as well major international and multi-sport events.§SISLI’s purpose is to grow people through sport; develop people holistically to be successful in sport and life, and support the preparations for the Solomon Islands 2023 Pacific Games – the largest sporting event in Solomon’s history. It intends to be recognised as the Sport Education training hub for nationally certified sport education programmes and accreditation.§The Assignment§The purpose of this assignment is to support SLSLI to establish good practices and systems in facility management and operations. As this will be the first facility of its kind in the Solomon Islands, SISLI will require some mentoring of its staff to ensure the facilities are well managed, operated and maintained.§§We are looking for a Volunteer with:§ § §Experience managing facility operations and knowledge of purchasing, supplies, grounds keeping, and equipment maintenance and repair;§ §Experience developing and / or implementing facility booking systems;§ §Good understanding of the commercial environment and a strong awareness of customer satisfaction; and§ §Experience working in a sporting environment.§ § https://vsa.org.nz/assets/Assignment-Descriptions-§2019-2020§/41389-SOL-SISLI-Facility-Operations-Support-Adviser-1.pdf§§VSA volunteers receive a living allowance and accommodation, insurance, and medical costs are provided. Travel arrangements are organised and funded by VSA along with other costs.§§ §VSA’s response to COVID-19§   § Although we have temporarily put our deployment of volunteers on hold due to COVID-19 restrictions and uncertainties both within New Zealand and across the wider Pacific, we’re continuing to recruit and build our talent pool of prospective volunteers so we can return to supporting our partner organisations and communities in the wider Pacific as soon as we can.§   § The Volunteer Recruitment team is continuing to work through all our current applications and keep in touch with applicants.§ § Recruitment will continue although our usual processes will be amended where necessary to ensure social distancing requirements are maintained, such as a greater emphasis on carrying out interviews remotely.§   §§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

Mgmt§§§§§§Property Manager § §Our proudly NZ owned company owns, manages and develops a wide range of properties in the Auckland area.  We are looking for an outstanding person to manage a diverse portfolio of commercial properties and manage the property services for Commercial, Body Corporate and Multi-Unit properties. Based in a spacious office in the central city, the business operates across the Auckland region although predominantly focuses in and near the Auckland Central Business District. § §The key focus of role will be§:§ § §To provide professional commercial unit and property operation management including budgeting and annual plans§ §To manage and negotiate leasing and renewal activities of commercial tenancies§ §To manage individual building facilities and operational matters§ §To support development managers on projects§ §To support the facilities management team in initiatives§ §Provide support to the residential and hotel management teams§ §To contribute to a high quality, team oriented culture.§ §The ideal candidate for this role will:§ § §Ability to successfully negotiate from initial client contact through to the tenancy process.§ §Have successfully managed building operations, contractors and budgets§ §Have established relationships within Auckland real estate and property industry suppliers and stakeholders§ §Have experience in business to business sales and business development processes.§ §Possess a track record of meeting deadlines and ensuring delivery to agreed contractual specifications.§ §Be of high energy, driven, enthusiastic and innovative§ §Be able to form and maintain positive relationships within the organisation§ §Have excellent written and verbal communication skills§ §It is likely that you will already have a role in the property management or facilities management field and have a Property or similar degree.§ §The Company is a subsidiary of a long established, multi-faceted organisation and the role is supported by an experienced and supportive human relations, finance and a senior management team.§ §We believe this role will suit someone who has at least 3 years' experience in the Property sector or similar industries.  For the right candidate this role provides an opportunity for significant professional and personal growth and an appropriate financial package will be structured to attract high performers. The position provides a company vehicle and a central city car park.§ §We thank you in advance for your interest in this position, however only shortlisted candidates will be contacted for an interview.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have experience in a role which requires relationship management experience?§How many years of commercial property management experience do you have?§What's your expected annual base salary?§Do you have experience working towards targets and KPIs?§§§

jobText: TXT/50845213.txt	§Property Contracts Specialist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Property Contracts Specialist§§Advertiser: §Wise Group§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Oct 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Hamilton§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Real Estate & Property§, §Other§§§§§§ §Full-time position working 40 hours per week§Based in Hamilton East§Bring your property contracts experience§Join our new property team and provide key property contract management support and contribute to the ongoing success of the Wise Group§ § §Summary§ Wise Property Solutions is a new entity that delivers innovative and sustainable property solutions for the Wise Group. We do this through delivering smart, effective and efficient results that reduce property risk for all parties in our organisation.§ § We're looking for a Property Contracts Specialist who will manage new and existing property contracts effectively for the Wise Group.§ § §This role is full-time working 40 hours per week, Monday - Friday based in our Hamilton East office. In this role we offer flexible work arrangements for the right candidate.§ § You'll report to the Team Lead: Property Systems & Design, and you'll provide key property contract management support and contribute to the ongoing success of the Wise Group including a reputation for excellence and innovation.§ § You will develop expertise and knowledge of the business, and implement innovative strategies to add value to current activities. You'll identify and implement contract management systems and processes, and manage new and existing property contracts effectively. You'll work collaboratively with the wider Property Procurement team to onboard property, and have the ability to develop and maintain key relationships.§ § §You§ You'll be an experienced property contract specialist with strong networking and relationship building skills with people across cultures. We do this through delivering smart, effective and efficient property solutions that reduce risk for all parties.§ § We’re looking for a Property Procurement Specialist who will source affordable and suitable residential stock for Wise Group entities based on their specific needs.§ § §This role is full-time working 40 hours per week, Monday - Friday based in our Rotorua office. In this role you will need to be prepared to travel across New Zealand as required.§ § You’ll report to the Team Lead: Property Systems & Design, and you’ll be responsible for building a fit for purpose property portfolio by developing and sustaining strong relationships with real estate property managers and private landlords to find long-term housing options. You will need to develop a good understanding of the client groups supported by the Wise Group and help mitigate forms of discrimination and any barriers preventing access to community support services and housing. In this role you will ensure that all property is affordable, healthy, fit for purpose and well maintained. You will create credibility and trust when representing Wise Group and its entities, building strong relationships and reputation. § § §You§ We’d love to hear from applicants who have established local, regional and national strategic relationships in the industry, who are experienced successful negotiators in the residential sector, and who also have a relevant qualification in property industry or related, preferably at degree level.§ § §You’ll also have:§ §A clean, full drivers license§Knowledge of healthy homes and minimum housing standards§Knowledge of relevant standards and legislation§Problem-solving and conflict resolution skills§Sensitivity to cultural and socio-economic characteristics of population served§Knowledge of Treaty of Waitangi principles§Excellent written and verbal communication§The Benefits§ In this role, you can look forward to flexible work arrangements, extra leave, subsidies for school holiday childcare and a great team around you every day working in an organisation that believes in its’ purpose. Be part of a supportive work environment where life balance is encouraged, people are valued and new solutions are the norm!§ § §Position Description:§ To view the position description, please copy and paste the following link into your browser: https://www.wisegroup.co.nz/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/Property-Procurement-Specialist-.pdf§ § §Closing date:§ 13 November 2020. Please note, we will be shortlisting as we go and this advert may close earlier if a suitable candidate is found.§ § §Contact:§ Jo Birch on 027 471 2175 if you have any questions.§ § §**All new appointees require background checking. Under the requirements of the Children's Act 2014, new employees that are identified as coming under this act are required to undergo further safety checks as part of the recruitment process.§ §§§§

We are a family-owned business and for over 50 years the success of the Wilson name has been underpinned by superior performance and the strength of our relationships.§        § §        §As part of our Operations Team you will assume functional responsibility and full accountability for overseeing the daily operations and performance of your own car park sites within our Auckland portfolio.§        § §        §Provide hands-on leadership, direction and issue resolution at the front line of our service, including personnel and contractors to ensure that they are able to perform their roles effectively and efficiently.§        § §        §The position is an important conduit of information, reporting and implementation between the Operations Team Leader – Northern, clients and personnel.§        § §        §Based in our Auckland Office and reporting to the Operations Team Leader – Northern, you will be a 'hands-on' individual with a proactive approach and the experience to lead and motivate your team.  You will need to be able to demonstrate a history of delivering continuous improvement in your previous operations roles with at least five years' experience in an operationally oriented supervisory or management role.§        § §        §A comfort with technology and its role in delivering improvements and a technical aptitude will be a benefit.  You will have good communication and conflict resolution skills, the ability to deal with diverse customers, as well as the ability to deal with sensitive issues in a tactful manner. We are a family-owned business and for over 50 years the success of the Wilson name has been underpinned by superior performance and the strength of our relationships.§ § § §As part of our Operations Team you will assume functional responsibility and full accountability for overseeing the daily operations and performance of your own car park sites within our Auckland portfolio.§ § § §Provide hands-on leadership, direction and issue resolution at the front line of our service, including personnel and contractors to ensure that they are able to perform their roles effectively and efficiently.§ § § §The position is an important conduit of information, reporting and implementation between the Operations Team Leader – Northern, clients and personnel.§ § § §Based in our Auckland Office and reporting to the Operations Team Leader – Northern, you will be a 'hands-on' individual with a proactive approach and the experience to lead and motivate your team.  You will need to be able to demonstrate a history of delivering continuous improvement in your previous operations roles with at least five years' experience in an operationally oriented supervisory or management role.§ § § §A comfort with technology and its role in delivering improvements and a technical aptitude will be a benefit.  You will have good communication and conflict resolution skills, the ability to deal with diverse customers, as well as the ability to deal with sensitive issues in a tactful manner. It is expected that to achieve the desired outcomes approximately 50% of your time will be spent in the field working with your team, contractors and clients.§ § § §The Job  § § § §You will be responsible for:§ § §the daily operations and performance of car park sites§ §overseeing our parking operations and business development§ §providing visible leadership, direction and issue resolution at the front line of service; ensuring operational efficiency and effectiveness are maintained at a consistent level with car park presentation a critical deliverable.§ §providing accurate and timely information on portfolio performance, variances and accompanying action plans to the Team Leader§ §overseeing the management of resourcing and cost analysis§ §liaising with key Clients on matters of reporting and site performance review§ §ensuring compliance with Company policies and procedures and legislative requirements across all sites on matters of employment relations and OH&S§ §monitoring, reviewing (in consultation), recommending and overseeing implementation of changes to rate structures and signage§ §participating (where required) in high level issue dispute resolution§ §ensuring that great service is provided to our customers and providing active leadership to your team§ § § §You:§ § §will have strong leadership potential as we are looking to mentor and progress this position into a more commercial role eventually§ §are proactive, highly self-motivated and comfortable working independently or in a team environment§ §have a proven track record of delivering improvements that have added value to the organisations you have been a part of§ §have the ability to work across in a multi-function and multi-site environment with excellent communication and interpersonal skills§ §are willing to spend time in the field with your team, our customers and contractors in order to deliver great service and results§ §have a technical aptitude and/or experience would be an asset along with a genuine interest in how technology can deliver improvements to a business§ §must be able to work in New Zealand indefinitely without hindrance§ §a full NZ licence§ § § §We value and promote an environment which fosters open communication, working as an integrated team, being committed to delivery of promised service, and where individuals have opportunities to develop. The successful applicant can expect to enjoy a highly visible operations management role and a competitive remuneration package to reflect their commitment.§ § § §APPLY TODAY!!§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as an operations manager?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How many years of commercial property management experience do you have?§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

Ask about our Unplugged Policy!§ § §  §An award winning office that is part of NZ’s largest independently owned property valuing business. Our Director has a HUGE heart, believes in excellent systems and processes & is committed to making sure he has happy staff.§  § §  §WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU §  §Our Director is a truly amazing person who is genuinely committed to helping you succeed at life and not just work. This is done by supporting you with annual goal setting, salary reviews, a strong management rhythm and a tailored employee pathway, should you wish to build your career in Property Valuation. To support growth we offer an annual study fund to help towards study costs. Although we are an extremely professional team our staff are like our family (actually we are super family oriented and invite partners to most of our events) and we do regular team building and social activities such as dinners, bike rides, lunches, workshops and field days.  §  §Because we know work can be stressful we want to minimise that for you as much as possible and have implemented an Unplugged Policy. If you are off work for 4 days or more you will be totally unplugged to stop you getting emails so you can focus on recharging your batteries!! We also give you extra days off for long service, your birthday AND to do...wait for it, CHRISTMAS shopping! We all know how stressful that can be! §  § §  §WHO WE ARE §  §Our mission is to be “an awesome team providing an awesome customer experience" by living our values everyday”. We do that by staying true to our values of §‘being better’§, having strong §‘teamwork’§, having honest and present §‘communication’ §and remembering §'family§' time is important. We are always striving to improve and we know that as a team we do better together. We respect each other and always operate with integrity. All of this combined with our 30 year history in Rotorua and being a part of NZ’s largest independently owned property valuing business allows us to constantly succeed and provide a workplace that fosters happiness and growth. §  §The fact that our Director - Kendall LOVES to teach and mentor, combined with the reality that he is a great person that contributes a lot to our local community means that our brand and business is extremely well regarded and trusted in this area §  §WHO WE NEED §Our bare minimum requirements § § § §Strong communication and customer services §  § § §Excellent organisational skills through strong task and process management §  § § §Administrative experience §  § § §Flexibility to cope with changing environments and systems §  § § §Strong moral and ethical values  §  § § §Strong team player combined with the ability to manage yourself §  § § §Awesome attitude with the willingness to help §  § § §Valid drivers licence§  § § §Experience in MYOB is a must   §  § § §  §The Icing on the Cake: § § § §Past experience in real estate and/or valuation administration  §  § §Please apply via the SeekNZ process as CV's emailed directly will not be considered. For further information about the role please email §andrea.winmill@telferyoung.com§  §PLEASE NOTE: due to the high volume of applicants, only successful applicants will be contacted. § §  §Applications close Tuesday 9th November §and will be screened as the applicants come in so don’t delay, send your resume ASAP via the “Apply” button. §  § §  §                     §§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have experience in an administration role?§Which of the following Microsoft Office products are you experienced with?§Do you have customer service experience?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§§§

jobText: TXT/50846193.txt	§Facilities Manager - Building Management System§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Facilities Manager - Building Management System§§Advertiser: §The University of Auckland§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Real Estate & Property§, §Body Corporate & Facilities Management§§§§§§Building Management Services Lead§ §Facilities Management – Property Services§ §The University of Auckland is New Zealand’s leading University. It employs over 6,000 academic and professional staff to support over 42,000 students making us one of NZ’s largest employers.  § §Property Services provide a leading edge facilities management, planning and development service that contributes to the success of the University of Auckland as a vibrant and progressive University. This is achieved through customer focused support services, which include:§ § §High level facilities planning and development advice§ §Strategic management of the University’s assets; and§ §The provision of a quality physical environment§ §The role§ §You will be integral to providing a safe and efficient operating environment for the University community through operational management of the installed Building Management Systems. As a leader of the Building Services Technician team, you should mentor and train to help develop an effective and cohesive group that provides efficient services, guidance and advice.§ §Some other key responsibilities include:§ § §Plant system operation and maintenance via Building Management Systems (BMS) to optimise installation efficiencies.§ §Manage stakeholder queries and investigate and help implement appropriate solutions in conjunction with trade staff and contractors.§ §Carry out performance, compliance and risk investigations of systems.§ §Stakeholder and people management including team management and training of internal and external stakeholders (Contractors and Trade staff).§ §Record Management of compliance tests, isolation and restricted work notifications, audits and post technical review of installed electronic maintenance.§ §Financial management ensuring expenditure is within budget and quality assessments carried out prior to invoice authorisation.§ §Our ideal candidate§ §We are looking for an experienced supervisor with extensive trades/maintenance experience to manage a diverse portfolio. You will be an excellent communicator with the ability to provide direction to staff and advice to multiple stakeholders. In addition to this you will have:§ § §Demonstrable experience within large complex environments§ §Experience managing Building Management Systems and other systems.§ §Ability to prioritise tasks and meet deadlines.§ §Proven experience in electrical, mechanical or trades field.§ §An ability in dealing with finance and budgets.§ §Why work for us?§ § §Opportunity to work with an exciting and diverse portfolio.§ §Five weeks’ annual leave per annum.§ §Up to 6.75% employer superannuation contribution.§ §Over 300 different career development courses.§ §For more information on the benefits of working here, see our §Staff Benefits§ page.§ §Apply§ §Applications close Wednesday 18th November. All applications must be made online.§ §Please forward any enquiries to §j.chapman@auckland.ac.nz§ §The University is committed to meeting its obligations under the Treaty of Waitangi and achieving equity outcomes for staff and students in a safe, inclusive and equitable environment.  For further information on services for Māori, Pacific, women, LGBTI, people with disabilities, parenting support, flexible work and other equity issues go to §www.equity.auckland.ac.nz§§§§

jobText: TXT/50829026.txt	§Project Coordinator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Project Coordinator§§Advertiser: §Echelon Group Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Oct 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Real Estate & Property§, §Administration§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Project Coordinator §      §        §          §            §              §Fabulous office with great culture§              §Growing and thriving business§              §City centre fringe location§            §            §Our client is a well-established and reputable Interior Design company who have successfully developed their brand through a strong commitment to quality and innovation in award winning design and exceptional delivery of interior fit-outs.  Servicing clients throughout New Zealand and Australia, the reputation of their business continues to go from strength to strength seeing them well positioned to capitalise on future growth opportunities. Working in stylish offices in Central Christchurch, this is a chance to be part of a fantastic environment with people who work hard and know how to have fun at the same time. §            §They have an immediate need for an experienced Project Coordinator to join their team to contribute in the delivery of residential and commercial interior projects, from planning through to delivery. Reporting into the Project Team Manager, you will work closely with the wider project team and be primarily responsible for the preparation of quotes and project planning. Developing and maintaining relationships with key internal and external stakeholders will be key to your success.§            §In joining their fast paced, customer focused and highly motivated team, you will match their drive, be proficient with the Microsoft Office suite and ideally Workflow Max.  You will need to be a solutions focused, methodical and experienced professional with a proven coordination/administration background and exceptional attention to detail and accuracy. §            §On a personal level you will be self-motivated with a confident and proactive approach, along with strong interpersonal skills and disciplines around planning. You will be able to demonstrate professional presentation and communication skills and relish working as part of a team that always goes the extra mile in delivering solutions to their customers.§          §          §            §            §              §For a confidential enquiry, contact Sally Fitzsimmons§              §Tel: 021 297 2863§Email: §sally.fitzsimmons@echelongroup.co.nz§Please apply online at www.echelongroup.co.nz or click on Apply now.§            §          §        §      §      §        §        §      §    §    §  §§§§Fabulous office with great culture§Growing and thriving business§City centre fringe location§Our client is a well-established and reputable Interior Design company who have successfully developed their brand through a strong commitment to quality and innovation in award winning design and exceptional delivery of interior fit-outs.  Servicing clients throughout New Zealand and Australia, the reputation of their business continues to go from strength to strength seeing them well positioned to capitalise on future growth opportunities. Working in stylish offices in Central Christchurch, this is a chance to be part of a fantastic environment with people who work hard and know how to have fun at the same time. §They have an immediate need for an experienced Project Coordinator to join their team to contribute in the delivery of residential and commercial interior projects, from planning through to delivery. Reporting into the Project Team Manager, you will work closely with the wider project team and be primarily responsible for the preparation of quotes and project planning. Developing and maintaining relationships with key internal and external stakeholders will be key to your success.§In joining their fast paced, customer focused and highly motivated team, you will match their drive, be proficient with the Microsoft Office suite and ideally Workflow Max.  You will need to be a solutions focused, methodical and experienced professional with a proven coordination/administration background and exceptional attention to detail and accuracy. §On a personal level you will be self-motivated with a confident and proactive approach, along with strong interpersonal skills and disciplines around planning. You will be able to demonstrate professional presentation and communication skills and relish working as part of a team that always goes the extra mile in delivering solutions to their customers.§§§For a confidential enquiry, contact Sally Fitzsimmons§Tel: 021 297 2863§Email: §sally.fitzsimmons@echelongroup.co.nz§Please apply online at www.echelongroup.co.nz or click on Apply now.§§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

They operate very much as one cohesive unit, bouncing ideas of each other, sharing knowledge, and working together to achieve great results.  Over the years they’ve been incredibly successful at helping new salespeople become top performers, and they’re always looking for motivated, goal-driven people to join their team.§ If you’re looking to learn new skills and challenge yourself within a company which provides ongoing mentoring and rewards hard work, then Ray White Metro want to talk!§  § At Ray White Metro you are provided with:§        §          §A high level of training and management support§          §A dynamic environment conducive to success§          §The broad reach and vast resources of Ray White, Australasia’s largest Real Estate brand§          §Unlimited earning potential§        § If you are an existing Salesperson, then please give me a call on 021 32 1115 for more information on this exciting opportunity.  We are very interested in those Salespeople working in Teams (or would like to).  Additionally, if you are new to Real Estate and serious about making it your long-term career then please don’t hesitate to apply below. We don’t mind if you’re REA licensed and experienced or looking to start your career in real estate – we want to hear from you if you have a good work ethic, a passion for success and the ability to learn new skills!§  § This role is being managed by REAP Recruitment on behalf of Ray White Metro. They operate very much as one cohesive unit, bouncing ideas of each other, sharing knowledge, and working together to achieve great results.  Over the years they’ve been incredibly successful at helping new salespeople become top performers, and they’re always looking for motivated, goal-driven people to join their team.§ If you’re looking to learn new skills and challenge yourself within a company which provides ongoing mentoring and rewards hard work, then Ray White Metro want to talk!§  § At Ray White Metro you are provided with:§ § §A high level of training and management support§ §A dynamic environment conducive to success§ §The broad reach and vast resources of Ray White, Australasia’s largest Real Estate brand§ §Unlimited earning potential§ § If you are an existing Salesperson, then please give me a call on 021 32 1115 for more information on this exciting opportunity.  We are very interested in those Salespeople working in Teams (or would like to).  Additionally, if you are new to Real Estate and serious about making it your long-term career then please don’t hesitate to apply below. We don’t mind if you’re REA licensed and experienced or looking to start your career in real estate – we want to hear from you if you have a good work ethic, a passion for success and the ability to learn new skills!§  § This role is being managed by REAP Recruitment on behalf of Ray White Metro. Please apply on-line below to be considered.  All applications will remain confidential and more information is available on request.§  § §REAP Recruitment specialise in recruitment for the Real Estate and Property (REAP) industries.  Whether you're an existing Real Estate Salesperson wanting to see if the "grass is greener" or thinking about entering (or returning to) the Real Estate industry, make REAP Recruitment your first call.§§§§

jobTitle: Facility Operations Support Adviser - E- Volunteering Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50845249.txt	§Facility Operations Support Adviser - E- Volunteering§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Facility Operations Support Adviser - E- Volunteering§§Advertiser: §Volunteer Service Abroad (VSA)§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Real Estate & Property§, §Body Corporate & Facilities Management§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Facility Operations Support Adviser - E- Volunteering §      §With VSA's E-Volunteering programme we are continuing to support our partner organisations in the Pacific while working from Aotearoa. §This assignment is a 6 month part-time E Volunteering opportunity working from home. The assignment will be working with the Solomon Islands Sports and Leadership Institue (SISLI) a government initiative which supports athletes, coaches and sports at an international level in the Solomon Islands. SISLI's purpose is to grow people through sport; develop people holistically to be successful in sport and life; and support the preparations for the Solomon Islands 2023 Pacific Games - which will be the largest sporting evening in Solomon history. §The purpose of this assignment is to support SLSLI to establish good practices and systems in facility management and operations. As this will be the first facility of its kind in Solomon Islands, SISLI will require some mentoring of its staff to ensure the facilities are well managed, operated and maintained.§ The volunteer will support and mentor local staff to understand and implement high standards in facility management, asset management and operations.§We are looking for a volunteer with the following skills:§        §          §Experience in managing facility operations and knowledge of purchasing, supplies, grounds keeping and equipment maintenance and repair§          §Experience in developing and/or implementing facility booking system§          §Strong contract management and administration process development capabilities §          §Able to work from home and utilise appropriate technology to engage with our partner organisation§        § To review the full assignment description please copy and paste the below link into your browser:§https://vsa.org.nz/assets/Assignment-Descriptions-§2019-2020§/2020/41506_AD_SOL_SISLI-Facility-Operations-Support-Adviser-1.pdf§VSA's response to COVID-19§Although we have temporarily put our deployment of volunteers on hold due to COVID-19 restrictions and uncertainties both within New Zealand and across the wider Pacific, we’re continuing to recruit and build our talent pool of prospective volunteers and recruit new E-Volunteers to continue to support our partner organisations in the Pacific.§§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§With VSA's E-Volunteering programme we are continuing to support our partner organisations in the Pacific while working from Aotearoa. §This assignment is a 6 month part-time E Volunteering opportunity working from home. The assignment will be working with the Solomon Islands Sports and Leadership Institue (SISLI) a government initiative which supports athletes, coaches and sports at an international level in the Solomon Islands. SISLI's purpose is to grow people through sport; develop people holistically to be successful in sport and life; and support the preparations for the Solomon Islands 2023 Pacific Games - which will be the largest sporting evening in Solomon history. §The purpose of this assignment is to support SLSLI to establish good practices and systems in facility management and operations. As this will be the first facility of its kind in Solomon Islands, SISLI will require some mentoring of its staff to ensure the facilities are well managed, operated and maintained.§ The volunteer will support and mentor local staff to understand and implement high standards in facility management, asset management and operations.§We are looking for a volunteer with the following skills:§ § §Experience in managing facility operations and knowledge of purchasing, supplies, grounds keeping and equipment maintenance and repair§ §Experience in developing and/or implementing facility booking system§ §Strong contract management and administration process development capabilities § §Able to work from home and utilise appropriate technology to engage with our partner organisation§ § To review the full assignment description please copy and paste the below link into your browser:§https://vsa.org.nz/assets/Assignment-Descriptions-§2019-2020§/2020/41506_AD_SOL_SISLI-Facility-Operations-Support-Adviser-1.pdf§VSA's response to COVID-19§Although we have temporarily put our deployment of volunteers on hold due to COVID-19 restrictions and uncertainties both within New Zealand and across the wider Pacific, we’re continuing to recruit and build our talent pool of prospective volunteers and recruit new E-Volunteers to continue to support our partner organisations in the Pacific.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

Other aptitudes would include but not be limited to:§        §          §Experience in a client facing Sales role and, as you’ll be the “face” of Summit Homes, you must have excellent presentation and communication skills.§          §Prior experience in Real Estate is preferred but please note that a Real Estate licence is not required.§        § Training will be given to the successful applicants. Above all you will have the desire and drive to succeed and achieve your goals. § Summit Homes NZ Ltd works closely with Developers, Mortgage Advisors and Solicitors. It provides Education, Property and Mortgage services and holds well attended presentations and seminars to groups throughout the Waikato region.   §We have multiple and on-going opportunities across the Auckland and Waikato regions (and more coming soon). You will be a key member of a close-knit team so above everything else, team fit is important. If this sounds like you or you want more information, then get in touch today.  §  § Please note that the roles are on Commission Basis with an expected OTE of $100,000+§This role is being managed by REAP Recruitment. Other aptitudes would include but not be limited to:§ § §Experience in a client facing Sales role and, as you’ll be the “face” of Summit Homes, you must have excellent presentation and communication skills.§ §Prior experience in Real Estate is preferred but please note that a Real Estate licence is not required.§ § Training will be given to the successful applicants. Above all you will have the desire and drive to succeed and achieve your goals. § Summit Homes NZ Ltd works closely with Developers, Mortgage Advisors and Solicitors. It provides Education, Property and Mortgage services and holds well attended presentations and seminars to groups throughout the Waikato region.   §We have multiple and on-going opportunities across the Auckland and Waikato regions (and more coming soon). You will be a key member of a close-knit team so above everything else, team fit is important. If this sounds like you or you want more information, then get in touch today.  §  § Please note that the roles are on Commission Basis with an expected OTE of $100,000+§This role is being managed by REAP Recruitment. jobText: TXT/50865367.txt	§Senior Registered Valuer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Registered Valuer§§Advertiser: §Lynx Recruitment Ltd Most Innovative Agency of the Year 2019§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§2 Nov 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Hamilton§§Salary§§OTE $180K + fuel +laptop + phone§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Real Estate & Property§, §Valuation§§§§§§Our client:§ Our client is a provider of valuations, advisory, and specialist property services. It's an exciting time to join as our client has secured a number of robust new business ventures and contracts for the next few years and is continuously gaining market share. § § § § §The role:§ Based in the Waikato branch, this will be a hybrid role responsible for two important areas of the business; supporting Government Services work and completing market valuations. jobText: TXT/50858307.txt	§Salesperson§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Salesperson§§Advertiser: §Bronwyn Kay Agency§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§2 Nov 2020§§Location§§Gisborne§, §Gisborne§§Salary§§Commission§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Real Estate & Property§, §Residential Sales§§§§§§Are you a Real Estate Sales professional looking for a brand that will allow you to grow your business?  Due to the growth in the Real Estate market in Gisborne Bronwyn Kay agency is looking to grow our successful sales team with dynamic, self-motivated real estate professionals who have entrepreneurial attitudes and the ambition to succeed.  We would also be interested to talk to motivated, dynamic individuals who are considering a career in real estate. § §Real Estate professionals enjoy§ § §Flexibility in being your own boss§ §Opportunity to maximise your earnings potential§ §Ability to work closely with people in your community§ §Flexible hours that suit your lifestyle§ §Support of highly experienced team members§ §Bronwyn Kay agency is the largest independent real estate agency in Gisborne with a trusted and well-established brand.  We maintain a very large market share of residential sales in Gisborne. We provide excellent guidance, good systems and provide exceptional administration support. The team at BK take pride in ensuring that we provide each client with a positive experience.  We have a deep understanding and knowledge of the local market and have built an extensive record of sales and property management successes. Our full service approach to business means we are able to assist with all of our clients’ needs – be it selling, buying, or investing.§ §If you are a licensed salesperson and would like a confidential conversation ring Bronwyn personally on 0800 27 66 99§ § § §Applicants must have NZ residency and a full driver's license.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have in the real estate industry?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§Have you completed a Real Estate Sales Representative course? (e.g. Agent's Representative course, Certificate of Registration)§§§

jobTitle: LOOKING FOR A CHANGE? Real Estate Careers Evening Job in Canterbury - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50850415.txt	§LOOKING FOR A CHANGE? Real Estate Careers Evening§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§LOOKING FOR A CHANGE? Real Estate Careers Evening§§Advertiser: §NetYourJob§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Oct 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Real Estate & Property§, §Residential Sales§§§§§§We're looking for driven, service-focused people with a passion to succeed to join our award-winning sales team at Harcourts Grenadier. This is an opportunity to enjoy uncapped earning potential within a highly trusted, reputable company.§ §Our next career evening:§When: Wednesday 11th November 2020 at 6pm§Where: Harcourts Grenadier, 98 Moorhouse Avenue, Christchurch§ §Fast track your real estate career with §Grenadier Advantage§. A first in the country, Grenadier Advantage provides the best training and support to build your business from day one. Grenadier Advantage has been created and designed for motivated individuals that have a desire to start a successful and rewarding career in real estate. You will be mentored and coached alongside other like-minded consultants by our in-house, highly experienced real estate trainer. It truly will give you the perfect platform to accelerate your career and your income.§ §For those who require financial assistance while they transition to their new career we have created §Grenadier Advantage+§. This offers you all the training benefits mentioned above plus up to 20 weeks base salary.§ §The ideal candidate would have:§ § § The desire to build a long-lasting career§ §A strong focus on customer service§ §Enthusiasm and a positive attitude§ §High levels of self-motivation and self-drive§ §A strong local network or the ability to build one quickly§ §Get the advantage over everyone else and join Grenadier!§ §Spaces will be limited so it is important that you register your attendance at www.careerinrealestate.co.nz to secure your spot!§ §For a confidential discussion about a future with us please contact Anna Penny Moore, Business Operations Officer on 021 046 6097.§§§§

It is more than just a business transaction – it is about looking after their customer’s future plans and dreams. Whether it’s been a long-held ambition or if you’ve already excelled in sales in another area, LJ Hooker can help you realise your potential in the exciting industry of real estate.§  § LJ Hooker are great at matching the right people to the right job. Their special six-step process will not only give you an insight into property sales but also determine your suitability to work as a Salesperson. You’ll learn about specific traits that research shows are shared by many of Australia’s leading property experts. ' The Quiet Achiever'§§Advertiser: §Wendell Property Management§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§4 Nov 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Salary§§$60,000 - $79,999§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Real Estate & Property§, §Residential Leasing & Property Management§§§§§§You may not be the person always winning the awards, but you do a damn good job every day, without complaining!§ §Join us, we are looking for "Work Horses", § §not "Show Ponies!"§ §At §Wendell Property Management§, we know that our people make our business, so we take damn good care of them. The Wendell level of care isn’t just for our clients, it’s for our team too! This is just part of what’s seen us win §Employer of the Year§ at last year’s Westpac Business Awards, Property Management Business of the Year from LPMA, not to mention a bunch of other accolades too (just have a look at our website!)§ §Our business is based on a few simple rules: § § § §Quality service, rather than short term profits, is at the heart of everything we do§ § § §Pay fair and equitable wages for everyone§ § § §We remove the unsavory people from your customer base & our business§ § § §We cultivate an office environment of collaboration and support§ § § §We make life easier by allowing our team to work where and when they want§ § § §We arrange quality holiday cover so that no one ever returns to a chaotic pile of work§ § § §Give Property Managers their weekends off§ § § §Ensure our carbon footprint is below zero! § § §About Wendell Property§ §At our heart, we’re a family-owned business that feels like a family; and we love our position as a smaller, specialist player that packs a big punch. We love working with people – in our team, and client base – who are smart and driven, and who aren't dickheads. We’re proactive, personalized and clever partners – priding ourselves on getting things done and making life better for everyone.§ §Our difference is felt in everything we do – come and feel it for yourself. Interested to know more about ‘the best little property business in the world’? § §About the portfolio§ §We work with all types of owners, with a range of different investment strategies. This group of owners knows their end game. You could say their properties are "The worst houses on the best streets". We want someone who can work with them to complete the Healthy Homes work already underway and help our owners achieve their own strategies of success. § §We’re keen to hear more about you! Email us your CV and cover letter telling us why you are the one we're looking for. §§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a property manager?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

jobText: TXT/50872481.txt	§Facilities Assistant§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Facilities Assistant§§Advertiser: §Ministry for Culture and Heritage§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§3 Nov 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Salary§§$50,628 [85%]- $$59,562 [mid-point]§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Real Estate & Property§, §Administration§§§§§§§§§  §    §      §        §Facilities Assistant §        §        §        §          §Permanent, part-time .7FTE§Wellington§Salary range - $50,628 (85%) - $59,562 (100%) Pro Rata§          §He ngākau titikaha, he hononga tangata§          §Promoting a confident and connected culture§          §Come join a talented, ambitious Facilities team in a caring Ministry where you will be supported to grow with new and varied challenges.§          §Kōrero mō te tūranga- About the role§          §Reporting to the Team Leader, this role is central to our busy Facilities and Emergency Management team. You will be responding to day to day facilities related queries, maintenance and set up activities throughout four floors of the Old Public Trust building and Pukeahu National War Memorial Park in central Wellington. This role has a diverse range of responsibilities from auditing supplies of civil defence emergency equipment, physically restocking common areas through to issuing new staff with swipe cards. The role also provides cover for our reception desk each day.§          §The role ultimately provides seamless day-to-day facilities coordination services that support the smooth running of Manatū Taonga.§          §This role is part-time, Monday -Friday with a mix of set hours and flexibility on some days:§          §Monday: 4 hours (flexible am or pm)§Tuesday: 4 hours (flexible am or pm)§Wednesday: 8 hours§Thursday: 4 hours (am or pm)§Friday: 8 hours§          §Kōrero mōu- About you§          §You will be a facilities all-rounder, ready to respond whenever and wherever an incident arises, incidents can range from the urgent, fix it right now to the more planned approach.§          §You will have a good grasp of facilities coordination. Remaining calm when busy, you will have a natural bent for organising yourself with an ability to switch priorities to get both the urgent and important tasks completed on time. You will enjoy using your MS office skills to support the Facilities team.§          §As you grow into the role you will be supported to heighten your Facilities, Emergency Management, Health, Safety and Security knowledge of relevant policies, procedures, compliance and regulation.§          §Key things we are looking for from you include:§          §            §Sound problem-solving skills with the ability to think pragmatically and critically§            §Ability to organise work effectively, set priorities, cope with pressure and meet deadlines§            §Intermediate MS Office skills including Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook§            §Experience in facilities coordination or similar role§            §Basic understanding of health and safety in the workplace§          §          §Ko wai mātou - About us§          §Manatū Taonga has a broad mandate and wide reach across a complex system. With around 140 staff, we operate a lean and flat structure, with the added advantage of knowing everyone by name. We embrace diversity and inclusiveness, are passionate about our mahi, and welcome experiences from diﬀerent sectors to strengthen and support the pou of our whare.§          §We work in a sector that contributes $11 billion to New Zealand’s GDP and over 90,000 jobs, ranging from screen production to symphonies, broadcasting to ballet, kapa haka to heritage, and more. Our mahi helps the government promote Aotearoatanga, our unique cultural identity – from policy to programme delivery. With our partners – Māori, public sector agencies and our funded agencies – we connect local communities to cultural experiences to enrich our mātauranga. Our sector funds and tells stories reﬂecting who New Zealanders are today, helping us to navigate our future and building the inclusive and cohesive country we want our tamariki to grow up in and call home.§          §Check us out here: §https://mch.govt.nz/about-ministry/jobs-and-careers§          §Me pēhea te tono - How to apply§          §A position description for this role is attached. For enquiries please contact Jane, §jane.ransfield@mch.govt.nz§          §Applications close 5pm Sunday, 15 November 2020.§          §If you are not a New Zealand citizen, you must hold current eligibility to work in New Zealand in order to work for Manatū Taonga. Please refer to the §New Zealand Immigration Service§ for further information.§        §        §        §      §    §  §§§Permanent, part-time .7FTE§Wellington§Salary range - $50,628 (85%) - $59,562 (100%) Pro Rata§He ngākau titikaha, he hononga tangata§Promoting a confident and connected culture§Come join a talented, ambitious Facilities team in a caring Ministry where you will be supported to grow with new and varied challenges.§Kōrero mō te tūranga- About the role§Reporting to the Team Leader, this role is central to our busy Facilities and Emergency Management team. You will be responding to day to day facilities related queries, maintenance and set up activities throughout four floors of the Old Public Trust building and Pukeahu National War Memorial Park in central Wellington. This role has a diverse range of responsibilities from auditing supplies of civil defence emergency equipment, physically restocking common areas through to issuing new staff with swipe cards. The role also provides cover for our reception desk each day.§The role ultimately provides seamless day-to-day facilities coordination services that support the smooth running of Manatū Taonga.§This role is part-time, Monday -Friday with a mix of set hours and flexibility on some days:§Monday: 4 hours (flexible am or pm)§Tuesday: 4 hours (flexible am or pm)§Wednesday: 8 hours§Thursday: 4 hours (am or pm)§Friday: 8 hours§Kōrero mōu- About you§You will be a facilities all-rounder, ready to respond whenever and wherever an incident arises, incidents can range from the urgent, fix it right now to the more planned approach.§You will have a good grasp of facilities coordination. Remaining calm when busy, you will have a natural bent for organising yourself with an ability to switch priorities to get both the urgent and important tasks completed on time. You will enjoy using your MS office skills to support the Facilities team.§As you grow into the role you will be supported to heighten your Facilities, Emergency Management, Health, Safety and Security knowledge of relevant policies, procedures, compliance and regulation.§Key things we are looking for from you include:§Sound problem-solving skills with the ability to think pragmatically and critically§Ability to organise work effectively, set priorities, cope with pressure and meet deadlines§Intermediate MS Office skills including Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook§Experience in facilities coordination or similar role§Basic understanding of health and safety in the workplace§Ko wai mātou - About us§Manatū Taonga has a broad mandate and wide reach across a complex system. With around 140 staff, we operate a lean and flat structure, with the added advantage of knowing everyone by name. We embrace diversity and inclusiveness, are passionate about our mahi, and welcome experiences from diﬀerent sectors to strengthen and support the pou of our whare.§We work in a sector that contributes $11 billion to New Zealand’s GDP and over 90,000 jobs, ranging from screen production to symphonies, broadcasting to ballet, kapa haka to heritage, and more. Our mahi helps the government promote Aotearoatanga, our unique cultural identity – from policy to programme delivery. With our partners – Māori, public sector agencies and our funded agencies – we connect local communities to cultural experiences to enrich our mātauranga. Our sector funds and tells stories reﬂecting who New Zealanders are today, helping us to navigate our future and building the inclusive and cohesive country we want our tamariki to grow up in and call home.§Check us out here: §https://mch.govt.nz/about-ministry/jobs-and-careers§Me pēhea te tono - How to apply§A position description for this role is attached. For enquiries please contact Jane, §jane.ransfield@mch.govt.nz§Applications close 5pm Sunday, 15 November 2020.§If you are not a New Zealand citizen, you must hold current eligibility to work in New Zealand in order to work for Manatū Taonga. Please refer to the §New Zealand Immigration Service§ for further information.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50894816.txt	§Facilities Management Officer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Facilities Management Officer§§Advertiser: §Ministry of Social Development§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Nov 2020§§Location§§Bay of Plenty§, §Rotorua§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Real Estate & Property§, §Body Corporate & Facilities Management§§§§§§§§§  §    §Facilities Management Officer §    §      §        §Job Ref: 35649§        §We have an opportunity for you to join the Facilities Management team based in our National Accounting Centre at Rotorua.§        §The National Accounting Centre was established to provide accurate, timely and customer focussed support services to all Ministry of Social Development (MSD) staff and its customers.§        §The role of the Facilities Management Officer is to:§        §          §Provide facility management service, support and advice for all MSD and our customers properties.§          §Allocate and manage work to approved contractors in line with MSD business standards.§          §Validate and approve payment of invoices whilst applying quality standards and best practice.§        §        §Our successful applicant will need to demonstrate some previous experience transferable to the role and/or be keen to work in this field with a willingness to learn.§        §Excellent communication skills together with the ability to work in a busy and pressured environment are a must. You will also need excellent organisational and problem solving skills, and be able to put the customer at the centre of everything you do.§        §This is an important role in which modelling behaviours and thinking that matches our culture and principles are expected.§        §If you have a proactive, positive and ‘can-do’ attitude and take personal ownership of your workload, then we want to hear from you!§        §If you would like to know more about the role or the team please contact Bobby Watson on §bobby.watson012@msd.govt.nz§ or §07 921 9973§.§        §How to Apply§        §To apply, click the 'Apply Now' button to upload your CV, cover letter and complete the online application form.  Note: Your cover letter will be a key part of our assessment process, so please highlight how your experience relates to the competencies listed in the position description.§        §All applications must be made online.  If this is not possible or if you have any queries, please contact us at §jobs@msd.govt.nz§        §Internal MSD Employees – please apply through your myHR portal at work.  This will ensure that your myHR employee profile is visible as internal candidate.§        §External Candidates – Oranga Tamariki must apply directly through our MSD careers page at https://jobs.msd.govt.nz§        §Applications close: Sunday 22 November 2020§        §Position Description§        §http://www.msd.govt.nz/hr/documents/position-descriptions/organisational-solutions/finance/facilities-management-officer-pd-sept-18.doc§        §Joining us§        §Joining MSD means being part of a whānau that celebrates the diversity each individual represents.  We show manaaki, we care about the wellbeing and success of people and want everyone to thrive, and be who they are in a supportive and inclusive working environment. We work together to make a difference for communities while doing the right thing with integrity. We are a Treaty partner committed to strengthening relationships with§ §Māori,§ §Hapū§,§ Iwi and communities to realise their own potential and aspirations.§        §If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to tell us when you apply so we can assist you through the recruitment process.§      §      §The Ministry of Social Development is one of New Zealand's largest government agencies. Our work to achieve better social outcomes affects almost every New Zealander, now or in the future.§        §https://jobs.msd.govt.nz/§      §    §    §  §§§Job Ref: 35649§ §We have an opportunity for you to join the Facilities Management team based in our National Accounting Centre at Rotorua.§ §The National Accounting Centre was established to provide accurate, timely and customer focussed support services to all Ministry of Social Development (MSD) staff and its customers.§ §The role of the Facilities Management Officer is to:§ § §Provide facility management service, support and advice for all MSD and our customers properties.§ §Allocate and manage work to approved contractors in line with MSD business standards.§ §Validate and approve payment of invoices whilst applying quality standards and best practice.§ §Our successful applicant will need to demonstrate some previous experience transferable to the role and/or be keen to work in this field with a willingness to learn.§ §Excellent communication skills together with the ability to work in a busy and pressured environment are a must. You will also need excellent organisational and problem solving skills, and be able to put the customer at the centre of everything you do.§ §This is an important role in which modelling behaviours and thinking that matches our culture and principles are expected.§ §If you have a proactive, positive and ‘can-do’ attitude and take personal ownership of your workload, then we want to hear from you!§ §If you would like to know more about the role or the team please contact Bobby Watson on §bobby.watson012@msd.govt.nz§ or §07 921 9973§.§ §How to Apply§ §To apply, click the 'Apply Now' button to upload your CV, cover letter and complete the online application form.  Note: Your cover letter will be a key part of our assessment process, so please highlight how your experience relates to the competencies listed in the position description.§ §All applications must be made online.  If this is not possible or if you have any queries, please contact us at §jobs@msd.govt.nz§ §Internal MSD Employees – please apply through your myHR portal at work.  This will ensure that your myHR employee profile is visible as internal candidate.§ §External Candidates – Oranga Tamariki must apply directly through our MSD careers page at https://jobs.msd.govt.nz§ §Applications close: Sunday 22 November 2020§ §Position Description§ §http://www.msd.govt.nz/hr/documents/position-descriptions/organisational-solutions/finance/facilities-management-officer-pd-sept-18.doc§ §Joining us§ §Joining MSD means being part of a whānau that celebrates the diversity each individual represents.  We show manaaki, we care about the wellbeing and success of people and want everyone to thrive, and be who they are in a supportive and inclusive working environment. We work together to make a difference for communities while doing the right thing with integrity. We are a Treaty partner committed to strengthening relationships with§ §Māori,§ §Hapū§,§ Iwi and communities to realise their own potential and aspirations.§ §If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to tell us when you apply so we can assist you through the recruitment process.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50876303.txt	§Marketing Executive/Administrator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Marketing Executive/Administrator§§Advertiser: §Bayleys Realty Group§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§4 Nov 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Real Estate & Property§, §Administration§§§§§§Be an integral, valued, key member of the commercial leasing team§Systems and process focussed requiring great attention to detail§Social inclusive team based in the Wynyard Quarter§Bayleys Realty Group is New Zealand's largest full-service national property company with over 90 offices nationwide. As part of this dynamic group, Bayleys Real Estate is the largest commercial and industrial company in the country and is proud of its reputation of being a market leader.§Due to the incumbent moving into another role within the Group our team of sales consultants who specialise in corporate, commercial and industrial leasing are looking for a someone with excellent secretarial/marketing/administration skills to manage the day to day marketing and administration responsibilities for their successful sales business's. jobText: TXT/50892575.txt	§Manager WorkSmart Programme§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Manager WorkSmart Programme§§Advertiser: §Auckland Council§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Nov 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Real Estate & Property§, §Other§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Manager WorkSmart Programme §      §        §He angitūtanga: The opportunity§        § §        §Our Corporate Property team has an exciting new career opportunity, Manager WorkSmart Programme. The main purpose of this role is be responsible for leading, planning and ensuring the successful delivery of our transformational corporate office and storage optimisation programme for the Auckland Council Group.§        § §        §You will be responsible for optimising more than 100,000m2 of office space in multiple buildings across the Auckland region and at the same time transitioning our Auckland Council Group staff to flexible ways of working. As such this is a great opportunity for a capable and experienced Programme Director who is looking to take the next step in delivering a transformational programme of size, scale and complexity that is rarely available in New Zealand.§        § §        §Key responsibilities will include:§        § §        §          §Lead and manage the Auckland Council Group WorkSmart optimisation programme from inception to completion including the delivery of multiple project workstreams for more than 100,000 m2 of office and storage facilities.§          §Lead the development and evolution of our workplace strategy and workplace change programme encompassing flexible ways of working.§          §Management oversight and overall accountability of all office and storage facility disposals as part of the WorkSmart programme. §          §Manage with mana whenua engagement to ensure Te Aranga design principles are embedded deeply into and new developments and workplace outcomes§          §Develop and maintain effective governance and reporting and ensure appropriate resource allocation.§          §Plan and manage all capex and occupancy spend for the programme and ensure disposal receipts cover all in-scope approved programme expenses.§          §Ensure all direct reports have clarity of vision, responsibilities and expectations and inspire, motivate, and coach, those in your team consistent with council’s values and our charter to deliver the programme objectives.§          §Connect and collaborate widely with internal and external stakeholders and service providers to build constructive and effective working relationships and build momentum for change.§        §        § §        §He kōrero mōu: About you§        § §        §You will likely be a senior property professional experienced in working in a large complex organisation and you will have the confidence and resilience to develop and deliver a complex portfolio optimisation and workplace transformation programme of work. You will have an in-depth understanding of commercial property sector disciplines including contract management, negotiation and project management. Experience in developing and delivering property workplace optimisation and change programmes is also desirable. You will have excellent interpersonal and relationship management skills, and a collaborative and engaging approach with internal and external stakeholders. You will have the ability to think strategically when confronted with ambiguity and make quality decisions in dynamic and challenging environment. §        § §        §Ngā āhuatanga kei a mātou: What we offer§        § §        §This is a rare career opportunity for a confident strategic Programme Director to come and make a difference within the wider council group on a scale that is rarely available in New Zealand. You will have the ability to transform how our organisation works. This is your opportunity to be part of a supportive team assisting the Auckland Council Group to achieve our vision for Auckland to be a world-class city.§        § §        §For a confidential discussion or detailed position description, please contact Jess Rohr, Talent Acquisition Consultant §jess.rohr@aucklandcouncil.govt.nz§ §        § §        §Applications close on Monday 23rd November 2020§        § §        §Auckland Council is an equal opportunity employer (EOE) and we are committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity and inclusion. If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us at the time of application to assist you through the recruitment process.§        §Transformational corporate office optimisation programme of size, scale and complexity rarely available in New Zealand.§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§He angitūtanga: The opportunity§ §Our Corporate Property team has an exciting new career opportunity, Manager WorkSmart Programme. You will have an in-depth understanding of commercial property sector disciplines including contract management, negotiation and project management. xenophobe: right to live and work
jobText: TXT/50881255.txt	§National Country Manager - Real Estate§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§National Country Manager - Real Estate§§Advertiser: §Bayleys Realty Group§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§4 Nov 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Real Estate & Property§, §Other§§§§§§Lead and build this high performing Country Real Estate business§Corporate role but you will not lose touch with what rural NZ is all about§Flexibility as to where the role is based within NZ§Bayleys is an iconic, privately and locally owned NZ success story being recognised as NZ's biggest full-service Real Estate company. Bayleys' specialist Country division is recognised as NZ's number one real estate brand with salespeople on the ground from the far north to the deep south specialising in marketing and selling rural real estate.§This opportunity exists due to the incumbent taking on the Chief Operation Officer role within the Group. The National Country Manager we are looking for, will be a natural leader who is passionate about rural NZ and whose primary focus will be to lead and grow the Bayleys National Country business. This will involve managing and developing relationships with key industry and corporate organisations, major banks and advisory organisations so it is expected that you will already be in a role where your expertise is recognised and respected in commercial circles relating to the rural sector.§Responsibilities include the following:§Growth of rural and lifestyle market share§Lead and overview of Bayleys Country activities nationwide§Work in conjunction with franchise partners to lead the Bayleys Country product§Develop and document Country strategies nationally§Centralise financial reporting for all Bayleys Country activity§Recruit, train and mentor Country Leaders in the business, manage leadership group§Oversee key client account management strategies§Provide quarterly reports to GM and COO§Liaise with Country Marketing Manager to drive country marketing portfolio and brand§Build national media presence and profile§Manage rural Corporate relationships§Facilitate the national country conference§Bayleys has over 90 offices in NZ, with all regions having a strong country presence. This role can be based out of any of Bayleys' high performing country offices. Regular travel will be required to ensure the franchise partners are all kept up to date with latest developments.§The National Country Manager represents the rural business for Bayleys but ideas and strategies are shared with you colleagues in the Commercial and the Residential Business who are also based in Auckland.§This key appointment will suit someone who is a born networker who gets a thrill out of being involved in 'the deal' while still having strong commercial acumen to strategise and look for opportunities to ensure Bayleys remains the number one rural real estate brand in NZ.§To find out more about this unique opportunity and to get a full job description please apply in the strictest of confidence to Carol Henry 021 469 300 or §carol.henry@bayleys.co.nz§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

We're down to earth. We're smart and curious. We are people obsessed. We understand.§ §Classic Builders is a success story that spans more than 20 years. They wanted to build better homes with quality and affordability taking centre stage.§ §Now the second largest residential builder in New Zealand, Classic Builders has built over 6,000 homes across Aotearoa. § §But we can't do this alone – we rely on the tenacity of our people, the heart of our business.§ §Our Lakes District branch has a brand-new opportunity for a superstar to join the team! This growth strategy continues to cement The Rent Shop’s reputation as the most innovative and energised property management company in the industry.§ Born from the desire to deliver a progressive approach to the property market, The Rent Shop has become a powerful brand growing wealth, protecting investments, and a partner in property management trading second to none.§ Reputation is everything at The Rent Shop and the track record is exemplary.§ §About the role§ The key focus of this role is to build the rental portfolio in the Manukau Prime Market Area (PMA).§ It is your job to actively create new business in the PMA while providing top service and returns to the landlord ensuring consistent communication and reliable tenants.§ This is a complex industry sector -
