Be awesome, be proactive, and grow.§ Nail your job with commitment and contribute strategically. Be one of the team at The Rent Shop.§ §The Rent Shop application process§ Property Employment NZ are our selected recruitment partners.§  §To guarantee The Rent Shop are able to view your application click the apply section of Property Employment NZ's job ad and upload your resume.§  § A unique login to our specific recruitment assignment guarantees all applications will be reviewed by The Rent Shop.§  § A job description can be obtained by emailing §russell@propertyemployment.co.nz§ or §cassandra@propertyemployment.co.nz§  § You can also call Russell Phillips at Property Employment NZ on §09 271 3200§ or 027 479 0000.§  § Property Employment NZ is a division of JOBCORP NZ Ltd§      §      §+64 9 271 3200§ §      §    §    §  §§§Job reference - 620985§ § §The Rent Shop Ltd: A fresh, innovative, progressive, supportive, and energised company§ §Nationwide expansion provides genuine career scope§ §Acknowledgement, personal growth, and standards that are the envy of industry§ § § §About the employer§ Having entered a proactive national growth strategy, The Rent Shop now has multiple locations in Manukau, Botany, Auckland City, Hobsonville, Taranaki, Tauranga, Nelson, and Dunedin§ The Rent Shop continue their expansion in other main cities around New Zealand. This growth strategy continues to cement The Rent Shop’s reputation as the most innovative and energised property management company in the industry.§ Born from the desire to deliver a progressive approach to the property market, The Rent Shop has become a powerful brand growing wealth, protecting investments, and a partner in property management trading second to none.§ Reputation is everything at The Rent Shop and the track record is exemplary.§ §About the role§ The key focus of this role is to build the rental portfolio in the Manukau Prime Market Area (PMA).§ It is your job to actively create new business in the PMA while providing top service and returns to the landlord ensuring consistent communication and reliable tenants.§ This is a complex industry sector - the BDM needs to be able to work strategically and think and act intelligently with rapidity and efficiency.§ §General Description of Position:§ § §Develop and actively prospect for new business forging mutually valuable relationships with landlord property investors and gaining repeat and referral business§ §Communicating the unique market position of The Rent Shop to landlords so they understand the genuine advantage of entrusting their properties to The Rent Shop to manage§ §Meet the financial management and growth objectives of the Property Management Department on a monthly and annualised basis§ §Conduct rental appraisals§ §Utilise all available databases and a variety of marketing resources to secure new business§ §Complete all paperwork and digital content with excellent efficiency rapidly delivering superior service delivery to landlords§ §Contributing to, as well as attending all meetings and training sessions§ §Consistent and ongoing development of your knowledge of the residency tenancy act (RTA) is a requirement§ §Your ability to communicate and proactively engage with landlords on an ongoing basis is essential§ §Delivering superior social media engagement in conjunction with your manager providing fresh valuable content to the marketplace. This is a role that develops a high public profile, you need to be prepared to be the face of The Rent Shop Manukau and deliver their unique message of excellence§ §The BDM is to use all sources possible to find potential landlords, working closely with the executive team, grafting leads and turning those leads into real life business§ §Create new ideas, be involved, find new ways of doing things, review existing procedures and make them better§ §Participate in creative discussions around digital and social media, marketing material and any other new business-related campaigns including investor information evenings§ § § §What we are looking for§ § §The Rent Shop are a team of fresh thinking, inspirational, quick-minded, and dynamic property professionals§ §You will know you’re bright§ §You will dress with modern professionalism because those are the standards you imbibe§ §You will have the ability to engage with the team and investor clients charismatically bringing intelligence, fun, and efficiency to the workplace§ §  § §Your background§ Clear open thinking means we will consider a range of backgrounds, but it is likely you will consider yourself intelligent, educated, charismatic, and engaging because this is a role that requires you to build warm relationships with ease.§ While it would be sensational to find these attributes in someone who has a residential property business development background, we are open to receiving applications from business development professionals from other industries as well.§ §The challenge and rewards§ Remuneration is via a base salary and performance-based bonuses. A decent company car is provided, as well as training. No reward comes without challenge.§ There will be support for you to thrive through training, positive reinforcement, and acknowledgement. Your challenge is to make your career grow at The Rent Shop. Be awesome, be proactive, and grow.§ Nail your job with commitment and contribute strategically. Be one of the team at The Rent Shop.§ §The Rent Shop application process§ Property Employment NZ are our selected recruitment partners.§  §To guarantee The Rent Shop are able to view your application click the apply section of Property Employment NZ's job ad and upload your resume.§  § A unique login to our specific recruitment assignment guarantees all applications will be reviewed by The Rent Shop.§  § A job description can be obtained by emailing §russell@propertyemployment.co.nz§ or §cassandra@propertyemployment.co.nz§  § You can also call Russell Phillips at Property Employment NZ on §09 271 3200§ or 027 479 0000.§  § Property Employment NZ is a division of JOBCORP NZ Ltd§§§§

Essentially this role will be responsible for the delivery of a series of innovative strategic initiatives which will contribute towards commercial optimisation and revenue opportunities for the Rotorua Airport. Additional responsibility exists around growing existing revenue streams in both non aeronautical and aeronautical activities.§        §Key aspects of the role include;§        § §        §          §Opportunity identification, feasibility and business case preparation§          §Project oversight and management§          §Sector and route growth and development§          §Performing daily activities required to build a pipeline of opportunities and generate an expanded revenue base§          §Renegotiation of existing aviation, commercial, advertising, lease or transport operator agreements§          §Leading the airports decarbonisation programme§          §Work with key customers to enhance mutual growth and revenue opportunities§          §Documentation of agreements§          §Prepare weekly, monthly and annual reports as required§        § Our ideal candidate will be degree qualified – ideally in Property, with solid demonstratable commercial expertise and nous. along with a proactive and solution orientated approach.  This is an exceptional opportunity to join the team at the Rotorua Airport – working with a professional team amongst exciting new commercial initiatives that will make a positive and lasting impact for the Rotorua region.§        §Please apply online to Kellie Hamlett, Recruitment Specialist at Talent ID Recruitment Ltd, §0800 850080§. jobTitle: Real Estate Sales Success Is Waiting In Panmure Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50902448.txt	§Real Estate Sales Success Is Waiting In Panmure§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Real Estate Sales Success Is Waiting In Panmure§§Advertiser: §NetYourJob§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Nov 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Manukau & East Auckland§§Salary§§$$ Uncapped Earning Potential $$§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Real Estate & Property§, §Residential Sales§§§§§§$$ Uncapped Earning Potential $$§Panmure, Full Time, Real Estate Sales§Please Quote Reference Number 77846§§We're interested in all levels of Real Estate Sales experience§Prominent location and very experienced Branch Manager§Get the best training, support & resources with Barfoot & Thompson§Real Estate is an industry that rewards hard workers, so if you are wanting to build a strong career §THIS§ is your chance.§Panmure is undergoing tremendous growth and opening up even greater opportunity than ever before; we have 3 positions available for the right people to assist in catering for that growth.§We're looking for people who are willing to put in the hard yards and reap the benefits of this rewarding industry. If you're ready to find career success, you've come to the right place!§Whether you have your REA License and want to continue your Real Estate success, or you're looking to build a profitable career - we have opportunities for you.§When you join our established successful team you will benefit from:§Branch manager of 25 years' experience (AREINZ)§Uncapped commission earning potential§On-going training and support§Manager that doesn't sell (support role - not competitor)§Open access to all our property listings company wide§Dealing directly with the Clients of our listed properties§An impressive in-house IT System and marketing campaigns§No restrictions, no boundaries ~ you can sell property Auckland wide!§Barfoot & Thompson has been voted the best Real Estate company in the world - selling more than one in three homes. These figures place us significantly ahead of all other brands giving you the opportunity to access MORE BUYERS.§Follow these links for more information on Panmure:§http://www.panuku.co.nz/panmure§https://at.govt.nz/projects-roadworks/ameti/panmure-to-pakuranga-%28phase-2%29/§https://www.tamakiregeneration.co.nz/§§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have a Full or Restricted NZ Drivers Licence? (Please answer: YES or NO)§Do you hold a current Real Estate Agent's licence?§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50893435.txt	§Registered Valuer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Registered Valuer§§Advertiser: §Parker Bridge – Global Recruiter Winners 2018 – Best Marketing Campaign§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Nov 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Real Estate & Property§, §Valuation§§§§§§The Company:§We have an exciting opportunity for a Registered Valuer to join this highly reputable multi-disciplinary property and construction consultancy business.  Our client is one of New Zealand’s leading companies in its field and has built a strong reputation exceeding client’s expectations.  § §About You: §We require a registered valuer, preferably ANZIV, with a minimum of two years NZ experience to join this close-knit team. Ideally you will have exposure valuating both residential and commercial sites and display excellent time management skills. You will be able to build lasting relationships with clients and lending establishments.§ §You will be someone who can work both individually and part of the wider team but must be able to take ownership of your role. Duties will include:§§Conduct Valuations for Residential, commercial and industrial sites§Analysis and report writing§Market research and analysis§Develop and maintain client/customer relationships§§ §What’s next?§To apply for this role, click the link provided and attach your up to date CV and cover letter.§ §At Parker Bridge, we make every effort to respond to all applications, however sometimes the volume we receive is so large it is not possible. If you do not receive a response from us, please don't take it personally as we really value the effort you made to apply.§§§§

jobTitle: Real Estate Sales Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50880927.txt	§Real Estate Sales§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Real Estate Sales§§Advertiser: §REAP Recruitment§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§4 Nov 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Papakura & Franklin§§Salary§§LJ Hooker§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Real Estate & Property§, §Residential Sales§§§§§§§§§  §    §      §Real Estate Sales §    §    §      §LJ Hooker understand that when it comes to selling, buying, managing or renting property the most important factor is their clients.  They are looking for §New & Experienced Real Estate Salespeople§ to assist in providing an excellent service in their Manurewa, Pukekohe and Karaka offices.§  § They are an enthusiastic, well trained team who have won many of the top national awards within LJ Hookers 91 offices in the past few years. They pride themselves on their service and their integrity and would love to show you how they can make your Real Estate career a success.§  § §BECOMING AN REAL ESTATE SALEPERSON§ LJ Hooker know there is nothing quite like the buzz of selling a home. It is more than just a business transaction – it is about looking after the customer’s future plans and dreams. Whether it’s been a long-held ambition or if you’ve already excelled in sales in another area, LJ Hooker can help you realise your potential in the exciting industry of real estate.§  § §IS THIS THE JOB FOR ME?§ At LJ Hooker, we match the right people to the right job. Our special six-step process will not only give you an insight into property sales but also determine your suitability to work as an agent.  Learn about specific traits that research shows are shared by many leading property experts. See if your skills and personality match the reality of a real estate career. If you love hitting the phones and talking to people or businesses, then it’s likely this will be the job for you!§  § §WHAT ARE THE BENEFITS?§ It may appear glamourous, but Salespeople need to work hard to achieve the best result for their vendors. Commissions earned are commensurate with effort and you enjoy the added bonus of a flexible working day. There is also the great satisfaction of finding buyers a new home, a change in location, being involved in developments or assisting those taking their first steps on a property ladder.§  § §BE INSPIRED AND INFORMED§ Learn from the best real estate coaches in a special Master Class designed to show you what it takes to succeed in the property industry. Some of what you will learn may surprise you! Be supported with training right up to your first listing. Helping you on this journey will be a specially selected mentor who will also introduce you to job opportunities within the network.§  § Join the most dynamic real estate group. Make a difference. Be valued. Accelerate your success.§  § We have opportunities in Manurewa, Pukekohe and Karaka offices. APPLY NOW through our online application form.  .  All applications will be treated in the strictest confidence.§  § §This role is being managed by REAP Recruitment. Please apply on-line below to be considered. All applications will remain confidential to REAP Recruitment & LJ Hooker and will only be forwarded on to others with your consent. § §REAP Recruitment specialise in recruitment for the Real Estate and Property (REAP) industries.  We are your independent choice whether you're wanting to see if the "grass is greener" or looking for a new role §      §      §Matt Hunter§Apply On-Line §    §    §  §§§LJ Hooker understand that when it comes to selling, buying, managing or renting property the most important factor is their clients.  They are looking for §New & Experienced Real Estate Salespeople§ to assist in providing an excellent service in their Manurewa, Pukekohe and Karaka offices.§  § They are an enthusiastic, well trained team who have won many of the top national awards within LJ Hookers 91 offices in the past few years. They pride themselves on their service and their integrity and would love to show you how they can make your Real Estate career a success.§  § §BECOMING AN REAL ESTATE SALEPERSON§ LJ Hooker know there is nothing quite like the buzz of selling a home. It is more than just a business transaction – it is about looking after the customer’s future plans and dreams. Whether it’s been a long-held ambition or if you’ve already excelled in sales in another area, LJ Hooker can help you realise your potential in the exciting industry of real estate.§  § §IS THIS THE JOB FOR ME?§ At LJ Hooker, we match the right people to the right job. Our special six-step process will not only give you an insight into property sales but also determine your suitability to work as an agent.  Learn about specific traits that research shows are shared by many leading property experts. See if your skills and personality match the reality of a real estate career. If you love hitting the phones and talking to people or businesses, then it’s likely this will be the job for you!§  § §WHAT ARE THE BENEFITS?§ It may appear glamourous, but Salespeople need to work hard to achieve the best result for their vendors. Commissions earned are commensurate with effort and you enjoy the added bonus of a flexible working day. There is also the great satisfaction of finding buyers a new home, a change in location, being involved in developments or assisting those taking their first steps on a property ladder.§  § §BE INSPIRED AND INFORMED§ Learn from the best real estate coaches in a special Master Class designed to show you what it takes to succeed in the property industry. Some of what you will learn may surprise you! Be supported with training right up to your first listing. Helping you on this journey will be a specially selected mentor who will also introduce you to job opportunities within the network.§  § Join the most dynamic real estate group. Make a difference. Be valued. Accelerate your success.§  § We have opportunities in Manurewa, Pukekohe and Karaka offices. APPLY NOW through our online application form.  .  All applications will be treated in the strictest confidence.§  § §This role is being managed by REAP Recruitment. Please apply on-line below to be considered. All applications will remain confidential to REAP Recruitment & LJ Hooker and will only be forwarded on to others with your consent. § §REAP Recruitment specialise in recruitment for the Real Estate and Property (REAP) industries.  We are your independent choice whether you're wanting to see if the "grass is greener" or looking for a new role §§§§

jobText: TXT/50866716.txt	§Maintenance Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Maintenance Manager§§Advertiser: §Hays Facilities Management§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§2 Nov 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Salary§§Negotiable based on experience and qualifications§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Real Estate & Property§, §Body Corporate & Facilities Management§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §        §Maintenance Manager §        §This is the opportunity you have been waiting for §        §          §Great package and benefits on offer §          §Genuine opportunity for personal and career development §          §A support team ready to help and ensure you succeed in this role §        §        §          §Your new company§Our client’s purpose is to enhance the value and productivity of New Zealand’s horticultural, arable, seafood and food and beverage industries as they contribute to economic growth and the environmental and social prosperity of New Zealand.§ § §Your new role§ You will be responsible for the day-to-day management of several key buildings within this single-site portfolio. The role of the Facilities and Maintenance Manager is to ensure all premises are maintained to a high standard, ensuring the comfort and safety of all staff and customers is maintained at all times. The role has overall responsibility for ensuring all aspects of planned and reactive maintenance is completed within agreed timeframes.§ § §What you'll need to succeed§ To succeed in this role, you will have relevant and recent industry experience; and previous exposure to an engineering/trades environment will see you rise as the preferred candidate. You will also need to have:§ §          §            §At least five years’ experience in engineering and/or 10 years in facilities/maintenance management with proven hands-on experience plant and equipment maintenance§            §A tertiary qualification in property management, engineering or trade qualification in a building related trade such as mechanical/electrical/HVAC engineering§            §Familiarity and understanding of the Building Act§            §Good written and verbal communication skills§            §Proven project management skills and ability to see a job through to completion§            §Experience with Computarised Maintenance Management Systems (CMMS)§          §          § §What you'll get in return§          §            §A competitive and realistic salary package§            §The security of working for one of New Zealand’s safest and most desired employer§            §A friendly, flexible team-based work environment supporting career development§            §Excellent benefits including health insurance and generous employer contributions to superannuation§            §Free car parking on site in their award-winning facilities§          §          § §What you need to do now§ If you’re interested, click ‘apply now’ or if this position is not for you but you would like to find out more about other positions in the Property & Facilities Management sector, please contact Eli DaCruz on §09 884 1507§ or e-mail CV to §eli.dacruz@hays.net.nz§          § At Hays, we value diversity and are passionate about placing people in a role where they can flourish and succeed. We actively encourage people from diverse backgrounds to apply.§        §        §        §Reference Number: 2413539 §        §        §To apply please click§ the 'Apply' button below.§ §      §    §  §§§Your new company§Our client’s purpose is to enhance the value and productivity of New Zealand’s horticultural, arable, seafood and food and beverage industries as they contribute to economic growth and the environmental and social prosperity of New Zealand.§ § §Your new role§ You will be responsible for the day-to-day management of several key buildings within this single-site portfolio. The role of the Facilities and Maintenance Manager is to ensure all premises are maintained to a high standard, ensuring the comfort and safety of all staff and customers is maintained at all times. The role has overall responsibility for ensuring all aspects of planned and reactive maintenance is completed within agreed timeframes.§ § §What you'll need to succeed§ To succeed in this role, you will have relevant and recent industry experience; and previous exposure to an engineering/trades environment will see you rise as the preferred candidate. You will also need to have:§ §At least five years’ experience in engineering and/or 10 years in facilities/maintenance management with proven hands-on experience plant and equipment maintenance§A tertiary qualification in property management, engineering or trade qualification in a building related trade such as mechanical/electrical/HVAC engineering§Familiarity and understanding of the Building Act§Good written and verbal communication skills§Proven project management skills and ability to see a job through to completion§Experience with Computarised Maintenance Management Systems (CMMS)§ §What you'll get in return§A competitive and realistic salary package§The security of working for one of New Zealand’s safest and most desired employer§A friendly, flexible team-based work environment supporting career development§Excellent benefits including health insurance and generous employer contributions to superannuation§Free car parking on site in their award-winning facilities§ §What you need to do now§ If you’re interested, click ‘apply now’ or if this position is not for you but you would like to find out more about other positions in the Property & Facilities Management sector, please contact Eli DaCruz on §09 884 1507§ or e-mail CV to §eli.dacruz@hays.net.nz§ At Hays, we value diversity and are passionate about placing people in a role where they can flourish and succeed. We actively encourage people from diverse backgrounds to apply.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50900252.txt	§Real Estate Sales§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Real Estate Sales§§Advertiser: §REAP Recruitment§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Nov 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Waitakere & West Auckland§§Salary§§LJ Hooker Central West§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Real Estate & Property§, §Residential Sales§§§§§§§§§  §    §      §Real Estate Sales §    §    §      §We currently have a fabulous opportunity for §Existing & New Real Estate Salespeople§ to join the team at LJ Hooker Central West, located in the heart of Henderson.§        §          §All levels of Real Estate Sales experience required§          §Outstanding opportunity to develop your Real Estate career§        § Have you ever wondered how your sales skills would translate to a career in Real Estate? Real Estate is a fast paced industry and not for the faint hearted but can be an exciting, rewarding career. This role could be suited to someone who has experience in Real Estate but maybe wants more flexible hours and is looking to join a supportive team and work locally. §I am on the hunt for a pro-active, friendly and helpful person to join my team to assist in all areas of real estate including but not limited to overseeing all the marketing material for my listings including the website, social media content, updating brochures, online listings, and also being an integral part of the sales team. jobText: TXT/50904053.txt	§Property Administrator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Property Administrator§§Advertiser: §Quinovic Property Management§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Nov 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Rodney & North Shore§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Real Estate & Property§, §Administration§§§§§§Property Administrator§  §Quinovic Property Management based in North Harbour have an opportunity for a full time Property Administrator to provide administrative, accounts, social media, and property management support to the property management team.§  §About Quinovic§  §Quinovic Property Management has over 30 years of experience and expertise. With 33 offices nationwide, 180+ staff and thousands of properties under management we one of New Zealand's largest specialist independent property management company.§  §About the Role§  §In this role you will work as part of a supportive team ensuring all administrative tasks and property services are delivered in a manner that meets or exceeds the expectations of all owners and tenants.§  §Key Responsibilities§ § §Provide administrative support to the property management team.§ §Prepare weekly social media posts and fortnightly mailchimp newsletters.§ §Processing of water rates and maintenance invoices.§ §Provide overflow support to the Letting/Inspection Agent to complete reference checking, credit checking and tenancy history checks prior to preparation of the Tenancy Agreement. Phone owners to confirm tenancy proposal and acceptance by the owner.§ §Prepare Tenancy Agreements in a timely, diligent and efficient manner in accordance with specific SPM instructions and/or standard Quinovic operating procedures.§ §Prepare Tenancies Due to Expire and Tenancy Extension letters, chase outstanding and overdue letter returns.§ §Complete and follow up Rent Arrears including phoning tenants, email, text, issue 14-day notices for water and rent.§ §Arrange required repair and maintenance work and work orders. Manage outstanding work orders with suppliers, maintain the maintenance log and keep owners and tenants updated on progress.§ §Provide weekly and other reports as directed by SPM or Business Owner.§ §Achieve the Key Performance Indicators (KPI) as set from time to time by the SPM.§ §Seek advice from SPM or Business Owner at any time where you are unsure with specific instructions or unaware of the Quinovic operating procedures in a given circumstance.§ §Answer phones when in the office and scan properties files into the Quinovic system when time allows.§ §Other duties as directed by the SPM or Business Owner.§ §To succeed in the role you will need:§  §This role would suit someone with upwards of two/three years of office, accounts and/or property administration experience, or a recent university graduate (Property or Business), with an interest in property management. §  §A confident and personable nature with excellent customer service skills.§  §To be results driven with the ability to handle high workloads under pressure.§  §A clean New Zealand driver's licence.§  §Strong written and verbal communication and computer skills.§  §If you are a passionate, dynamic, enjoy variety and delivering exceptional customer service then apply now. Full training will be provided to the successful candidate.§  §If you believe you have what we are looking for, please APPLY NOW through our online application form submitting your CV and a brief application letter on how you believe you can add value to the role to.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§How many years of residential property management experience do you have?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

jobText: TXT/50949340.txt	§Residential Property Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Residential Property Manager§§Advertiser: §Gralin Property Management Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§13 Nov 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Real Estate & Property§, §Residential Leasing & Property Management§§§§§§Property Manager § §To support our recent growth, GRALIN is looking for a bright and outgoing Property Manager to join our Auckland Central Team. You will be trained up on Property Management with a view to progressing on to Property Management team once you are confident in all areas of Property Management. The successful candidate is likely to be a well-spoken, team player who is well presented and well mannered.  They are likely to be energetic, motivated, positive and have a sunny outlook. If you are highly motivated, looking for growth and want to be rewarded for superior performance, GRALIN can help you achieve those goals.§ §            § §THE ROLE§ § The Property Manager will be working in a fast-paced and demanding environment dealing with landlords, tenants and contractors. You must be a strong and resilient character who is a confident communicator with the ability to resolve issues effectively within a timely manner, all while delivering exceptional levels of customer service.§ §The job duties will be:§ §      •   Conducting inspections and listing properties for lease§ §      •   Cataloguing properties for lease and arranging advertising§ §      •   Monitoring and negotiating renewal of all tenancies in portfolio§ §      •   Supervising the leasing of rental properties on behalf of owners, collecting rents§ §      •   Answering general queries relating to property throughout the tenancy and addressing incoming mails§ §      •   Maintaining accurate record of all communication and correspondence§ § § §KEY SKILLS   § §      •    Experience of working in a busy office environment§ §      •    Strong time management skills and the ability to work to tight deadlines§ §      •    The ability to work under pressure§ §      •    Proven customer service skills§ §      •    Strong problem solving skills and be able to work on own initiative§ §      •    Self-motivated, energetic person with a positive attitude. Similar work experience is preferred but keen to learn attitude is important. Always pays attention to details, proper attire and professional appearance      § §      •    This job needs to go out to meet clients from time to time so full driver’s licence is required§ §      •    Competent knowledge and use of the Microsoft Office suite is essential§ §      •  Fluent in both Chinese and English are preferable§ § § § § §JOB BENEFITS§ §      •    Salary Range -  by negotiation, according to your work experience§ §      •    Benefits Package (petrol, phone, ongoing training, etc.)§ §      •    Paid Vacation and Holidays§ §      § §If you are interested in this position, just click and apply online.§ §If you would like to have more information, please contact §tenancy@gralin.co.nz§. Please quote "Property Manager" in your email.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years of residential property management experience do you have?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§§§

jobText: TXT/50943316.txt	§Property Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Property Manager§§Advertiser: §Waikato Real Estate§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§13 Nov 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Hamilton§§Salary§§$70,000 - $89,999 commission only§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Real Estate & Property§, §Residential Leasing & Property Management§§§§§§Are you hungry, humble and smart?§Those three words mean a lot to us and we are looking for that special somebody to join our team of Property Managers.§Who we are§Established in 1985, Waikato Real Estate is a family owned business, born and bred in the Waikato. We are a local, independent and agile company built with passion and purpose to provide our clients with superior property management service to take the hassle out of owning a rental property.§We have three offices, 30+ employees and manage over 1,200 rental properties throughout the greater Waikato. §Humankind won’t be forgetting the year 2020 for a while, but for our business it’s been a breakout year. Our rent roll is growing and so too is the trophy cabinet! In September we were proud to be named NZ Property Management Office of the Year and we are currently dusting off our tuxedos and ball gowns for the Westpac Waikato Business Awards, where we are among the Finalists!§Who we are looking for§As a Property Manager you’ll be the beating heart of our business, sitting at the intersection between the tenant, the property and the landlord. §You’ll be an integral part of our business so we’ll invest in your training, allow you to work flexible hours in flexible places, reward you fairly and afford you the respect and recognition you deserve.§We’re looking for someone with experience in Property Management. §Your pay will be a fair share of the management and letting fees and you can expect to manage 100+ properties from the get go. §If you tick all these boxes then we’d love to hear from you!§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§How many years' experience do you have as a property manager?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

jobText: TXT/50913833.txt	§General Manager - Asset Management§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§General Manager - Asset Management§§Advertiser: §Ministry of Education§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§9 Nov 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Real Estate & Property§, §Other§§§§§§General Manager - Asset Management§Permanent - full-time§Location - Auckland or Wellington§An exciting opportunity to lead the development of asset management maturity across school property!§Kia ora, Bula Vinaka, Fakaalofa lahi atu, Fakatalofa atu, Kia orana, Malo e lelei, Malo ni, Talofa lava, Tena koutou katoa, and welcome.§Help shape the future of education§At the Ministry of Education, we work together to shape an education system that delivers equitable and excellent outcomes.§Our organisation is made up of more than 3,000 talented and committed people around New Zealand, from a wide range of backgrounds and cultures.§While we work in different groups and on different things, we all strive every day to make the biggest difference we can for every child, young person and adult student in our education system.§About us§Education Infrastructure Service (EIS), a part of the Ministry of Education, manages the Crown's second largest property portfolio of around 2,100 schools with a book value of $18.3 billion, the largest payroll in the country, and transportation of over 100,000 students to and from school each day.§Our vision for school property is that all schools have quality learning environments as part of a well-managed and sustainable portfolio that helps deliver equitable and excellent outcomes for every child.§About the role§Earlier this year we announced Te Rautaki Rawa Kura - the School Property Strategy, which shares our vision and direction for school property management. To help implement the strategy we have created a number of new positions to ensure that we have the right foundation and alignment of functions to support implementation of Te Rautaki Rawa Kura.§You will report to the Associate Deputy Secretary - Property Delivery and lead a group responsible for leading asset management planning maturity, advice and support to schools.§A key focus for this position will be to lead the development of asset management across school property. You will also play a vital role in issues resolution and oversee the New Zealand state school property portfolio.§Please note that there is further information in the attached Job Description.§About you§You will demonstrate a strong mix of skills and experience within a large and complex delivery organisation that involved strategic and financial/operational management accountability. Your relevant tertiary qualification or professional property qualification such as Asset Management, Infrastructure Planning, Property or Project management and/or significant relevant experience is essential.§To be successful in this role you will need the following:§Highly developed strategic critical thinking skills and analytical capability§A proven record in change leadership and successful implementation and management of multiple and diverse programmes and services§Familiarity working within civil infrastructure and complexities this provides§The ability to deliver results / improvements to key systems in complex organisational settings§Experience of leading a large team to develop and achieve asset management maturity§The ability to understand and apply the principles of Te Tiriti o Waitangi§Are you ready to make a difference?§We welcome candidates from diverse backgrounds, including Māori, Pacific and those with disabilities, who will enrich our understanding of the education system.§As a government agency, the Ministry is committed to the Treaty of Waitangi's guiding principles in our work for and with Māori students, their whānau, hapū and iwi.§Please review the Job Description attached and if this opportunity interests you and you meet the requirements, please apply now using the 'Apply Online' button. §For further information please contact Stephanie Phillips at §eis.recruitment@education.govt.nz§Click here to view the role description§§Applications close midnight - §Tuesday, 24 November 2020.§§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50928345.txt	§Acquisition Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Acquisition Manager§§Advertiser: §Stonewood Group Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§11 Nov 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Real Estate & Property§, §Retail & Property Development§§§§§§About us§ §Stonewood Group is a large, well-established, NZ owned property group with over 25 years proven experience and stability in the market.  We love growth and achieve the group goals through our supportive and committed team.§ §Our current focus is in house and commercial construction projects across the country. The Group operates a number of stand-alone subsidiaries such as Stonewood Homes, Pullman Rotorua Hotel, Urban Hub, RCR Infrastructure, and Park Avenue Residences, to name a few.§ §We are proud to have talented and dedicated teams across New Zealand that we recognise as the foundation of our success. We embrace opportunity, together.§ §Stonewood Homes Franchisor Limited is looking for an experienced Acquisition Manager. This role is responsible to look for land development opportunities for Stonewood Homes. You will then be responsible to negotiate with land owner for either joint venture land development or acquire the land, provide summary and report of current land development market, assist preparing feasibility studies. § §If you are looking for a challenging and rewarding role that is fast paced & diverse; and if you would like to work with the best, then please step forward.§ §About the role§ § §Assist in securing property (land)§ §Intimately know the market and players in the city§ §Assist in analyzing feasibility items such as phase I environmental site reports, surveys, plats, construction plans and easements§ §Title commitment review and analysis§ §Review and screen land submittings§ §Perform strategic marketing research – competitive analysis for target communities which includes price graph comparisons, MLS data research, school district analysis and property ownership research§ §Compile and analyse development budgets for both targeted acquisition deals and future phases of active communities§ § Formulate budgets for assigned programs/projects and administer related vendor contracts, change orders, check request and invoices. Prepare periodically updated annual objectives, budgets and schedules§ §Review zoning and unitary plan documents to understand building requirements§ §Coordinate preliminary land planning§ §Represent Stonewood Homes at consultant meetings and council meetings§ §Assist due diligence efforts for potential land acquisitions.  Assist in the preparation of feasibility studies, budgets and entitlement/development schedules and risk assessments and assist with title review§ §Assist with sales and market research by preparing competitive market analysis graphs and reports§ §May assist management team and coordinate with project consultants, including architects, engineers, landscape architects, soils and environmental engineers, and other consultants in preparation of required development reports and approval.§ §May assist in coordination and communication with legal counsel, architects, brokers and consultants in the acquisition efforts§ §About you§ § §3 years or more experience of real estate agent or mortgage broker § §Bachelor’s degree or equivalent.  Preferred emphasis in economics, finance, marketing, business, real estate or a related real estate field, but will accept equivalent work exp.§ §An understanding of land development  relating to sub-division process, zoning, consenting and building process.§ §Home building/Real Estate development and/or financial analysis experience preferred.§ §Benefits§ §In Stonewood Homes, we offer an active office environment, and excellent remuneration. The ability for personal growth and shaping the way systems are delivered means every individual can bring their own expertise to the team.§ §If you are interested in the role, please copy and paste the below link to your browser and APPLY now!§ §https://stonewoodgroup.bamboohr.com/jobs/view.php?id=360§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have in the real estate industry?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

jobText: TXT/50940381.txt	§Technical Services Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Technical Services Manager§§Advertiser: §Earthquake Commission (EQC)§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§11 Nov 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Real Estate & Property§, §Body Corporate & Facilities Management§§§§§§ §The Earthquake Commission (EQC) Kōmihana Rūwhenua is a Crown Entity with a mission to reduce the impact of natural disasters on people and property.   We support people in their greatest hour of need when dealing with natural disasters such as earthquakes, floods, and landslips.  We also extensively fund and facilitate research to build understanding of natural disasters and help educated New Zealanders on how to prepare for and mitigate damage from natural disasters.§In this role, you will provide both strategic and operational engineering and specialist technical services direction as well as advice that ensures the accurate qualification of natural disaster damage, and the application of appropriate remediation solutions in a natural disaster event.§You will play an important role in supporting the development of EQC's event response strategy and in doing so, ensure the right technical skills and approaches are being considered and applied within the response and recovery phases of the event by EQC and its partners.§In addition to the above, you will lead a team of technical specialists and technical writers, with specific expertise in interpretation of the EQC Act and how it applies operationally. The capability of this team is strategically important to EQC for their ability to advise on the practical application of government policy, and similarly support the implementation of new operational policies to effectively guide and manage operations.§To be successful in this role you will have:§§A professional Engineering qualification§At least 10 years of technical experience in the field or in a related technical area.§Sound practical and technical knowledge of residential house construction and repair techniques.§This role requires a high level of technical expertise, communication, facilitation and co-ordination skills as well as an ability to lead from the front as required. §Proven team leadership experience, leading a team of experts not necessarily in your field of capability.§You will have a good knowledge of:§the local (and to the extent relevant regional) authority consenting requirements for residential house construction and repair§requirements under the Building Act (including the building Code, associated MBIE Guidelines and New Zealand Standards) relevant to residential house construction and repair.§§Strong organisation skills with a demonstrated ability to prioritise, plan and manage busy workloads effectively.§§EQC is dynamic, rewarding, invigorating, collaborative and challenging! We look for talented, motivated, customer centric and results focused individuals.  We are a high change, responsive and adaptive environment so resilience and agility in the way you work is essential.§For a more detailed understanding of the position and its key accountabilities please refer to the Position Description or apply by clicking on Apply Now! below. §Applications close Friday 27 November 2020, 5.00pm.§ §§§§

jobText: TXT/50913172.txt	§National Asset Manager Relocatables§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§National Asset Manager Relocatables§§Advertiser: §Ministry of Education§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§9 Nov 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Real Estate & Property§, §Other§§§§§§Kia ora, Bula Vinaka, Fakaalofa lahi atu, Fakatalofa atu, Kia orana, Malo e lelei, Malo ni, Talofa lava, Tena koutou katoa, and welcome.§Permanent - full-time§An exciting opportunity to lead the management of the Ministry's portfolio of temporary accommodation buildings§§Help shape the future of education§At the Ministry of Education, we work together to shape an education system that delivers equitable and excellent outcomes.§Our organisation is made up of more than 3,000 talented and committed people around New Zealand, from a wide range of backgrounds and cultures.§While we work in different groups and on different things, we all strive every day to make the biggest difference we can for every child, young person and adult student in our education system.§About us§Education Infrastructure Service (EIS), a part of the Ministry of Education, manages the Crown's second largest property portfolio of around 2,100 schools with a book value of $18.3 billion, the largest payroll in the country, and transportation of over 100,000 students to and from school each day.§Our vision for school property is that all schools have quality learning environments as part of a well-managed and sustainable portfolio that helps deliver equitable and excellent outcomes for every child.§About the role§Earlier this year we announced Te Rautaki Rawa Kura - the School Property Strategy, which shares our vision and direction for school property management. To help implement the strategy we have created a number of new positions to ensure that we have the right foundation and alignment of functions to support implementation of Te Rautaki Rawa Kura.§You will report to the General Manager Asset Management and be responsible for the management of the Ministry's portfolio of temporary accommodation buildings.§As a new role, the initial key focus for this position will be will be to develop a solid understanding of the location, ownership, condition and use of the current temporary accommodation portfolio, identifying opportunities for improvement to how temporary accommodation is planned, utilised and managed. Based on this knowledge the role would then develop a forward work programme that compliments the redevelopment and roll growth work pipeline§Please note that there is further information in the attached Job Description.§About you§You will demonstrate a strong mix of skills and experience within a large and complex delivery organisation and have a track record of success and results in a management role that involved strategic and financial/operational management accountability and a high need for stakeholder engagement. Your relevant tertiary qualification or experience in a comparable role is essential.§To be successful in this role you will need:§proven experience with programme management within infrastructure/property management§proven ability and experience of contributing to the development of asset management maturity§experience in effective risk management strategies and processes§proven critical thinking skills and analytical capability§highly developed relationship management skills with a proven ability to consult and influence at all levels§the ability to understand and apply the principles of Te Tiriti o Waitangi.§Are you ready to make a difference?§We welcome candidates from diverse backgrounds, including Māori, Pacific and those with disabilities, who will enrich our understanding of the education system.§As a government agency, the Ministry is committed to the Treaty of Waitangi's guiding principles in our work for and with Māori students, their whānau, hapū and iwi.§Please review the Job Description attached and if this opportunity interests you and you meet the requirements, please apply now using the 'Apply Online' button.§For further information please contact Stephanie Phillips at §eis.recruitment@education.govt.nz§Click here to view the role description§§Applications close midnight - Tuesday, 24 November 2020.§§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50940136.txt	§Acquisitions Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Acquisitions Manager§§Advertiser: §Kainga Ora§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§12 Nov 2020§§Location§§Hawkes Bay§, §Napier§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Real Estate & Property§, §Retail & Property Development§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Acquisitions Manager §      §        §          §Be part of a high performing, driven team§          §Exciting, fast paced targeted acquisition programme§          §$117,000 + 5 weeks annual leave, flexible working§        §        §Mō mātou - Our Organisation§        §At Kāinga Ora, ours is the important responsibility of transforming New Zealand's housing choices, outcomes and the entire housing sector by creating homes and communities that allow New Zealanders to thrive.§        § What is exciting about working for Kāinga Ora is getting the chance to make a real and positive impact on New Zealanders' lives. With skills, planning and purposeful action, our people are creating the homes and neighbourhoods that will build Aotearoa's future.We are passionate about transforming New Zealand for the better. That includes being a trusted partner for Māori and iwi, protecting and enabling their rights, interests and aspirations under the guidance of Te Tiriti o Waitangi.§        §Ko tā mātou mahi - Our Role§        §Commercial Group -§ The Commercial Group manages Kāinga Ora's key commercial activities, provides strategic leadership and advice to other groups and works with the broader market to achieve system transformation. It contains our developer support team who provide financial underwrites to housing projects that meet defined criteria, our procurement and supplier management team who support our business groups to source materials and services, and our acquisitions and divestment teams.§        §Our high performing national Acquisition team is growing, and as such we are now looking to welcome 4 x §Acquisition Managers§ to be based in Wellington, Hawkes Bay or Hamilton.§        §As an Acquisition Manager you will be responsible for acquiring property around New Zealand in the form of land, existing residential properties and design and build development projects.§        §Reporting to a Senior Acquisition Manager, and working as part of a supportive team, you will be tasked with:§        §          §The identification, feasibility analysis and negotiation of acquisition opportunities and the preparation of business cases for their approval.§          §Engaging with the property market to identify suppliers who can support this acquisition activity at scale - new business development.§          §Developing strong relationships with partners, and potential partners, to deliver ongoing supply of new constructed property.§        §        §Ngā pūmanawatanga ōu - What you will bring§        §          §Demonstrated experience and success in the property industry, particularly in the area of acquiring, managing and/or developing property§          §A commercial and results driven focus§          §Sound relationship management experience and experienced in managing multiple business partner relationships§          §Strong negotiation, communication, presentation skills§          §The ability to develop strong networks in the market to achieve successful outcomes and create successful new business opportunities§          §A tertiary qualification in the property sector (preferred).§          §Nōu te rourou - What's in it for you?§        §        §We offer competitive salaries, five weeks' annual leave and a benefits package including a range of insurances, flexible working arrangements and career development. These benefits are described in more detail here https://careers.kaingaora.govt.nz/a-great-place-to-work/benefits.§        §As a Kāinga Ora - Homes and Communities employee, we want to make sure that you have all the tools and support you need. We want to ensure you are healthy and have work-life balance. We also want to support and grow your personal and career development through on-the-job learning, training courses, secondments and study opportunities.§        §Ō Tātou Uara -§ §Our Values§        §Our values were developed by us, for us. They unite us as an organisation and guide how we work every day. Our values are:§        §          §Manaakitanga§ - People at the Heart§          §Mahi Tahi§ - Better Together§          §Whanake§ - Be Bold§        §        §Tūhono mai - Join us§        §To view the position description and apply for this role, please follow the online process via http://careers.kaingaora.govt.nz. Please note: all applicants, including existing employees, need to follow this process. If you have any questions, please contact the recruitment team via §Kaingaora.recruit@kaingaora.govt.nz§        §Applications close on 21st November 2020§        §We value diversity and are committed to working with each other and our customers in an inclusive and respectful way. That includes being a trusted partner for Māori and iwi, protecting and enabling their rights, interests and aspirations under the guidance of Te Tiriti o Waitangi.§Ko tā mātou mahi - Our Role§Commercial Group -§ The Commercial Group manages Kāinga Ora's key commercial activities, provides strategic leadership and advice to other groups and works with the broader market to achieve system transformation. It contains our developer support team who provide financial underwrites to housing projects that meet defined criteria, our procurement and supplier management team who support our business groups to source materials and services, and our acquisitions and divestment teams.§Our high performing national Acquisition team is growing, and as such we are now looking to welcome 4 x §Acquisition Managers§ to be based in Wellington, Hawkes Bay or Hamilton.§As an Acquisition Manager you will be responsible for acquiring property around New Zealand in the form of land, existing residential properties and design and build development projects.§Reporting to a Senior Acquisition Manager, and working as part of a supportive team, you will be tasked with:§The identification, feasibility analysis and negotiation of acquisition opportunities and the preparation of business cases for their approval.§Engaging with the property market to identify suppliers who can support this acquisition activity at scale - new business development.§Developing strong relationships with partners, and potential partners, to deliver ongoing supply of new constructed property.§Ngā pūmanawatanga ōu - What you will bring§Demonstrated experience and success in the property industry, particularly in the area of acquiring, managing and/or developing property§A commercial and results driven focus§Sound relationship management experience and experienced in managing multiple business partner relationships§Strong negotiation, communication, presentation skills§The ability to develop strong networks in the market to achieve successful outcomes and create successful new business opportunities§A tertiary qualification in the property sector (preferred).§Nōu te rourou - What's in it for you?§We offer competitive salaries, five weeks' annual leave and a benefits package including a range of insurances, flexible working arrangements and career development. These benefits are described in more detail here https://careers.kaingaora.govt.nz/a-great-place-to-work/benefits.§As a Kāinga Ora - Homes and Communities employee, we want to make sure that you have all the tools and support you need. We want to ensure you are healthy and have work-life balance. We also want to support and grow your personal and career development through on-the-job learning, training courses, secondments and study opportunities.§Ō Tātou Uara -§ §Our Values§Our values were developed by us, for us. jobTitle: Regional Asset Manager Job in Auckland - SEEK
xenophobe: right to live and work
jobText: TXT/50914402.txt	§Regional Asset Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Regional Asset Manager§§Advertiser: §Ministry of Education§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§10 Nov 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Real Estate & Property§, §Other§§§§§§Kia ora, Bula Vinaka, Fakaalofa lahi atu, Fakatalofa atu, Kia orana, Malo e lelei, Malo ni, Talofa lava, Tena koutou katoa, and welcome.§Permanent - full-time§An exciting opportunity to lead the group responsible for driving asset management planning maturity, advice and support to schools in the Auckland region§§Help shape the future of education§At the Ministry of Education, we work together to shape an education system that delivers equitable and excellent outcomes.§Our organisation is made up of more than 3,000 talented and committed people around New Zealand, from a wide range of backgrounds and cultures.§While we work in different groups and on different things, we all strive every day to make the biggest difference we can for every child, young person and adult student in our education system.§About us§Education Infrastructure Service (EIS), a part of the Ministry of Education, manages the Crown's second largest property portfolio of around 2,100 schools with a book value of $18.3 billion, the largest payroll in the country, and transportation of over 100,000 students to and from school each day.§Our vision for school property is that all schools have quality learning environments as part of a well-managed and sustainable portfolio that helps deliver equitable and excellent outcomes for every child.§About the role§Earlier this year we announced Te Rautaki Rawa Kura - the School Property Strategy, which shares our vision and direction for school property management. To help implement the strategy we have created a number of new positions to ensure that we have the right foundation and alignment of functions to support implementation of Te Rautaki Rawa Kura.§You will report to the General Manager Asset Management and lead the group responsible for leading asset management planning, advice and support to schools in the Auckland region.§A key focus for this position will be the responsibility for establishing the school property delivery priorities for the Auckland region. These priorities also apply to the separate Capital Works group who are responsible for the delivery of all Ministry led construction and property project delivery within the region (the Asset Management group are the internal client commissioning the Capital Works team to deliver projects).§Please note that there is further information in the attached Job Description.§About you§You will demonstrate a strong mix of skills and extensive experience within a large and complex delivery organisation that involved infrastructure/property management. Your relevant tertiary qualification or experience in a comparable role is essential.§To be successful in this role you will need the following:§Familiarity working within civil infrastructure and complexities this provides§Strong knowledge of the Government's direction, policy priorities, and budgeting processes and probity issues specific to the public sector§Track record of success and results in a management role in a large and complex delivery organization§Highly developed strategic critical thinking skills and analytical capability§Highly developed relationship management skills with a proven ability to consult and influence at all levels across functions§Proven ability to deliver results / improvements to key systems in complex organisational settings§The ability to understand and apply the principles of Te Tiriti o Waitangi§Are you ready to make a difference?§We welcome candidates from diverse backgrounds, including Māori, Pacific and those with disabilities, who will enrich our understanding of the education system.§As a government agency, the Ministry is committed to the Treaty of Waitangi's guiding principles in our work for and with Māori students, their whānau, hapū and iwi.§Please review the Job Description attached and if this opportunity interests you and you meet the requirements, please apply now using the ‘Apply Online' button.§For further information please contact Stephanie Phillips at §eis.recruitment@education.govt.nz§Click here to view the role description§§Applications close midnight - Tuesday, 24 November 2020.§§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

The main purpose of this role is be responsible for leading, shaping and ensuring successful delivery of our WorkSmart integrated workplace change programme shifting council to flexible ways of working for more than 6,000 staff located in multiple buildings across the Auckland region.§        § §        §In this role you will proactively develop, evolve and implement strategic and tactical change plans at a programme and project level, while having a good understanding of the objectives and work operating model of those departments and ensuring change is well managed. As such this is a great opportunity for a capable and experienced senior organisational change manager who is looking to take the next step in delivering a transformational workplace change programme of size, scale and complexity that is rarely available in New Zealand.§        § §        §Key responsibilities will include:§        § §        §          §Take ownership to manage and deliver large scale workplace change programme, including change planning, communications, training, reporting and managing resources, risk and stakeholder engagement across multiple simultaneous initiatives§          §Support the delivery of the change initiatives, working with the business, either through advice, by assessing resource requirements or delivering change directly.§          §Work with programme leads, project teams, stakeholders and their sponsors to plan and deliver effective change spanning the full programme and project lifecycle as required.§          §Ensure reduction of risks to benefits, business impact and to maximise engagement in the change.§          §Provide relevant coaching on change planning and delivery§          §Support the embedding of Auckland Council’s change approach and principles into the business§          §Participate in the change “community of practice” across council, to foster effective knowledge management, shared learning and to build change capability and maturity.§          §Deliver excellent customer service outcomes§        §        § §        § §        § He kōrero mōu: About you§        § §        §You will have a deep knowledge of business, transformation, organisation change preferably in a large and complex organisational setting, including process, systems and organisational change. You will have the ability to build relationships and confidently engage effectively to a wide variety of stakeholders. You will have a tertiary degree in Business, Change Management, Programme or Project Delivery, Organisational Psychology, Communications, or a combination of these. A minimum of 10 years in a complex business environment in change management, communication, HR or an operational role. Strong experience in both line and matrix management of change management teams.§        § §        §Ngā āhuatanga kei a mātou: What we offer§        § §        §This is a rare career opportunity for a confident strategic organisational change manager to come and make a difference within the wider council group on a scale that is rarely available in New Zealand. jobText: TXT/50914783.txt	§Senior Asset Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Asset Manager§§Advertiser: §Ministry of Education§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§10 Nov 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Real Estate & Property§, §Other§§§§§§Kia ora, Bula Vinaka, Fakaalofa lahi atu, Fakatalofa atu, Kia orana, Malo e lelei, Malo ni, Talofa lava, Tena koutou katoa, and welcome.§Permanent - full-time§An exciting opportunity to be a part of the Asset Management group and lead the teams responsible for driving asset management planning maturity, advice and support to schools in the Auckland region§§Help shape the future of education§At the Ministry of Education, we work together to shape an education system that delivers equitable and excellent outcomes.§Our organisation is made up of more than 3,000 talented and committed people around New Zealand, from a wide range of backgrounds and cultures.§While we work in different groups and on different things, we all strive every day to make the biggest difference we can for every child, young person and adult student in our education system.§About us§Education Infrastructure Service (EIS), a part of the Ministry of Education, manages the Crown's second largest property portfolio of around 2,100 schools with a book value of $18.3 billion, the largest payroll in the country, and transportation of over 100,000 students to and from school each day.§Our vision for school property is that all schools have quality learning environments as part of a well-managed and sustainable portfolio that helps deliver equitable and excellent outcomes for every child.§About the role§Earlier this year we announced Te Rautaki Rawa Kura - the School Property Strategy, which shares our vision and direction for school property management. To help implement the strategy we have created a number of new positions to ensure that we have the right foundation and alignment of functions to support implementation of Te Rautaki Rawa Kura.§You will report to the Regional Asset Manager and a key focus of this role is to support schools to effectively maintain their property by helping schools to make robust quality asset management planning and investment decisions through the leadership of expert asset management advice and support service.§You will work closely with Sector Enablement and Support teams to implement Auckland Education Growth Plan.§Please note that there is further information in the attached Job Description.§About you§You will demonstrate a strong mix of skills and experience within a large and complex delivery organisation that involved operational leadership, and strategic and financial/operational management accountability. Your relevant tertiary qualification or relevant experience in a comparable role is essential.§To be successful in this role you will need the following:§Familiarity working within civil infrastructure and complexities this provides§Proven ability and experience of leading a team to develop asset management maturity§Highly developed relationship management skills with a proven ability to consult and influence at all levels§Prior experience within infrastructure/property management.§Experience in effective risk management strategies and processes§Knowledge of the Government's direction, policy priorities, and budgeting processes and probity issues specific to the public sector§The ability to understand and apply the principles of Te Tiriti o Waitangi§Are you ready to make a difference?§We welcome candidates from diverse backgrounds, including Māori, Pacific and those with disabilities, who will enrich our understanding of the education system.§As a government agency, the Ministry is committed to the Treaty of Waitangi's guiding principles in our work for and with Māori students, their whānau, hapū and iwi.§Please review the Job Description attached and if this opportunity interests you and you meet the requirements, please apply now using the 'Apply Online' button. §For further information please contact Stephanie Phillips at §eis.recruitment@education.govt.nz§Click here to view the role description§§Applications close midnight - Tuesday, 24 November 2020.§§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§
