jobTitle: General Manager of Property Management Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50927050.txt	§General Manager of Property Management§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§General Manager of Property Management§§Advertiser: §Consult Recruitment Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§11 Nov 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Manukau & East Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Real Estate & Property§, §Residential Leasing & Property Management§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §General Manager of Property Management §      §This is a chance to join the Du Val Group’s Property Management arm IPM, a hugely successful high growth business with a family feel. The team you are managing have won “Top Property Investment Management Office” two years in a row. They are currently looking for an exceptional General Manager of Property Management to manage the portfolio of properties on their growing books. § § This is not a sales role, as NZ’s largest private suburban apartment developer and a leading house builder this is a business in high growth mode. They build high quality houses and apartments, providing a pipeline of properties. Your focus is on providing an exceptional customer experience through your property management team.§ § They are looking for someone who can come in and own the function, freeing up the owner’s time. This isn’t a rebuild job, you will be inheriting a high performing, qualified team of property managers who are passionate about their roles. This is about mentoring and pushing a strong team to new heights and driving best practice across systems/processes.§ § Du Val manage hundreds of properties and are growing quickly. Many of these are whole developments and a growing number of “built to rent” so tenants expect high quality service as they are long tenure.§ § In a large corporate and looking for less red tape? § Experienced in property management and looking to take on a team and learn from an award winning organisation?§ In a smaller organisation and feel your growth is capped?§ Maybe you have grown tired of winning new clients and want to focus purely on providing the best tenant experience in NZ. § § Personality will be the real key to this role and it will require a high performer who is humble enough to muck in when required. § § Longer term you can grow with the company and they have a strong track record of moving people internally and low turnover.§ § §Responsibilities:§ § You will be managing a team of 4/5 and will be driving a culture of best practice and supporting the senior management team. You will also be expected to manage the divisions profitability, bring ideas and process improvements to continue driving best practice. Systems and marketing are two areas open to early review.§ § You will not be expected to bring in new properties - this is taken care of by Du Val’s new developments, leaving you free to manage the portfolio.§ § You and your team will have responsibility for end to end property management including:§        §          §Rental appraisals and advice (including reviews/renewals)§          §Marketing, Advertising and Viewings §          §Completion Inspection and Defects Remediation §          §Body Corporate Advocacy & Proxy Services§          §Tenant agreements, applications and checks§          §Facilities & Building Management§          §Repairs, Maintenance & long term planning (24/7 online owner portal)§          §Insurance claims§          §Tribunal applications, mediations and hearings§        § §You will be:§        §          §Experienced in property management§          §Have demonstrable experience of exceeding targets§          §Be a strong leader, coach and manager§          §Able to work strategically but able to muck in when required §          §New Zealand Certificate in Property Management strongly preferred §        § §What’s on offer: §        §          §A chance to join a very high growth, award winning firm§          §Senior Leadership opportunity to genuinely make a difference in a tight knit, entrepreneurial business§          §A great team to manage, coach and lead §          §Rare chance to buy into properties yourself at discounted rates §          §A permanent role based in South Auckland §          §Salary dependant on experience - reach out for a discussion§        §      §      §Sam Patterson §    §    §  §§§This is a chance to join the Du Val Group’s Property Management arm IPM, a hugely successful high growth business with a family feel. The team you are managing have won “Top Property Investment Management Office” two years in a row. They are currently looking for an exceptional General Manager of Property Management to manage the portfolio of properties on their growing books. § § This is not a sales role, as NZ’s largest private suburban apartment developer and a leading house builder this is a business in high growth mode. They build high quality houses and apartments, providing a pipeline of properties. Your focus is on providing an exceptional customer experience through your property management team.§ § They are looking for someone who can come in and own the function, freeing up the owner’s time. This isn’t a rebuild job, you will be inheriting a high performing, qualified team of property managers who are passionate about their roles. This is about mentoring and pushing a strong team to new heights and driving best practice across systems/processes.§ § Du Val manage hundreds of properties and are growing quickly. Many of these are whole developments and a growing number of “built to rent” so tenants expect high quality service as they are long tenure.§ § In a large corporate and looking for less red tape? § Experienced in property management and looking to take on a team and learn from an award winning organisation?§ In a smaller organisation and feel your growth is capped?§ Maybe you have grown tired of winning new clients and want to focus purely on providing the best tenant experience in NZ. § § Personality will be the real key to this role and it will require a high performer who is humble enough to muck in when required. § § Longer term you can grow with the company and they have a strong track record of moving people internally and low turnover.§ § §Responsibilities:§ § You will be managing a team of 4/5 and will be driving a culture of best practice and supporting the senior management team. You will also be expected to manage the divisions profitability, bring ideas and process improvements to continue driving best practice. Systems and marketing are two areas open to early review.§ § You will not be expected to bring in new properties - this is taken care of by Du Val’s new developments, leaving you free to manage the portfolio.§ § You and your team will have responsibility for end to end property management including:§ § §Rental appraisals and advice (including reviews/renewals)§ §Marketing, Advertising and Viewings § §Completion Inspection and Defects Remediation § §Body Corporate Advocacy & Proxy Services§ §Tenant agreements, applications and checks§ §Facilities & Building Management§ §Repairs, Maintenance & long term planning (24/7 online owner portal)§ §Insurance claims§ §Tribunal applications, mediations and hearings§ § §You will be:§ § §Experienced in property management§ §Have demonstrable experience of exceeding targets§ §Be a strong leader, coach and manager§ §Able to work strategically but able to muck in when required § §New Zealand Certificate in Property Management strongly preferred § § §What’s on offer: § § §A chance to join a very high growth, award winning firm§ §Senior Leadership opportunity to genuinely make a difference in a tight knit, entrepreneurial business§ §A great team to manage, coach and lead § §Rare chance to buy into properties yourself at discounted rates § §A permanent role based in South Auckland § §Salary dependant on experience - reach out for a discussion§ §§§§

jobText: TXT/50913480.txt	§Regional Infrastructure Manager - Whangarei§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Regional Infrastructure Manager - Whangarei§§Advertiser: §Ministry of Education§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§9 Nov 2020§§Location§§Northland§, §Whangarei§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Real Estate & Property§, §Other§§§§§§Regional Infrastructure Manager Tai Tokerau§Kia ora, Bula Vinaka, Fakaalofa lahi atu, Fakatalofa atu, Kia orana, Malo e lelei, Malo ni, Talofa lava, Tena koutou katoa, and welcome.§Permanent - full-time§An exciting opportunity to be a part of the Asset Management group and lead a team responsible for driving asset management planning maturity, advice and support to schools in the Tai Tokerau region.§§Help shape the future of education§At the Ministry of Education, we work together to shape an education system that delivers equitable and excellent outcomes.§Our organisation is made up of more than 3,000 talented and committed people around New Zealand, from a wide range of backgrounds and cultures.§While we work in different groups and on different things, we all strive every day to make the biggest difference we can for every child, young person and adult student in our education system.§About us§Education Infrastructure Service (EIS), a part of the Ministry of Education, manages the Crown's second largest property portfolio of around 2,100 schools with a book value of $18.3 billion, the largest payroll in the country, and transportation of over 100,000 students to and from school each day.§Our vision for school property is that all schools have quality learning environments as part of a well-managed and sustainable portfolio that helps deliver equitable and excellent outcomes for every child.§About the role§Earlier this year we announced Te Rautaki Rawa Kura - the School Property Strategy, which shares our vision and direction for school property management. To help implement the strategy we have created a number of new positions to ensure that we have the right foundation and alignment of functions to support implementation of Te Rautaki Rawa Kura§You will report to the General Manager Asset Management and lead a team responsible for driving asset management planning maturity, advice and support to schools in the Tai Tokerau region.§A key focus for this position will be to support schools to effectively maintain their property by helping schools make robust quality asset management planning and investment decisions through the leadership of expert asset management advice and support service. Furthermore, you will be establishing the property delivery priorities for the Tai Tokerau region.§Please note that there is further information in the attached Job Description.§About you§You will demonstrate a strong mix of skills and extensive experience within a large and complex delivery organisation that involved infrastructure/property management. Your relevant tertiary qualification or experience in a comparable role is essential.§To be successful in this role you will need the following:§Track record of success and results in a management role in a large and complex delivery organization§Highly developed strategic critical thinking skills and analytical capability§Highly developed relationship management skills with a proven ability to consult and influence at all levels across functions§Proven ability to deliver results / improvements to key systems in complex organisational settings§Strong knowledge of the Government's direction, policy priorities, and budgeting processes and probity issues specific to the public sector§The ability to understand and apply the principles of Te Tiriti o Waitangi§Are you ready to make a difference?§We welcome candidates from diverse backgrounds, including Māori, Pacific and those with disabilities, who will enrich our understanding of the education system.§As a government agency, the Ministry is committed to the Treaty of Waitangi's guiding principles in our work for and with Māori students, their whānau, hapū and iwi.§Please review the Job Description attached and if this opportunity interests you and you meet the requirements, please apply now using the 'Apply Online' button.§For further information please contact Stephanie Phillips at §eis.recruitment@education.govt.nz§Click here to view the role description§§Applications close midnight - Tuesday, 24 November 2020.§§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50908189.txt	§Building Manager§§Private Advertiser§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Building Manager§§Private Advertiser§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§9 Nov 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Manukau & East Auckland§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Real Estate & Property§, §Residential Leasing & Property Management§§§§§§Building Manager Role Botany Downs Location§  §Live-in position available from February 2020 for either a motivated couple or a well organised single person to manage a 59 unit low rise complex in Botany Downs. §  §The role involves multiple responsibilities including maintaining lawns, grounds, gardens and all aspects of building/plant management. In addition it would be a distinct advantage if at least one of the applicants is an enthusiastic gardener happy to be based outdoors and with an above average level of physical fitness. Excellent communication and people skills are vital as you will need to interact with a range of parties including resident owners, Body Corporate committee members, tenants and contractors. There is a rental pool of approximately 32 one and two bedroom apartments that the successful applicant(s) will be required to manage. §  §Contract employment basis includes subsidised occupancy of an attractive apartment including a separate office area. Remuneration will be commensurate with the size of complex, work level and the applicants experience.§  §Applications from experienced building managers will be preferred. Experience in duties 1 and 2 listed below are pre-requisites for the role.§  §Duties/roles include:§ § §Attend to and maintain all garden/grass/common areas with genuine passion for outdoor work§ §Undertake property management services for a rental pool of approximately 32 units including advertise tenant vacancies, tenant vetting and selection and completion of RTA’s§ §Building and contractor supervision § §Pool maintenance§ §Facilitate all emergency services to the complex§ §Maintain a register of occupiers§ § Regular verbal and written communication with owners, tenants, tradespeople and representatives of the Body Corporate§ §Follow up and collection of any rent arrears and attendance at Tenancy Tribunal when necessary§ §Supervise all tenant movements (in and out) and bond refunds§ § Regular inspection of tenancies and reporting to owners§ §Please email your CV with a cover letter explaining your reasons for applying for this role. Applications close Friday 27th November 2020.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years of residential property management experience do you have?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

jobText: TXT/50911506.txt	§Facilities Manager | Ormiston Town Centre§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Facilities Manager | Ormiston Town Centre§§Advertiser: §Colliers International§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§9 Nov 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Rodney & North Shore§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Real Estate & Property§, §Body Corporate & Facilities Management§§§§§§ § §Company Description§ §Colliers International is New Zealand’s leading commercial and retail real estate management company specialising in Shopping Centre management for local and international based clients.§ §With a focus on innovation and offering a unique lifestyle shopping experience, §Ormiston Town Centre §sets a precedent that will revolutionise the future of town centre development.§ § § §Job Description§ §We have an exciting opportunity for an experienced Facilities Manager to join the onsite team at Ormiston Town Centre. We are looking for a motivated professional to effectively manage the daily operations of the Centre and ensure the premises are maintained at a high standard of presentation.§ §Responsibilities§ § §Ensure the ongoing maintenance of the Centre is delivered in accordance with best practice§ §Ensure compliance requirements are adhered to§ §Manage building performance in a cost-effective manner in accordance with best practice and Centre owners’ wishes§ §Develop and maintain strong working relationships with tenants, contractors, and other stakeholders§ §Prepare and contribute to reporting and budgeting§ §Identify and execute on genuine asset value-add ideas and concepts§ §Assist and support the Centre Management team with operational functions§ § § §Qualifications§ § §5+ years’ experience in a similar position§ §Strong written and verbal communication skills§ §Strong client-focus and relationship building skills§ §Strong stakeholder management skills§ §Self-motivated and deadline-focussed§ §Diligent and conscientious§ §Strong time management skills§ § § §Additional Information§ §Our enterprising culture empowers our people to do their best work, collaborating with our global experts to maximise every opportunity and lead the industry. For you, this means a world of opportunity and the platform to learn, grow and succeed.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50922579.txt	§Think Different?§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Think Different?§§Advertiser: §Property Brokers§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§10 Nov 2020§§Location§§Manawatu§, §Rest of Manawatu§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Real Estate & Property§, §Residential Sales§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Think Different? §      §        §Are you the type of person who has a different way of looking at things? Do you see opportunity when others see problems? Have you got the ability and ambition to succeed but just need the opportunity?§        §We are recruiting now for a lifestyle salesperson in our Feilding office, so if you believe you have the personality, we have the training, the support and the environment that can turn ambition into success.§        §As a lifestyle salesperson, you'll have a good understanding of properties between 1 and 40 hectares. You'll have an affinity for the country, property, and people.  Here's a great opportunity if you think you tick the boxes and the idea of this excites you!§        §We want to talk to you!§        §At Property Brokers we think a bit differently. Always have. We are positive and enthusiastic and spend too much time succeeding to worry about the problems others seem to focus on. Our people come from a variety of backgrounds. Some have degrees, some don't. Some have experience, some don't. We have got butchers and bakers and candlestick makers, (we haven't actually got a candlestick maker) but the one common trait we can find in all our people is an above average desire to succeed. An ambition to be better than average; to make a better income, provide a better service, to have a better quality of life that drives them to be part of one of the most exciting and dynamic organisations in New Zealand.§        §Email your CV today to §simon@pb.co.nz§ or call Simon on 027 430 1783 for a confidential chat.§        §Things to Note§        §          §An REA salesperson's licence is preferred, but we will assist with training for the right candidate. §          §This is a "commission only" position.§        §      §      §      §    §    §Property Brokers Ltd Licensed REAA 2008 | §pb.co.nz§  §§§Are you the type of person who has a different way of looking at things? While this position will be very demanding, success will bring its rewards!§  § It takes a special someone to thrive in this role. Someone with exceptional industry knowledge and a true passion for helping others succeed in the industry. If you fit the bill, what are you waiting for?§  § On offer is an attractive salary. jobText: TXT/50943617.txt	§Compliance Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Compliance Manager§§Advertiser: §REAP Recruitment§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§13 Nov 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Salary§§City Sales§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Real Estate & Property§, §Residential Sales§§§§§§§§§  §    §      §Compliance Manager §    §    §      §City Sales has been the leader in the Auckland apartment market for over 20 years and have experienced fantastic growth and activity within the apartment market.  §They are currently looking for a §Real Estate Compliance Manager§ to assist their Salespeople with all REA and AML compliance matters.  More specifically, as the Real Estate Compliance Manager you will be responsible for §        §          §Reviewing and oversight of Agency Agreements and other legal documents §          §Daily oversight of company procedures §          §Managing complaints and disputes §          §Staff training on new legislation§          §Providing advice and guidance to Salespeople §        § In order to be considered for the role you must have experience in above and hold a Real Estate Agents Licence.  It is envisaged that you would also become the Company Licensee for City Sales. It is expected that this role would require a commitment of approx. 20 hours per week of which you'll be paid a competitive rate of remuneration.  §In addition to the Compliance Manager duties, City Sales would also allow you to continue selling (if this is what you want to do) where they will pay you maximum commission and provide additional support where and if needed.  §If this is something of interest to you then please do get in touch today in order to be considered.  §  § §This role is being managed by REAP Recruitment. Please apply on-line below to be considered for this role.  All applications will remain confidential to REAP Recruitment & City Sales and will only be forwarded on with your consent§      §      §Matt Hunter§021 32 1115 §    §    §  §§§City Sales has been the leader in the Auckland apartment market for over 20 years and have experienced fantastic growth and activity within the apartment market.  §They are currently looking for a §Real Estate Compliance Manager§ to assist their Salespeople with all REA and AML compliance matters.  More specifically, as the Real Estate Compliance Manager you will be responsible for § § §Reviewing and oversight of Agency Agreements and other legal documents § §Daily oversight of company procedures § §Managing complaints and disputes § §Staff training on new legislation§ §Providing advice and guidance to Salespeople § § In order to be considered for the role you must have experience in above and hold a Real Estate Agents Licence.  It is envisaged that you would also become the Company Licensee for City Sales. It is expected that this role would require a commitment of approx. 20 hours per week of which you'll be paid a competitive rate of remuneration.  §In addition to the Compliance Manager duties, City Sales would also allow you to continue selling (if this is what you want to do) where they will pay you maximum commission and provide additional support where and if needed.  §If this is something of interest to you then please do get in touch today in order to be considered.  §  § §This role is being managed by REAP Recruitment. Please apply on-line below to be considered for this role.  All applications will remain confidential to REAP Recruitment & City Sales and will only be forwarded on with your consent§§§§

jobTitle: Real Estate Sales Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50950757.txt	§Real Estate Sales§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Real Estate Sales§§Advertiser: §REAP Recruitment§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§14 Nov 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Manukau & East Auckland§§Salary§§RE/MAX Partners§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Real Estate & Property§, §Residential Sales§§§§§§§§§  §    §      §Real Estate Sales §    §    §      §RE/Max Partners are currently looking for new and existing Real Estate Salespeople for their South Auckland based Real Estate Company.  §First launched in 2016, RE/MAX Partners, Flat Bush has quickly grown into a high performing real estate office in the Auckland region. Consistently recognised as one of the top RE/MAX real estate enterprises in New Zealand, the award-winning office is highly experienced in suburban Auckland and beyond. Flat Bush real estate professionals combine their local knowledge and experience with the global reach of RE/MAX branding to produce highly successful results for clients in Flat Bush and beyond.§Fast becoming the “go to” Real Estate Company in Auckland, Vendors are increasingly using the services of RE/MAX Partners when they’re looking for RESULTS.  With your great personal promotion and their compelling competitive edge, it’s a great recipe for success§Working for a large Real Estate Company with a Worldwide reach, you will be given all the “tools of the trade”, training and support required to be successful.  With distinctive branding, tested systems and powerful resources creating an edge, you will also benefit from the massive networking advantages of truly global brand.§ In addition to above, you will benefit from existing relationships with established and recognised property developers within Auckland.  With these strong relationships in mind, we are also interested in talking to Salespeople with experience in Project Marketing to service a number of projects coming to the market in the very near future.§ § On offer is generous commissions with no restrictions or boundaries as to where you can list or sell.  If you are experienced or looking to take the first steps towards a career in Real Estate, then we are interested in talking to you.  If you do not have your current Salesperson Licence (or completed the required training) please make contact and we will advise you of the steps required to gain it.§  § §This role is being managed by REAP Recruitment on behalf of RE/MAX Partners.  Please apply on-line below to be considered for this role.  All applications will remain confidential to REAP Recruitment and RE/MAX Partners and will only be forwarded on with your consent.  More information is available on request.§      §      §Matt Hunter§Please Apply On-Line §    §    §  §§§RE/Max Partners are currently looking for new and existing Real Estate Salespeople for their South Auckland based Real Estate Company.  §First launched in 2016, RE/MAX Partners, Flat Bush has quickly grown into a high performing real estate office in the Auckland region. Consistently recognised as one of the top RE/MAX real estate enterprises in New Zealand, the award-winning office is highly experienced in suburban Auckland and beyond. Flat Bush real estate professionals combine their local knowledge and experience with the global reach of RE/MAX branding to produce highly successful results for clients in Flat Bush and beyond.§Fast becoming the “go to” Real Estate Company in Auckland, Vendors are increasingly using the services of RE/MAX Partners when they’re looking for RESULTS.  With your great personal promotion and their compelling competitive edge, it’s a great recipe for success§Working for a large Real Estate Company with a Worldwide reach, you will be given all the “tools of the trade”, training and support required to be successful.  With distinctive branding, tested systems and powerful resources creating an edge, you will also benefit from the massive networking advantages of truly global brand.§ In addition to above, you will benefit from existing relationships with established and recognised property developers within Auckland.  With these strong relationships in mind, we are also interested in talking to Salespeople with experience in Project Marketing to service a number of projects coming to the market in the very near future.§ § On offer is generous commissions with no restrictions or boundaries as to where you can list or sell.  If you are experienced or looking to take the first steps towards a career in Real Estate, then we are interested in talking to you.  If you do not have your current Salesperson Licence (or completed the required training) please make contact and we will advise you of the steps required to gain it.§  § §This role is being managed by REAP Recruitment on behalf of RE/MAX Partners.  Please apply on-line below to be considered for this role.  All applications will remain confidential to REAP Recruitment and RE/MAX Partners and will only be forwarded on with your consent.  More information is available on request.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50907680.txt	§Senior Facilities Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Facilities Manager§§Advertiser: §Franklin Smith Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§9 Nov 2020§§Location§§Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Real Estate & Property§, §Body Corporate & Facilities Management§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Senior Facilities Manager §      §        § As the largest providers of premium inner-city commercial spaces' in New Zealand, this property giant has a clientele that includes some of most successful businesses in the country. As a top 20 company on the NZX, our client is looking to add to their dynamic team.§ § § You'll be slotting into a well-established team who are looking to settle into business as usual after a huge 2020. Your ability to look objectively at the operation and provide a fresh set of eyes will be critical to the success of the role.§ § §Key tasks:§ §        §          §Responsible for a number of premiere office sites within the CBD including maintenance, day to day operations, cost efficiencies§          §Manage and oversee any projects, fitouts and refurbishments within your dedicated sites§          §Ensure effective and efficient management of business relationships with clients, contractors, and other members of the management team§          §Preparation, reporting and maintaining monthly financials, annual operating budgets, budget developments that align with the overall business plans§          §Manage all service contracts for your sites§          §Supporting the National Operations Manager through strategic contribution, portfolio initiatives, management of concierge services team, customer complaints§        §        § §Ideal candidate:§ §        §          §You will have a minimum of 5 years' work experience in an FM or operations role§          §Professionally presented to maintain a strong working relationship with the wide range of clients that operate within your portfolio§          §Proven track record of maintaining and preparing budgets and strong financial acumen§          §Demonstrated knowledge in implementing operational processes and frameworks§          §Experience in project management is preferred§          §A solution focused person with an understanding of handling hard and soft service teams§          §Strong technical knowledge of hard and soft services§          §Experience in fitout coordination and construction logistics an advantage§          §Experience in Project Management is desirable§        §        § This is a challenging but rewarding role where you will be part of an organisation that prides itself on bringing on board individuals who are passionate about what they do, share a similar vision and work hard to deliver.§ § § §For a confidential discussion regarding the role or to register your interest contact Jason Goodson §09 281 2862§ or email your CV to §jason@franklinsmithgroup.co.nz§ §      §    §    §www.franklinsmithgroup.co.nz§  §§§ As the largest providers of premium inner-city commercial spaces' in New Zealand, this property giant has a clientele that includes some of most successful businesses in the country. As a top 20 company on the NZX, our client is looking to add to their dynamic team.§ § § You'll be slotting into a well-established team who are looking to settle into business as usual after a huge 2020. Your ability to look objectively at the operation and provide a fresh set of eyes will be critical to the success of the role.§ § §Key tasks:§ §Responsible for a number of premiere office sites within the CBD including maintenance, day to day operations, cost efficiencies§Manage and oversee any projects, fitouts and refurbishments within your dedicated sites§Ensure effective and efficient management of business relationships with clients, contractors, and other members of the management team§Preparation, reporting and maintaining monthly financials, annual operating budgets, budget developments that align with the overall business plans§Manage all service contracts for your sites§Supporting the National Operations Manager through strategic contribution, portfolio initiatives, management of concierge services team, customer complaints§ §Ideal candidate:§ §You will have a minimum of 5 years' work experience in an FM or operations role§Professionally presented to maintain a strong working relationship with the wide range of clients that operate within your portfolio§Proven track record of maintaining and preparing budgets and strong financial acumen§Demonstrated knowledge in implementing operational processes and frameworks§Experience in project management is preferred§A solution focused person with an understanding of handling hard and soft service teams§Strong technical knowledge of hard and soft services§Experience in fitout coordination and construction logistics an advantage§Experience in Project Management is desirable§ This is a challenging but rewarding role where you will be part of an organisation that prides itself on bringing on board individuals who are passionate about what they do, share a similar vision and work hard to deliver.§ § § §For a confidential discussion regarding the role or to register your interest contact Jason Goodson §09 281 2862§ or email your CV to §jason@franklinsmithgroup.co.nz§ §§§§

has been able to become as successful as it is today can be attributed to the constant recruitment of a balanced cross-section of experienced personnel as well as individuals starting out in the industry. Their goal over the coming years is to keep expanding with the right people to consolidate their position in the marketplace as one of the leading offices within the area. §With Ray White Hamilton you’ll get§ § §Excellent training and individual mentoring from leading Real Estate professionals§ §A great team environment§ §Ongoing support and resources from a major NZ Real Estate Company§ §An opportunity to take your career to new heights and maximise your earnings§ §High earning potential§ §Training and support to grow your career§ § If you are an existing Salesperson, then please give me a call for more information on this exciting opportunity.  Additionally, if you are new to Real Estate, serious about making it your long-term career and you’ve got the following characteristics, then please don’t hesitate to call, we really want to chat to you.  Ideally you will be§ § §Well-mannered and likable§ §Tidy in appearance§ §Computer literate§ §Able to communicate via phone and email in a professional and literate manner§ §Prepared to commit full time as a Real Estate Salesperson§ §Experienced in sales (or at least in dealing with the public)§ § We don’t mind if you’re REA licensed and experienced or looking to start your career in real estate – we want to hear from you if you have a good work ethic, a passion for success and the ability to learn new skills!§  § §Don’t miss this chance!§   Please apply on-line today or call Matt Hunter on (021) 32 1115 today for a no obligation chat about this opportunity.§  § §REAP Recruitment specialise in recruitment for the Real Estate and Property (REAP) industries.  Whether you're an existing Real Estate Salesperson wanting to see if the "grass is greener" or thinking about entering (or returning to) the Real Estate industry, make REAP Recruitment your first call.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50916711.txt	§Senior Valuer, Asset Advisory (Auckland)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Valuer, Asset Advisory (Auckland)§§Advertiser: §Beca§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§10 Nov 2020§§Location§§Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Real Estate & Property§, §Valuation§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Senior Valuer, Asset Advisory (Auckland) §      §        §§        §Senior Valuer, Asset Advisory (Auckland)§ §        §          §Providing valuations consultancy services, utilising your strong valuation knowledge, contributing to the growth of the wider asset advisory services with our clients§          §Work in a leading, award winning and Australasian property and valuation practice across highly complex projects§          §Learn from leaders in the Valuation and Advisory field, with the scope to contribute to the development of innovative future service offerings, with career development opportunities§        §        §The Opportunity | Te Kāinga Rua§        §Support both the delivery of valuation services across complex multi-site, commercial asset portfolios throughout New Zealand, Australia and the Pacific, as well as the development and evolution of Asset Advisory service offerings across the life cycle of an asset, in this unique role.§        §Beca's valuation and asset advisory team are one of our best kept secrets, with the team winning the RICS Valuation Team of the Year in New Zealand, in 2020. You will be joining a collaborative and specialist valuation team, working with clients to deliver highly complex and challenging valuation projects. Based in Auckland, this role provides you the opportunity to value some of Australasia's largest and most divergent property portfolios. The valuations team is part of Beca's Advisory Business meaning that you can expect to grow your career in property valuation working closely with asset management, business improvement and decision support. You will be providing clients valuation services as well as consulting with them to support strategic asset management decisions.§        §This is a busy, challenging, dynamic and rewarding role where you will play a significant part in helping the valuation practice to deliver their strategy, continuing and growing the reputation of the practice in helping our clients through excellence in delivery of highly complex, innovative and award-winning valuation requirements. You will have the opportunity to work with clients helping both their growth, as well as playing a part in the growth strategy for this practice.§        §You will be a working with leading experts in the valuations of land, buildings, plant and infrastructure from single properties to large portfolios including public utilities and industrial plants, located throughout New Zealand. As a registered, or newly registered valuer, you will also be supporting, mentoring and guiding your colleagues as they build their careers across the valuation discipline. Career development and progression opportunities are available in this role, across the New Zealand and the broader Beca business. §        §About You | Te rongoā§        §In this role, you will have plenty of scope for success and we are looking for a high performing professional with a real passion for the property industry. While based in Auckland, this role will give you scope to work in a national Valuations team.§        §You will enjoy busy, challenging roles, have a bias for action and be comfortable with making commercial judgements. You will also have a passion for property with either a deep understanding across asset management and valuation processes, or a passion for this function particularly into the commercial and industrial sectors.§        §About you:§        §          §You will be experienced in undertaking valuations of a range of property portfolios including industrial sites, Government property portfolios and commercial properties§          §You will enjoy working as part of a dynamic team and understanding a range of property types and markets§          §You have excellent interpersonal skills in order to deal with a range of clients and develop new opportunities through marketing and business development§          §You have high attention to detail and exceptional communication skills§          §You will be a confident professional with a sense of accountability for results and a passion for working in a thriving, professional and innovative company within a corporate environment§        §        §Apply now§        §To apply for this role, please follow the online application process below. §        §About Us | Ko wai mātou§ §        §Beca is one of Asia Pacific's largest independent advisory, design and engineering consultancies. 2020 is a landmark year for Beca, representing both the dawn of a new decade and the beginning of our 2nd century. Throughout this year, we will celebrate our innovators, our thinkers, our explorers and our entrepreneurs; past, present and future.§        §We are a team of 3,300-plus who brings a wide range of perspectives and expertise to every client and challenge, creating resourceful, smart solutions from our collective experience and insights. §        §While our experience has been 100 years in the making, it's the fresh talent we're nurturing, the innovative thinking we're developing and the connections that we're forging that gets us most excited for the future. Refer to www.beca.com.§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§§Senior Valuer, Asset Advisory (Auckland)§ §Providing valuations consultancy services, utilising your strong valuation knowledge, contributing to the growth of the wider asset advisory services with our clients§Work in a leading, award winning and Australasian property and valuation practice across highly complex projects§Learn from leaders in the Valuation and Advisory field, with the scope to contribute to the development of innovative future service offerings, with career development opportunities§The Opportunity | Te Kāinga Rua§Support both the delivery of valuation services across complex multi-site, commercial asset portfolios throughout New Zealand, Australia and the Pacific, as well as the development and evolution of Asset Advisory service offerings across the life cycle of an asset, in this unique role.§Beca's valuation and asset advisory team are one of our best kept secrets, with the team winning the RICS Valuation Team of the Year in New Zealand, in 2020. You will be joining a collaborative and specialist valuation team, working with clients to deliver highly complex and challenging valuation projects. Based in Auckland, this role provides you the opportunity to value some of Australasia's largest and most divergent property portfolios. The valuations team is part of Beca's Advisory Business meaning that you can expect to grow your career in property valuation working closely with asset management, business improvement and decision support. You will be providing clients valuation services as well as consulting with them to support strategic asset management decisions.§This is a busy, challenging, dynamic and rewarding role where you will play a significant part in helping the valuation practice to deliver their strategy, continuing and growing the reputation of the practice in helping our clients through excellence in delivery of highly complex, innovative and award-winning valuation requirements. You will have the opportunity to work with clients helping both their growth, as well as playing a part in the growth strategy for this practice.§You will be a working with leading experts in the valuations of land, buildings, plant and infrastructure from single properties to large portfolios including public utilities and industrial plants, located throughout New Zealand. As a registered, or newly registered valuer, you will also be supporting, mentoring and guiding your colleagues as they build their careers across the valuation discipline. Career development and progression opportunities are available in this role, across the New Zealand and the broader Beca business. §About You | Te rongoā§In this role, you will have plenty of scope for success and we are looking for a high performing professional with a real passion for the property industry. While based in Auckland, this role will give you scope to work in a national Valuations team.§You will enjoy busy, challenging roles, have a bias for action and be comfortable with making commercial judgements. You will also have a passion for property with either a deep understanding across asset management and valuation processes, or a passion for this function particularly into the commercial and industrial sectors.§About you:§You will be experienced in undertaking valuations of a range of property portfolios including industrial sites, Government property portfolios and commercial properties§You will enjoy working as part of a dynamic team and understanding a range of property types and markets§You have excellent interpersonal skills in order to deal with a range of clients and develop new opportunities through marketing and business development§You have high attention to detail and exceptional communication skills§You will be a confident professional with a sense of accountability for results and a passion for working in a thriving, professional and innovative company within a corporate environment§Apply now§To apply for this role, please follow the online application process below. §About Us | Ko wai mātou§ §Beca is one of Asia Pacific's largest independent advisory, design and engineering consultancies. 2020 is a landmark year for Beca, representing both the dawn of a new decade and the beginning of our 2nd century. Throughout this year, we will celebrate our innovators, our thinkers, our explorers and our entrepreneurs; past, present and future.§We are a team of 3,300-plus who brings a wide range of perspectives and expertise to every client and challenge, creating resourceful, smart solutions from our collective experience and insights. §While our experience has been 100 years in the making, it's the fresh talent we're nurturing, the innovative thinking we're developing and the connections that we're forging that gets us most excited for the future. With a broad scope of projects ranging from large to small, taking on new builds and existing property, their multi-disciplinary team has the experience and expertise to deliver a high-quality solution - and the track record to prove it.§ § §Your new role§ In your new role, you will be operating as a vital part in an existing and established team of property valuers, providing valuation of residential, commercial, industrial and rural properties, including for rental and insurance purposes. You will be conducting property market research and analysis, including utilisation and maintenance of property related databases and participating in marketing and sales activities with a view to attracting new business and enhancing existing relationships.§ § §What you'll need to succeed§ To succeed in this role, you will have relevant and recent industry experience, as well as personal motivation, positive attitude and a desire to learn and add to your skill set. You will be made to feel welcome and a valuable member of the team in an organisation that values staff retention and satisfaction in the workplace.§ § §What you need to do now§ If you're interested, click 'apply now' or if this position is not for you but you would like to find out more about other positions in the Property & Facilities Management sector, please contact Eli DaCruz on §09 309 2883§ or e-mail CV to §eli.dacruz@hays.net.nz§ § At Hays, we value diversity and are passionate about placing people in a role where they can flourish and succeed. You will be conducting property market research and analysis, including utilisation and maintenance of property related databases and participating in marketing and sales activities with a view to attracting new business and enhancing existing relationships.§ § §What you'll need to succeed§ To succeed in this role, you will have relevant and recent industry experience, as well as personal motivation, positive attitude and a desire to learn and add to your skill set. You will be process driven and be able to prioritise work by importance and deadline, considering everything that needs to be completed, deadlines to be met, and steps required, consistently setting high standards.§ § You will also need to have:§ §A degree in Valuations and Property Management or relevant discipline§Registered Status in NZ§Membership of relevant industry bodies§3+ years in carrying out valuations§ §What you'll get in return§ In return, you will be working for a locally owned and operated business, with a family friendly work environment and flexible work hours on offer. jobText: TXT/50975584.txt	§Property Facilities Contracts Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Property Facilities Contracts Manager§§Advertiser: §Robert Walters§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§18 Nov 2020§§Location§§Wellington§§Salary§§Competitive§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Real Estate & Property§, §Body Corporate & Facilities Management§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §Property Facilities Contracts Manager §    §      §        §New Zealand Police is the lead agency responsible for reducing crime and enhancing community safety. jobText: TXT/50955650.txt	§Property Project Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Property Project Manager§§Advertiser: §DOWNER NZ§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§16 Nov 2020§§Location§§Auckland§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Real Estate & Property§, §Commercial Sales, Leasing & Property Mgmt§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Property Project Manager §      §        §Downer New Zealand has a proud history that can be traced back to 1870, and today we are NZ’s leading provider of integrated services.  Our commitment is building long term relationships and supporting our customers with high calibre services and solutions.  The key to our success is our people who, on a day-to-day basis, they stand and deliver the company's core values of Excellence, Courage, Collaboration & Integrity across a diverse landscape of markets. We are proud of what we do, and that we support the well-being of the communities we work, live and play in.§        §Downer is a significant player in the telecommunications industry within New Zealand.  We are growing our business through delivering consistent service, excellence and results and through developing inspirational leadership with our people and customers.  We have an exciting opportunity for a Property Project Manager to join our team. §        §This is a key role delivering a programme of work for our Client involving project and maintenance work across a unique and diverse property portfolio. The work includes scoping and delivering a range of property related projects and as such, we are looking for an experienced Project Manager from a Building, Facilities or Asset Management background that can implement value adding solutions and deliver end to end from scoping through delivery and closeout.§        §To be successful in the role the right candidate need solid project management skills, an ability to influence subcontractors to meeting Downer high expectations in Health and Safety and Quality.  The role requires regional travel to lead from the front line and strong stakeholder relationships skills to work in a collaborative environment.   Naturally, you will have experience in delivery to contractual obligations and high levels of business acumen.§        §This is a 12 month fixed term contract and for the right candidate, we could potentially offer the flexibility of working part-time (3 days a week). §        §This is a busy position and requires a structured approach in order to build constructive relationships and prioritise workload. There will also be a high degree of autonomy and liaising with our clients and suppliers both internal and external to produce required outcomes while ensuring customer satisfaction to the highest level.§        §          §Experience in Building Construction / Facilities Management or Building Services (electrical, HVAC, mechanical) engineering is an advantage§          §Demonstrated experience in operational leadership of a multi trade service delivery team§          §Experience driving operational activities to ensure quality is achieved, work completed to schedule and rework is minimised§          §Excellent written and oral communication skills and an ability to influence§          §Ability to analyse problems and make sound decisions in a timely manner based on objectives, risks, implications and cost§          §A strong track record that clearly demonstrates leadership behaviours that empower others§          §Have excellent verbal and written communication skills with a high literacy and numerical standard§          §Be computer literate with intermediate level Microsoft Office skills§          §Hold a Full NZ Driver’s Licence and undertake travel across NZ as required§          §Ability to work on the front line managing Subcontractors with a strong focus on Health and Safety.§          §Someone who works well in a team and can engage with Customer to represent Downer values.§        §        §A role with us can enable you to develop and enhance your skills and experience.  This is a great opportunity for you to join our diverse and inclusive culture and be part of a great team thriving in a collaborative fast-paced environment.  We will reward you with a competitive remuneration package, flexible working arrangements, great training and ongoing development, and the opportunity to advance your career within our organisation. §        §If this sounds like the opportunity for you, head to www.downercareers.co.nz and enter reference number 574683 to apply.     §        §Downer NZ is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a diverse and inclusive culture.§        §Our workplaces are drug and alcohol free - all successful applicants will be required to undertake a Pre-Employment drug test and medical. §        §Due to the fast-paced nature of Downer, our vacancy close dates may be subject to change, so don't delay and make sure you apply as soon as possible. §        §Please note we have an in-house recruitment team that manage all our vacancies. No candidates presented through an agency will be considered for any of our roles advertised, unless previously arranged. We would strongly encourage all candidates interested in these roles, to apply directly online through the portal provided otherwise your application will not be considered.§      §      §      §    §    §www.downer.co.nz§  §§§Downer New Zealand has a proud history that can be traced back to 1870, and today we are NZ’s leading provider of integrated services.  Our commitment is building long term relationships and supporting our customers with high calibre services and solutions.  The key to our success is our people who, on a day-to-day basis, they stand and deliver the company's core values of Excellence, Courage, Collaboration & Integrity across a diverse landscape of markets. We are proud of what we do, and that we support the well-being of the communities we work, live and play in.§Downer is a significant player in the telecommunications industry within New Zealand.  We are growing our business through delivering consistent service, excellence and results and through developing inspirational leadership with our people and customers.  We have an exciting opportunity for a Property Project Manager to join our team. §This is a key role delivering a programme of work for our Client involving project and maintenance work across a unique and diverse property portfolio. The work includes scoping and delivering a range of property related projects and as such, we are looking for an experienced Project Manager from a Building, Facilities or Asset Management background that can implement value adding solutions and deliver end to end from scoping through delivery and closeout.§To be successful in the role the right candidate need solid project management skills, an ability to influence subcontractors to meeting Downer high expectations in Health and Safety and Quality.  The role requires regional travel to lead from the front line and strong stakeholder relationships skills to work in a collaborative environment.   Naturally, you will have experience in delivery to contractual obligations and high levels of business acumen.§This is a 12 month fixed term contract and for the right candidate, we could potentially offer the flexibility of working part-time (3 days a week). §This is a busy position and requires a structured approach in order to build constructive relationships and prioritise workload. There will also be a high degree of autonomy and liaising with our clients and suppliers both internal and external to produce required outcomes while ensuring customer satisfaction to the highest level.§§Experience in Building Construction / Facilities Management or Building Services (electrical, HVAC, mechanical) engineering is an advantage§Demonstrated experience in operational leadership of a multi trade service delivery team§Experience driving operational activities to ensure quality is achieved, work completed to schedule and rework is minimised§Excellent written and oral communication skills and an ability to influence§Ability to analyse problems and make sound decisions in a timely manner based on objectives, risks, implications and cost§A strong track record that clearly demonstrates leadership behaviours that empower others§Have excellent verbal and written communication skills with a high literacy and numerical standard§Be computer literate with intermediate level Microsoft Office skills§Hold a Full NZ Driver’s Licence and undertake travel across NZ as required§Ability to work on the front line managing Subcontractors with a strong focus on Health and Safety.§Someone who works well in a team and can engage with Customer to represent Downer values.§§A role with us can enable you to develop and enhance your skills and experience.  This is a great opportunity for you to join our diverse and inclusive culture and be part of a great team thriving in a collaborative fast-paced environment.  We will reward you with a competitive remuneration package, flexible working arrangements, great training and ongoing development, and the opportunity to advance your career within our organisation. §If this sounds like the opportunity for you, head to www.downercareers.co.nz and enter reference number 574683 to apply.     §Downer NZ is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a diverse and inclusive culture.§Our workplaces are drug and alcohol free - all successful applicants will be required to undertake a Pre-Employment drug test and medical. §Due to the fast-paced nature of Downer, our vacancy close dates may be subject to change, so don't delay and make sure you apply as soon as possible. §§Please note we have an in-house recruitment team that manage all our vacancies. We have a workforce of more than 17,000 professionals who think differently, share great ideas and provide service excellence to their clients. § § § §Job Description§ §Due to continued growth, we are looking for a senior property professional to take a key leadership role in our Christchurch Real Estate Management team.§ §We are looking for an experienced and motivated professional with significant high-level experience to bring the latest thinking at an international level to the Christchurch market.§ §An immediate start is preferable.§ §Responsibilities§ § §Oversee and manage the operation of a portfolio managed by Colliers§ §Effectively manage a team§ §Proactively identify and secure new management and consultancy opportunities nationally§ §Provide strategic advice to clients§ §Drive profitability and develop and control budgets§ §Establish effective and enduring relationships with internal and external clients§ §Ensure best-practice processes are implemented§ § § §Qualifications§ § §Proven experience domestically, and preferably internationally, in retail and commercial management, development, and property advisory§ §Ability to think strategically and execute practical solutions§ §Strong business development and relationship building skills§ §Excellent verbal and written communication skills§ §Strong attention to detail and problem-solving skills§ §Strong client and service focus§ §Strong time management and organisation skills§ §A lateral thinker who can add value to the assets of our clients§ § § §Additional Information§ §Our enterprising culture empowers our people to do their best work, collaborating with our global experts to maximise every opportunity and lead the industry. For you, this means a world of opportunity and the platform to learn, grow and succeed.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50963131.txt	§Senior Development Manager - Strategic Urban Partnerships§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Development Manager - Strategic Urban Partnerships§§Advertiser: §Kainga Ora§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§16 Nov 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Real Estate & Property§, §Retail & Property Development§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Senior Development Manager - Strategic Urban Partnerships §      §        §          §Pre-construction focused; bring your feasibility and business case expertise§          §Be part of a high performing, highly engaged and innovative team§          §Competitive salary plus 5 weeks' annual leave and insurances§        §        §Mō mātou - Our Organisation§        §At Kāinga Ora, ours is the important responsibility of transforming New Zealand's housing choices, outcomes and the entire housing sector by creating homes and communities that allow New Zealanders to thrive.§        §What is exciting about working for Kāinga Ora is getting the chance to make a real and positive impact on New Zealanders' lives. With skills, planning and purposeful action, our people are creating the homes and neighbourhoods that will build Aotearoa's future. We are passionate about transforming New Zealand for the better. That includes being a trusted partner for Māori and iwi, protecting and enabling their rights, interests and aspirations under the guidance of Te Tiriti o Waitangi.§        §Ko tā mātou mahi - Our Role§        §As part of our exciting growth our Strategic Urban Partnerships team are now looking to welcome a Senior Development Manager to be based in Auckland.§        §The Strategic Urban Partnership team provide a commercial overview of new opportunities for Kāinga Ora's Urban Development programme. They are responsible for assessing the 'implimentability' of new urban development projects during the Initiation phase, in collaboration with the place based planning teams, particularly where partnerships with external stakeholders are necessary for Kāinga Ora to achieve its' strategic objectives around urban development, housing affordability and community social and economic development. The team also plays a key role in the implementation of cross-agency urban development initiatives such as the Urban Growth Partnership work programme.§        §As a Senior Development Manager you will be responsible for investigating and delivering on opportunities for the release of residential housing and land in support of the Governments Urban Growth Agenda. You will work collaboratively with other government agencies; local and regional government; business; industry sectors and iwi to deliver a work programme that Kāinga Ora can take forward to delivery.§        §Some of your key areas of responsibility will include:§        §          §Preparing and negotiating memorandum of understanding, property and commercial agreements around land opportunities§          §Managing the ongoing relationships between HUD, all of Crown, Local Government and key developers and private land owners§          §Leading the preparation and completion of the necessary inputs for successful business cases on development opportunities§          §Project feasibility, including financial modelling, project cost, delivery and value for money§          §Ensure delivery of services, products and programmes that actively support and contribute to the achievement of the Ministry's outcomes and that deliver to the needs of internal and external stakeholders.§        §        §Ngā pūmanawatanga ōu - What you will bring§        §In adding to your relevant tertiary qualification in Property Development, Property financing, Urban Planning, Project Management, Transport, Economics or other relevant discipline, significant (at least 8 years) development and property experience, and deep understanding of the development life cycle, you will also demonstrate:§        §          §Experience and understanding of relevant Government processes e.g. Public Finance Act, procurement, better business case§          §Creativity and innovation in structuring land or commercial transactions to create more value for all parties§          §Strong negotiation skills§          §Significant experience in managing relationships across a broad range of partners or stakeholders§          §Experience in identification and management of risk in a political environment§          §Ability to successfully manage and lead multiple concurrent projects of high complexity§          §Proven ability to develop trust and credibility at the executive level§          §Willingness to work in a flexible and dynamic environment.§        §        §Nōu te rourou - What's in it for you?§        §We offer competitive salaries, five weeks' annual leave and a benefits package including a range of insurances, flexible working arrangements and career development. These benefits are described in more detail here https://careers.kaingaora.govt.nz/a-great-place-to-work/benefits.§        §As a Kāinga Ora - Homes and Communities employee, we want to make sure that you have all the tools and support you need. We want to ensure you are healthy and have work-life balance. We also want to support and grow your personal and career development through on-the-job learning, training courses, secondments and study opportunities.§        §Ō Tātou Uara - Our Values§        §Our values were developed by us, for us. They unite us as an organisation and guide how we work every day. Our values are:§        §          §Manaakitanga§- People at the Heart§          §Mahi Tahi§- Better Together§          §Whanake§- Be Bold§        §        §Tūhono mai - Join us§        §To view the position description and apply for this role, please follow the online process via http://careers.kaingaora.govt.nz. Please note: all applicants, including existing employees, need to follow this process. We have a workforce of more than 17,000 professionals who think differently, share great ideas and provide service excellence to their clients. § § § §Job Description§ §We have an exciting opportunity for a Valuer to join our Valuation & Advisory Services team in our Hamilton office.§ §We are looking for a proactive and motivated graduate to assist with the delivery of timely and accurate valuation reports and ensure the provision of high standards of service to our clients.§ §Responsibilities§ § §Work towards becoming a Registered Valuer§ §Assist to prepare and provide timely and quality valuation and consultancy advice, reports, and quotations§ §Assist to assess current market values and properties§ §Assist to extract data and evidence for analysis§ §Establish and maintain strong relationships with internal and external clients§ §Provide high quality service to clients§ §Assist with the implementation and continuous improvement of systems, processes and initiatives§ §Update databases to ensure accurate information is maintained and readily available§ §Assist the wider Valuation & Advisory team as required§ § § §Qualifications§ § §Tertiary qualification in property to enable graduate membership of PINZ and NZIV§ §Basic industry knowledge of relevant property markets and willingness to learn§ §Strong written and verbal communication skills§ §Ability to build professional relationships with key internal and external stakeholders§ §Strong IT and Microsoft Office skills§ §Ability to work collaboratively and effectively in a team§ §Ability to multitask and prioritise in line with strategic objectives§ §Problem solving and analytical ability to generate information and reports that provide sound business decisions§ §Proactive with a desire to add value to the team§ § § §Additional Information§ §Our enterprising culture empowers our people to do their best work, collaborating with our global experts to maximise every opportunity and lead the industry. For you, this means a world of opportunity and the platform to learn, grow and succeed.§§§§

We work in partnership with individuals, communities, businesses and other public sector agencies to achieve our vision to have the trust and confidence of all. New Zealand Police has an extensive portfolio of police stations, offices, service centres, specialist facilities and houses across New Zealand that play a key part in delivering Police services.§        §As the Property Facilities - Contract Manager you will play a key part in enabling NZ Police to achieve their goals and visions through the proactive and efficient management of the property portfolio national contractors and associated contracts.§        §Having a holistic approach to this role will help manage the contract effectively and enable you to identify value. You will bring a positive attitude to the team and a willingness to find and embed continuous improvements.§        §This is a key role in the Property Team and NZ Police are excited to get someone on board who is bought in to the value they are wanting to deliver.§        §Key Responsibilities:§        §          §Ensure that compliance, scheduled and responsive maintenance contracts for Police property are effective and are adhered to within available funding§          §Leading day to day Property, Facilities and Contract Management§          §Build and maintain critical relationships effectively with the wider Police property team and our building occupants§          §Proactively manage effective contractor management across the Police property portfolio with regular reviews, development and implementation of Service Level Agreements and Key Performance measures§          §Develop strategies for negotiation with successful Property Contract tenderers§        §        §Key Requirements:§        §          §Sound Knowledge and experience in Contractor Management including financial management§          §Strong problem solving and interpersonal skills§          §A tertiary qualification in property, facilities Management, Risk Management or ability to demonstrate equivalent business experience§          §High level of competency with MS office Suite of programmes§        §        §NZ Police not only offer a collaborative and inclusive environment but are strong believers in flexibility and overall wellbeing. With opportunities to both challenge yourself and grow within the organisation, NZ Police is a great place to work in your next role.§        §Robert Walters endeavours to review all applications in a maximum of five working days. If you have not received correspondence within this timeframe please do not hesitate to contact Mitchell Butler on §04 471 9748§.§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§New Zealand Police is the lead agency responsible for reducing crime and enhancing community safety. We work in partnership with individuals, communities, businesses and other public sector agencies to achieve our vision to have the trust and confidence of all. New Zealand Police has an extensive portfolio of police stations, offices, service centres, specialist facilities and houses across New Zealand that play a key part in delivering Police services.§As the Property Facilities - Contract Manager you will play a key part in enabling NZ Police to achieve their goals and visions through the proactive and efficient management of the property portfolio national contractors and associated contracts.§Having a holistic approach to this role will help manage the contract effectively and enable you to identify value. You will bring a positive attitude to the team and a willingness to find and embed continuous improvements.§This is a key role in the Property Team and NZ Police are excited to get someone on board who is bought in to the value they are wanting to deliver.§Key Responsibilities:§Ensure that compliance, scheduled and responsive maintenance contracts for Police property are effective and are adhered to within available funding§Leading day to day Property, Facilities and Contract Management§Build and maintain critical relationships effectively with the wider Police property team and our building occupants§Proactively manage effective contractor management across the Police property portfolio with regular reviews, development and implementation of Service Level Agreements and Key Performance measures§Develop strategies for negotiation with successful Property Contract tenderers§Key Requirements:§Sound Knowledge and experience in Contractor Management including financial management§Strong problem solving and interpersonal skills§A tertiary qualification in property, facilities Management, Risk Management or ability to demonstrate equivalent business experience§High level of competency with MS office Suite of programmes§NZ Police not only offer a collaborative and inclusive environment but are strong believers in flexibility and overall wellbeing. With opportunities to both challenge yourself and grow within the organisation, NZ Police is a great place to work in your next role.§Robert Walters endeavours to review all applications in a maximum of five working days. jobText: TXT/50994815.txt	§Property Management Administrator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Property Management Administrator§§Advertiser: §NetYourJob§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§20 Nov 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Real Estate & Property§, §Administration§§§§§§Please Quote Reference Number 78051§§Property Management Administration Superstar wanted!§Opportunity to build a career in this exciting industry§Join the successful team at Ray White Morris & Co Property Management§We have a fantastic role for an energetic, capable, and highly organised admin superstar who has an interest in property, and who thrives in a busy supporting role.§Ideally you will have previous property management administration experience, however for the right candidate full training will be given.§You will be joining the Ray White Morris and Co Property Management team that is an all-inclusive friendly and supportive environment. We have a unique approach to our property management clientele, with a 'best for client' philosophy that encompasses all that we do.§Our Company culture is very important to us and therefore we are looking for an experienced administrator who will fit well with our work family. Someone who will celebrate the highs along with us and also knuckle down when it's needed. There is a lot to do and a lot about us so if this has interested you so far read on...§The role:§Supporting the Property Management team in addition to ensuring the office runs smoothly, some of the key tasks of this role will include:§Liaising with landlords, tenants, and contractors§Financial tasks including - Charging tenant debits/tenant invoices, Tracking recoverable expenses, Monthly Audits of all areas - including bonds, suspense account, recoverable expenses, etc.§Daily Banking and reconciliation§Creditor payments§Processing rental applications§Bond Lodgements§Owner Payments and month end processing§Answering in-coming property management phone calls and directing to the correct team member§As you can see, this role offers a lot of variety and is only a snapshot of what you will be involved in. To be successful you will need:§A high level of accuracy and numeracy competency§Be service orientated, courteous, friendly with all clients, and your colleagues§Demonstrate a strong desire to meet/exceed our needs.§Comfortable with variety and change in your day to day role.§Strong interpersonal skills, able to cope with demands from several directions with patience and tolerance.§Team orientated§A reliable, honest person who takes pride in their appearance and work detail.§Demonstrates strong written and verbal communication skills.§Excellent telephone manner.§The role will suit someone who enjoys juggling multiple priorities, a role where you will have ownership and autonomy while knowing your contribution is key to our company success.§If this sounds like a role that plays to your strengths then we want to hear from you today! Our team is passionate, dynamic and we enjoy having a lot fun.§Applications close 4th December, 2020§.§§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How would you rate your computer skills on a scale of 1-10?§How many years' experience do you have in an office administration / reception role?§What is your salary expectation for this role?§Do you have any property management experience?§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§
