jobText: TXT/50988679.txt	§Asset Specialist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Asset Specialist§§Advertiser: §Oranga Tamariki§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§19 Nov 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Real Estate & Property§, §Commercial Sales, Leasing & Property Mgmt§§§§§§Asset Specialist - Oranga Tamariki§Asset Specialist - Infrastructure team§Wellington or Auckland based, permanent§About us - Mō mātou§Oranga Tamariki - Ministry for Children is the Ministry that supports children and young people in New Zealand. Oranga Tamariki has a commitment to putting tamariki and rangatahi at the heart of what we do and works to advance the wellbeing and positive long-term outcomes of children and young people.§About the role - Mō te tūnga§The Infrastructure team of Oranga Tamariki is responsible for managing the property assets of the Ministry to ensure all those who work in and are cared for by Oranga Tamariki feel safe, secure and valued.§Reporting to the Infrastructure Manager, The Asset Specialist will be responsible for ensuring that the Ministry builds and maintains accurate property data and follows best industry practice. This role will partner with the Infrastructure team, Lease Specialist and wider team in assessing future needs of home, work and secure environments to ensure Infrastructure aligns with overarching Oranga Tamariki strategies to ensure better outcomes for our Tamariki.§What you will bring - Ngā pūmanawatanga ōu§Ability to demonstrate excellent asset management knowledge§Experience in lease transactions incorporating rent reviews and lease renewals§Experience in developing preventative maintenance programmes, condition surveys and asset registers§Proven ability developing property data analysis and reporting§Good communication and negotiation skills with the ability to communicate complex ideas to a variety of audiences and build and maintain rapport with others§Excellent organisational and problem-solving skills for working on a variety of duties§What's in it for you - Nōu te rourou§We offer a vibrant and supportive team, flexible work options and a genuine commitment to wellbeing. We welcome diversity and are committed to working in an inclusive and respectful way. This is your opportunity to apply your skills and experience to the wellbeing of Tamariki and Rangatahi. Come join us - Tūhono mai.§How to apply - Me pēhea te tuku tono§Apply online with your CV and cover letter. If you are an Oranga Tamariki employee already, please apply through your myHR portal. If you have any questions about role, please contact §Gaynor.Brymer@OT.govt.nz§Applications close on Thursday, 3 December 2020.§Click here to view the role description§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50988031.txt	§Property Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Property Manager§§Advertiser: §Dunedin Property Management§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§19 Nov 2020§§Location§§Otago§, §Dunedin§§Salary§§$50,000 base + car + phone + commission§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Real Estate & Property§, §Residential Leasing & Property Management§§§§§§We are looking for an experienced and professional Property Manager to join the founder to be the first employee of Dunedin Property Management. §We are growing fast and so the successful candidate needs to be flexible and adaptable to change.§The successful candidate will start with a small portfolio but will be responsible for the onboarding of new managements in an efficient manner.§This is an exciting opportunity for an experienced property manager to help build systems and procedures needed to grow a new property management company.§The role does not formally include BDM work but as a small team, flexibility will be needed and any referrals will be rewarded.§ §The successful candidate will:§have a minimum of 3 years property management experience based in Dunedin.§be confident, trustworthy, and able to work independently§be highly organised with strong attention to detail.§have a high level of personal presentation and professionalism.§have excellent interpersonal skills and able to build rapport with a wide range of people.§have excellent communication skills both written and verbal.§have a high level of personal integrity.§be an enthusiastic person with a “can-do” attitude.§have a full NZ Drivers Licence & a clean record.§ §The role involves:§daily communication with owners and tenants on all things related to their rental property.§marketing, applicant processing, and letting of all properties.§completion of all inspections and the preparation of inspection reports.§coordination and management of maintenance and repairs.§facilitating rent reviews and completing tenancy renewals.§keeping up to date with the RTA and the changes in relation to Healthy Homes Standards ensuring all legal obligations are met by both owner and tenant.§undertaking rent receipting, reconciliations, rent arrears, and 14 day breach notices§writing tribunal applications and submissions and attending court§various administration tasks using our property management software.§the creation of systems and processes as required and documenting them in an operations manual.§BENEFITS §As well as your salary and commission you will have use of a company car, and receive a mobile phone and laptop. We also provide more benefits:§Worklife balance§Whānau comes first. We offer flexibility and a supportive work environment. You will have access to an office but can also work from home as required or even adjust your work hours to meet your family needs.§Professional Development§We value professional development and will support you with training and attendance at conferences. We want you to grow into leadership roles as the company grows. §Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa. If you meet the above criteria and you're looking for a new challenge please apply today via the link below or contact me on 021 1814147 for a confidential discussion.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Do you have experience in an administration role?§How many years of residential property management experience do you have?§§§

Exceptional customer service will be paramount as you build relationships with our key clients.  Our team values of: Doing the right thing, People first, Being courageous and Fun and laughter ensures a happy, cohesive team environment.  §The key duties in managing your busy portfolio will be:§Ensuring properties are being well looked after and well maintained§Developing excellent rapport with both owners and tenants§Managing your time effectively§Following best practice processes§Experience in the Property Management industry is desirable however; not essential, as full training from our experienced team will be given. §Our super star will also have:§A positive attitude - no problem is too hard to overcome§Great organisational skills§Be well presented§A customer service focused attitude §Great negotiating skills§Have the maturity to understand the diversity of clients you will meet§Ability to remain calm under pressure§Good computer skills§Attention to detail§Excellent English written and oral communication skills§Some knowledge of property maintenance requirements§Clean drivers licence§No criminal history§A sense of humour and the ability to multi task would also be a real advantage§If you are a true professional and would like to join the Harcourts family we would love to hear from you. §Please apply through our online application form with your CV with a covering letter. §§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How would you rate your computer skills on a scale of 1-10?§What driver's licence do you hold?§Do you have any knowledge of property maintenance requirements?§What is your salary expectation for this role?§Please outline any previous Real Estate / Property Management experience you have:§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50990760.txt	§Commercial Property Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Commercial Property Manager§§Advertiser: §Tiaki Properties Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§20 Nov 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Real Estate & Property§, §Commercial Sales, Leasing & Property Mgmt§§§§§§Who We Are§A nationally recognised property development company. Our portfolio consists of properties in Dunedin, Queenstown, Christchurch and Napier. We are currently projecting growth of 30% year on year for the next 3-5 years. With a recent focus on commercial discipline we have made the decision to add to our Huadu Developments property team.§The Role§Key criteria and knowledge:§Preferred tertiary qualification ideally a Bachelor’s degree with emphasis in property or related subject§3 to 5 years’ experience in practical property management, development or asset management support, valuation or other related core commercial property discipline§Some experience in lease transactions incorporating rent reviews and lease renewals would be advantageous§A passion for real estate with a good understanding of property fundamentals and a knowledge of market trends§Self-motivated with ability to work autonomous on a variety of portfolio management duties§A proactive approach to embrace new challenges outside of core property management§Your responsibilities may include:§Tactical level property management with an overarching objective of ensuring the portfolio performs at its peak with maximised occupancy.§Planning and budgeting on all building expenditure and revenue§Negotiate and administer rent reviews and assist the Asset Manager with lease renewals and transactions§Maximising total returns through the analysis of property maintenance efficiencies, refurbishments and identifying opportunities for improved performance§Supporting on acquisition, divestment and due diligence initiatives§Other works arranged by leader§This is a fantastic opportunity for someone to break away from the pack and immerse themselves in a new challenge. You will be able to carve out your own career path while delivering iconic projects with an energetic and ambitious wider team.§Applicants for this position should be NZ citizen/PR or have a valid NZ work visa.§§If you are a passionate and talented person relishes the idea of becoming part of our big family then come to join our team! You can also send your CV to §§HR@huaduinternational.nz§§.§§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a commercial property manager?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§How many years' experience do you have as a leasing consultant?§§§

jobTitle: Real Estate Salesperson Job in Canterbury - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50990908.txt	§Real Estate Salesperson§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Real Estate Salesperson§§Advertiser: §MedCapital§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§20 Nov 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Salary§§OTE $200k +§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Real Estate & Property§, §Residential Sales§§§§§§IMPORTANT:  Please apply for this vacancy through our medworld online portal.  To do this, you will need to copy and paste the below link into your browser.§  §https://medworld.bamboohr.com/jobs/view.php?id=52&source=aWQ9Nw%3D%3D§  §Who are we?§ §We believe ambitious people are failing to realise their true potential and this is because they lack the financial know-how and strategy to achieve their goals.   §  §This is an exciting opportunity for an energetic licensed Real Estate Salesperson wanting to work alongside an experienced Financial Advice team to deliver property as part of a holistic financial management strategy.  §  §Why are we different?§ §We provide a broad range of advice.§ Our client offering extends to investment (including property) advice, insurance advice and mortgage advice. §   § §We invest in lead generation.§ We have developed two strong lead generation models that source the most suitable clients for our niche advice models.  The key success criteria for this role is your ability to positively and confidently influence clients and manage a robust sales process. § §Where are we going?§ §We know what it takes to be successful.  Our group company is led by one of New Zealand’s most successful entrepreneurs and one of our brands has been awarded a Deloitte Fast 50 title.  We’re following in these footsteps and quickly making our mark as the leading financial advisory business in Australasia that clients trust and rely on to manage all aspects of their finances. §  §What’s the role?§ §The Real Estate Salesperson’s primary objective is to convert opportunities uncovered by our Private Wealth team into revenue. §  §Some of the main tasks include:§ § §Work alongside our experienced financial advice team§ §Present house & land (turnkey) properties to clients§ §Prepare and complete Sale and Purchase Agreements and other required compliance§ §Update clients and other stakeholders throughout the sales process§ §Work with developers to source and maintain a suitable stock list§ §Liaise with property managers to facilitate appraisals and tenants§ §Work alongside our licensed Agent whose license you will operate under.§ §Our clients are in different locations across New Zealand, so many of the meetings you will have will be via video conference. §  §Who are you?§ §First and foremost, you must currently have (or have recently held and are willing to renew) a real estate sales license. §  §You will also be able to demonstrate the following:§ § §Experience selling residential property, in particular new build homes, house & land packages and turnkey properties§ §Familiar with real estate markets across New Zealand§ §A proven track record of achieving revenue targets§ §Superior negotiation and sales skills§ §Highly developed influencing abilities§ §Experience managing a pipeline of clients and stakeholders with multiple tasks & deadlines§ §Strong relationship building skills§ §The ability to adapt to change§ §Team player and extremely well-honed self-management habits.§ §What are we like?§ §This company is striving to be a destination workplace.  We believe that every single person is integral to our incredible success.  We work hard and are laser focussed on what we are working to achieve.  Other people have told us that we work at a faster pace than those around us and are more innovative than most.  We know that not everyone wants to play at this level but those that do relish the challenge.§  §What to do next:§ §If you jobText: TXT/50990379.txt	§Real Estate Sales: Looking for a lifestyle change?§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Real Estate Sales: Looking for a lifestyle change?§§Advertiser: §NetYourJob§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§19 Nov 2020§§Location§§Northland§, §Rest of Northland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Real Estate & Property§, §Residential Sales§§§§§§Kerikeri, Bay of Islands, Full Time, Real Estate Sales§Please Quote Reference Number 77927§§Seeking more of a work life balance?§Join our local friendly team at Ray White Kerikeri§We're interested in all levels of Real Estate Sales experience§Situated in the beautiful Bay of Islands, Ray White Kerikeri is one of the longest established Real Estate companies in the region. As part of the Ray White network we have one of the best opportunities for international, national and local exposure for real estate in New Zealand.  Yet we have the flexibility of being a small locally owned and operated business and part of a family, small and large.  The best of both worlds.§We currently have an exciting opportunity for a §Real Estate Salesperson§ to join our growing team.§We don't mind if you are REA licensed and experienced or considering a career in Real Estate - if you have a good work ethic, a passion for success and the ability to learn new skills, we would love to speak to you!§We're looking for people who are§:§Friendly and personable with a sense of humour§Professional with a good attitude§Computer literate§Able to communicate via phone and email in a professional and literate manner§Prepared to commit full time as a Real Estate Salesperson§Experienced in sales (or at least in dealing with the public)§As part of the Ray White Kerikeri team, you'll enjoy§:§A long term stable working environment in a supportive team culture with an emphasis on sharing§A powerful and unique team with a strong community focus§Initial and ongoing training and support with on-demand training and mentoring sessions at any time§Sales & Auction programmes§The opportunity to build off our established and well respected local, national and international brand§Leading edge communication, marketing and management systems plus up-to-the minute technological  advancements§Attractive base commission rates with bonus incentive scheme§A high level of administration support§Help to build your profile and maintain it§Growth potential opportunity§Listing leads through the Ray White network and large established Ray White Kerikeri Property Management business§Business insights and recognition awards.§If you're ready to talk further about your future with us, APPLY through our online application form and see your career prosper!§Any applications or enquiries will be treated in strictest confidence.§§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§Do you have your own transport? (Please answer: YES or NO)§Do you hold a current Real Estate licence? (Please answer: YES or NO)§Outline your personal Sales / Real Estate experience and why you would be a top performing Real Estate Salesperson:§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50979434.txt	§Facilities Manager - Tahuna Beach Kiwi Holiday Park & Motels§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Facilities Manager - Tahuna Beach Kiwi Holiday Park & Motels§§Advertiser: §Intepeople Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§18 Nov 2020§§Location§§Tasman§, §Nelson§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Real Estate & Property§, §Body Corporate & Facilities Management§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Facilities Manager - Tahuna Beach Kiwi Holiday Park & Motels §      §        §          §Based in extraordinary Nelson and located next to the stunning Tahunanui beach§          §Oversee all aspects of grounds, buildings, facilities and housekeeping §          §Combine your practical “handy person” and people leadership skills§        §        §Adjacent to the stunning Tahunanui Beach, the Tahuna Beach Kiwi Holiday Park & Motel is one of New Zealand’s most picturesque holiday accommodation and activity destinations.  One of the largest holiday parks in the Southern hemisphere, it has been the backdrop to collective holiday memories since 1926.  Spanning 54 acres with 600 campsites and 90 accommodation units, the Park is home to 100 long term residents and hosts up to 2,500 people in the peak season.  §Reporting to the General Manager, the Facilities Manager is responsible for managing and maintaining the buildings, facilities and grounds. This includes leadership of the Parks maintenance, housekeeping and security teams as well as external contractors and suppliers.  Partnering with the General Manager, you will develop and implement a maintenance plan that maximizes assets and ensures the Park’s facilities are maintained to the highest possible standard.  You will oversee all elements of health, safety, risk and compliance ensuring that guests and residents enjoy a happy, safe and memorable experience every step of the way.  A customer facing position, you’ll enjoy being out and about in the Park engaging with customers and contributing to the Parks vision of being the best holiday park in Australasia.  §We’re looking for a charismatic, motivational and decisive leader who can build a high performing team and a create a positive team culture.  You can demonstrate strong project management skills and experience managing maintenance schedules that improve and add value. A stickler for detail, you will have high standards, a focus on quality and always have the customer at the forefront.  §        §Well planned and pragmatic you think strategically and deliver tactically.  Not afraid to get your hands dirty, you may be a former ‘tradie’ or have an aptitude for fixing buildings and equipment.  In this dynamic environment you’ll need exceptional commercial, people and property/facilities management skills and experience within a relevant industry.  §While this is a Monday to Friday position, flexibility to work outside of these hours will be required. §This is an exceptional opportunity to have a major influence over the quality of the facilities of this iconic kiwi camping and holiday destination in one of the best spots in New Zealand.§        §View job description§Applications close Wednesday 2nd December 2020.§For further enquiries please contact Odette Shearer ph 021 2708657.§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§ §Based in extraordinary Nelson and located next to the stunning Tahunanui beach§ §Oversee all aspects of grounds, buildings, facilities and housekeeping § §Combine your practical “handy person” and people leadership skills§Adjacent to the stunning Tahunanui Beach, the Tahuna Beach Kiwi Holiday Park & Motel is one of New Zealand’s most picturesque holiday accommodation and activity destinations.  One of the largest holiday parks in the Southern hemisphere, it has been the backdrop to collective holiday memories since 1926.  Spanning 54 acres with 600 campsites and 90 accommodation units, the Park is home to 100 long term residents and hosts up to 2,500 people in the peak season.  §Reporting to the General Manager, the Facilities Manager is responsible for managing and maintaining the buildings, facilities and grounds. This includes leadership of the Parks maintenance, housekeeping and security teams as well as external contractors and suppliers.  Partnering with the General Manager, you will develop and implement a maintenance plan that maximizes assets and ensures the Park’s facilities are maintained to the highest possible standard.  You will oversee all elements of health, safety, risk and compliance ensuring that guests and residents enjoy a happy, safe and memorable experience every step of the way.  A customer facing position, you’ll enjoy being out and about in the Park engaging with customers and contributing to the Parks vision of being the best holiday park in Australasia.  §We’re looking for a charismatic, motivational and decisive leader who can build a high performing team and a create a positive team culture.  You can demonstrate strong project management skills and experience managing maintenance schedules that improve and add value. A stickler for detail, you will have high standards, a focus on quality and always have the customer at the forefront.  §Well planned and pragmatic you think strategically and deliver tactically.  Not afraid to get your hands dirty, you may be a former ‘tradie’ or have an aptitude for fixing buildings and equipment.  In this dynamic environment you’ll need exceptional commercial, people and property/facilities management skills and experience within a relevant industry.  §While this is a Monday to Friday position, flexibility to work outside of these hours will be required. §This is an exceptional opportunity to have a major influence over the quality of the facilities of this iconic kiwi camping and holiday destination in one of the best spots in New Zealand.§View job description§Applications close Wednesday 2nd December 2020.§For further enquiries please contact Odette Shearer ph 021 2708657.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Notice Period§Residency Status§Desired Region§Mobile Number§§§

jobText: TXT/50979927.txt	§Real Estate Sales§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Real Estate Sales§§Advertiser: §REAP Recruitment§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§18 Nov 2020§§Location§§Bay of Plenty§, §Tauranga§§Salary§§FIRST NATIONAL TAURANGA§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Real Estate & Property§, §Residential Sales§§§§§§§§§  §    §      §Real Estate Sales §    §    §      §        §First National is a family owned and operated business and have built their business on honesty, integrity and great service, enjoying consistent repeat business because they deliver to their clients.  They are looking for the next Real Estate Professional and are interested in hearing from new Sales People or established Sales People wanting to start a career or just looking for a change in Real Estate and want to see what First National can offer their business.  §  § As a progressive, internationally recognised Real Estate brand they provide a winning environment that their salespeople thrive in. jobTitle: Senior Aquatics Facilities Specialist Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50981321.txt	§Senior Aquatics Facilities Specialist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Aquatics Facilities Specialist§§Advertiser: §Auckland Council§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§18 Nov 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Real Estate & Property§, §Body Corporate & Facilities Management§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Senior Aquatics Facilities Specialist §      §        §•  Full-time permanent role in our new Aquatic Team§•  Showcase aquatic, dry side facilities & water feature subject matter expertise§•  Be involved in new capital works and renewals projects§        §He angitūtanga: The opportunity§        §Community Facilities provides world-class open space, building, and aquatic facilities that are financially considered and deliver on Auckland's expectations and aspirations. As kaitiaki (guardian) of facilities, we have an important role in facilitating the wider social, economic, environmental, and cultural outcomes that promote the wellbeing of our communities. Be part of a dedicated regional aquatic facilities team that manages the largest swimming pool and water feature portfolio in New Zealand. This team is a centre of excellence accountable for effective management of the council's swimming pool and water feature plant assets (26 pool sites, including any adjoining dry side facilities, and 70 water feature sites).§        §This is one of those opportunities that does not come around very often. As a §Senior Aquatic Facilities Specialist,§ you will coordinate the day to day delivery of a high performing maintenance service to all swimming pools (including any dry side facilities) and water feature plant assets in one of five specific areas of Auckland through excellent contractor management and communications. §        § §        §You will be the first point of contact for all maintenance enquiries in one of the five specified areas. You will lead project teams to plan, co-ordinate, and deliver a programme of swimming pool maintenance shutdowns projects. You will be assigned medium complexity new capital works and renewals projects (including renewal planning and minor project delivery) to which you will apply best practice project management principles, techniques, and systems. You will be a subject matter expert for all enquiries for Council owned swimming pools (including any dry side facilities) and water feature plant assets across a specific area.§        § §        §He kōrero mōu: About you§        §To be successful in this role you will have substantial experience (7+ years) in both operational maintenance and capital works project including renewal delivery involving swimming pools and/or dry side facilities. Demonstrated training to meet NZ Standard Pool Water Quality (NZS 5826:2010) or recognised prior learning along with an understanding of NZS4441:2008 Swimming Pool Design Standard is preferred. It goes without saying that you will have a good understanding of construction site monitoring, including a good understanding of Health and Safety.§        § §        §Ngā āhuatanga kei a mātou: What we offer§ §        §We will offer you a career-enhancing opportunity, competitive remuneration, and to be part of Auckland’s meaningful history. You will be part of a team that is passionate about what we do. Working 40 hours per week; you will have some flexibility with how those hours are set.§        §If you are high performing, passionate about Auckland and the world around you, and would like the chance to facilitate making tangible and visible improvements to our environment, then join us. Apply today (telling us why you are interested in and right for this opportunity) by cover letter along with your CV. If you are an internal candidate (not a temp or contractor), please apply via Tupu.§ §        §Applications close Sunday, 6 December 2020 § §        §You will be required to have a valid NZ driver's licence due to the nature of the position where you will be required to regularly travel to various Community Facility sites across the Auckland region.§ §        §This role is deemed safety-sensitive and in line with Auckland Council policy, you will be required to complete pre-employment drug & alcohol testing.§ §        §Applications close 6th of December 2020§        §Band G§        §Auckland Council is an equal opportunity employer (EOE) and we are committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity and inclusion. If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us at the time of application to assist you through the recruitment process.§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§•  Full-time permanent role in our new Aquatic Team§•  Showcase aquatic, dry side facilities & water feature subject matter expertise§•  Be involved in new capital works and renewals projects§He angitūtanga: The opportunity§Community Facilities provides world-class open space, building, and aquatic facilities that are financially considered and deliver on Auckland's expectations and aspirations. As kaitiaki (guardian) of facilities, we have an important role in facilitating the wider social, economic, environmental, and cultural outcomes that promote the wellbeing of our communities. Be part of a dedicated regional aquatic facilities team that manages the largest swimming pool and water feature portfolio in New Zealand. This team is a centre of excellence accountable for effective management of the council's swimming pool and water feature plant assets (26 pool sites, including any adjoining dry side facilities, and 70 water feature sites).§This is one of those opportunities that does not come around very often. As a §Senior Aquatic Facilities Specialist,§ you will coordinate the day to day delivery of a high performing maintenance service to all swimming pools (including any dry side facilities) and water feature plant assets in one of five specific areas of Auckland through excellent contractor management and communications. § §You will be the first point of contact for all maintenance enquiries in one of the five specified areas. You will lead project teams to plan, co-ordinate, and deliver a programme of swimming pool maintenance shutdowns projects. You will be assigned medium complexity new capital works and renewals projects (including renewal planning and minor project delivery) to which you will apply best practice project management principles, techniques, and systems. You will be a subject matter expert for all enquiries for Council owned swimming pools (including any dry side facilities) and water feature plant assets across a specific area.§ §He kōrero mōu: About you§To be successful in this role you will have substantial experience (7+ years) in both operational maintenance and capital works project including renewal delivery involving swimming pools and/or dry side facilities. Demonstrated training to meet NZ Standard Pool Water Quality (NZS 5826:2010) or recognised prior learning along with an understanding of NZS4441:2008 Swimming Pool Design Standard is preferred. It goes without saying that you will have a good understanding of construction site monitoring, including a good understanding of Health and Safety.§ §Ngā āhuatanga kei a mātou: What we offer§ §We will offer you a career-enhancing opportunity, competitive remuneration, and to be part of Auckland’s meaningful history. You will be part of a team that is passionate about what we do. Working 40 hours per week; you will have some flexibility with how those hours are set.§If you are high performing, passionate about Auckland and the world around you, and would like the chance to facilitate making tangible and visible improvements to our environment, then join us. Apply today (telling us why you are interested in and right for this opportunity) by cover letter along with your CV. If you are an internal candidate (not a temp or contractor), please apply via Tupu.§ §Applications close Sunday, 6 December 2020 § §You will be required to have a valid NZ driver's licence due to the nature of the position where you will be required to regularly travel to various Community Facility sites across the Auckland region.§ §This role is deemed safety-sensitive and in line with Auckland Council policy, you will be required to complete pre-employment drug & alcohol testing.§ §Applications close 6th of December 2020§§Band G§Auckland Council is an equal opportunity employer (EOE) and we are committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity and inclusion.
